Psa 21:12 Instead, you will put them to flight when you aim your bow at their faces. 
Psa 21:13 Be exalted, LORD, in Your strength; we will sing and praise Your might.
Psa 22:1 [For the choir director: according to "The Deer of the Dawn." A Davidic psalm.] My God, my God, why have You forsaken me? Why are You so far from my deliverance and from my words of groaning? 
Psa 22:2 My God, I cry by day, but You do not answer, by night, yet I have no rest. 
Psa 22:3 But You are holy, enthroned on the praises of Israel. 
Psa 22:4 Our fathers trusted in You; they trusted, and You rescued them. 
Psa 22:5 They cried to You and were set free; they trusted in You and were not disgraced. 
Psa 22:6 But I am a worm and not a man, scorned by men and despised by people. 
Psa 22:7 Everyone who sees me mocks me; they sneer and shake their heads: 
Psa 22:8 "He relies on the LORD; let Him rescue him; let the LORD deliver him, since He takes pleasure in him." 
Psa 22:9 You took me from the womb, making me secure while at my mother's breast. 
Psa 22:10 I was given over to You at birth; You have been my God from my mother's womb. 
Psa 22:11 Do not be far from me, because distress is near and there is no one to help.
Psa 22:12 Many bulls surround me; strong ones of Bashan encircle me. 
Psa 22:13 They open their mouths against me-- lions, mauling and roaring.
Psa 22:14 I am poured out like water, and all my bones are disjointed; my heart is like wax, melting within me.
Psa 22:15 My strength is dried up like baked clay; my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth. You put me into the dust of death. 
Psa 22:16 For dogs have surrounded me; a gang of evildoers has closed in on me; they pierced my hands and my feet. 
Psa 22:17 I can count all my bones; people look and stare at me. 
Psa 22:18 They divided my garments among themselves, and they cast lots for my clothing. 
Psa 22:19 But You, LORD, don't be far away. My strength, come quickly to help me. 
Psa 22:20 Deliver my life from the sword, my only life from the power of these dogs. 
Psa 22:21 Save me from the mouth of the lion! You have rescued me from the horns of the wild oxen. 
Psa 22:22 I will proclaim Your name to my brothers; I will praise You in the congregation. 
Psa 22:23 You who fear Yahweh, praise Him! All you descendants of Jacob, honor Him! All you descendants of Israel, revere Him!
Psa 22:24 For He has not despised or detested the torment of the afflicted. He did not hide His face from him but listened when he cried to Him for help. 
Psa 22:25 I will give praise in the great congregation because of You; I will fulfill my vows before those who fear You. 
Psa 22:26 The humble will eat and be satisfied; those who seek the LORD will praise Him. May your hearts live forever! 
Psa 22:27 All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the LORD. All the families of the nations will bow down before You, 
Psa 22:28 for kingship belongs to the LORD; He rules over the nations. 
Psa 22:29 All who prosper on earth will eat and bow down; all those who go down to the dust will kneel before Him-- even the one who cannot preserve his life.
Psa 22:30 Their descendants will serve Him; the next generation will be told about the Lord. 
Psa 22:31 They will come and tell a people yet to be born about His righteousness-- what He has done.
Psa 23:1 [A Davidic psalm.] The LORD is my shepherd; there is nothing I lack. 
Psa 23:2 He lets me lie down in green pastures; He leads me beside quiet waters. 
Psa 23:3 He renews my life; He leads me along the right paths for His name's sake. 
Psa 23:4 Even when I go through the darkest valley, I fear no danger, for You are with me; Your rod and Your staff-- they comfort me.
Psa 23:5 You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies; You anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows. 
Psa 23:6 Only goodness and faithful love will pursue me all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the house of the LORD as long as I live.
Psa 24:1 [A Davidic psalm.] The earth and everything in it, the world and its inhabitants, belong to the LORD; 
Psa 24:2 for He laid its foundation on the seas and established it on the rivers. 
Psa 24:3 Who may ascend the mountain of the LORD? Who may stand in His holy place? 
Psa 24:4 The one who has clean hands and a pure heart, who has not set his mind on what is false, and who has not sworn deceitfully. 
Psa 24:5 He will receive blessing from the LORD, and righteousness from the God of his salvation. 
Psa 24:6 Such is the generation of those who seek Him, who seek the face of the God of Jacob. [Selah] 
Psa 24:7 Lift up your heads, you gates! Rise up, ancient doors! Then the King of glory will come in.
Psa 24:8 Who is this King of glory? The LORD, strong and mighty, the LORD, mighty in battle. 
Psa 24:9 Lift up your heads, you gates! Rise up, ancient doors! Then the King of glory will come in.
Psa 24:10 Who is He, this King of glory? The LORD of Hosts, He is the King of glory.[Selah]
Psa 25:1 [Davidic.] LORD, I turn to You. 
Psa 25:2 My God, I trust in You. Do not let me be disgraced; do not let my enemies gloat over me.
Psa 25:3 No one who waits for You will be disgraced; those who act treacherously without cause will be disgraced. 
Psa 25:4 Make Your ways known to me, LORD; teach me Your paths. 
Psa 25:5 Guide me in Your truth and teach me, for You are the God of my salvation; I wait for You all day long. 
Psa 25:6 Remember, LORD, Your compassion and Your faithful love, for they have existed from antiquity. 
Psa 25:7 Do not remember the sins of my youth or my acts of rebellion; in keeping with Your faithful love, remember me because of Your goodness, LORD. 
Psa 25:8 The LORD is good and upright; therefore He shows sinners the way. 
Psa 25:9 He leads the humble in what is right and teaches them His way.
Psa 25:10 All the LORD's ways show faithful love and truth to those who keep His covenant and decrees. 
Psa 25:11 Because of Your name, Yahweh, forgive my sin, for it is great. 
Psa 25:12 Who is the man who fears the LORD? He will show him the way he should choose. 
Psa 25:13 He will live a good life, and his descendants will inherit the land. 
Psa 25:14 The secret counsel of the LORD is for those who fear Him, and He reveals His covenant to them.
Psa 25:15 My eyes are always on the LORD, for He will pull my feet out of the net. 
Psa 25:16 Turn to me and be gracious to me, for I am alone and afflicted. 
Psa 25:17 The distresses of my heart increase; bring me out of my sufferings. 
Psa 25:18 Consider my affliction and trouble, and take away all my sins. 
Psa 25:19 Consider my enemies; they are numerous, and they hate me violently. 
Psa 25:20 Guard me and deliver me; do not let me be put to shame, for I take refuge in You. 
Psa 25:21 May integrity and what is right watch over me, for I wait for You. 
Psa 25:22 God, redeem Israel, from all its distresses.
Psa 26:1 [Davidic.] Vindicate me, LORD, because I have lived with integrity and have trusted in the LORD without wavering. 
Psa 26:2 Test me, LORD, and try me; examine my heart and mind. 
Psa 26:3 For Your faithful love is before my eyes, and I live by Your truth. 
Psa 26:4 I do not sit with the worthless or associate with hypocrites.
Psa 26:5 I hate a crowd of evildoers, and I do not sit with the wicked. 
Psa 26:6 I wash my hands in innocence and go around Your altar, LORD, 
Psa 26:7 raising my voice in thanksgiving and telling about Your wonderful works. 
Psa 26:8 LORD, I love the house where You dwell, the place where Your glory resides. 
Psa 26:9 Do not destroy me along with sinners, or my life along with men of bloodshed 
Psa 26:10 in whose hands are evil schemes and whose right hands are filled with bribes. 
Psa 26:11 But I live with integrity; redeem me and be gracious to me. 
Psa 26:12 My foot stands on level ground; I will praise the LORD in the assemblies.
Psa 27:1 [Davidic.] The LORD is my light and my salvation-- whom should I fear? The LORD is the stronghold of my life-- of whom should I be afraid?
Psa 27:2 When evildoers came against me to devour my flesh, my foes and my enemies stumbled and fell. 
Psa 27:3 Though an army deploys against me, my heart is not afraid; though a war breaks out against me, still I am confident. 
Psa 27:4 I have asked one thing from the LORD; it is what I desire: to dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, gazing on the beauty of the LORD and seeking Him in His temple. 
Psa 27:5 For He will conceal me in His shelter in the day of adversity; He will hide me under the cover of His tent; He will set me high on a rock. 
Psa 27:6 Then my head will be high above my enemies around me; I will offer sacrifices in His tent with shouts of joy. I will sing and make music to the LORD. 
Psa 27:7 LORD, hear my voice when I call; be gracious to me and answer me. 
Psa 27:8 My heart says this about You, "You are to seek My face." LORD, I will seek Your face. 
Psa 27:9 Do not hide Your face from me; do not turn Your servant away in anger. You have been my helper; do not leave me or abandon me, God of my salvation. 
Psa 27:10 Even if my father and mother abandon me, the LORD cares for me. 
Psa 27:11 Because of my adversaries, show me Your way, LORD, and lead me on a level path. 
Psa 27:12 Do not give me over to the will of my foes, for false witnesses rise up against me, breathing violence. 
Psa 27:13 I am certain that I will see the LORD's goodness in the land of the living. 
Psa 27:14 Wait for the LORD; be strong and courageous. Wait for the LORD.
Psa 28:1 [Davidic.] LORD, I call to You; my rock, do not be deaf to me. If You remain silent to me, I will be like those going down to the Pit. 
Psa 28:2 Listen to the sound of my pleading when I cry to You for help, when I lift up my hands toward Your holy sanctuary. 
Psa 28:3 Do not drag me away with the wicked, with the evildoers, who speak in friendly ways with their neighbors while malice is in their hearts. 
Psa 28:4 Repay them according to what they have done-- according to the evil of their deeds. Repay them according to the work of their hands; give them back what they deserve.
Psa 28:5 Because they do not consider what the LORD has done or the work of His hands, He will tear them down and not rebuild them. 
Psa 28:6 May the LORD be praised, for He has heard the sound of my pleading. 
Psa 28:7 The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in Him, and I am helped. Therefore my heart rejoices, and I praise Him with my song. 
Psa 28:8 The LORD is the strength of His people; He is a stronghold of salvation for His anointed. 
Psa 28:9 Save Your people, bless Your possession, shepherd them, and carry them forever.
Psa 29:1 [A Davidic psalm.] Ascribe to Yahweh, you heavenly beings, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength. 
Psa 29:2 Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due His name; worship Yahweh in the splendor of His holiness. 
Psa 29:3 The voice of the LORD is above the waters. The God of glory thunders-- the LORD, above vast waters,
Psa 29:4 the voice of the LORD in power, the voice of the LORD in splendor. 
Psa 29:5 The voice of the LORD breaks the cedars; the LORD shatters the cedars of Lebanon. 
Psa 29:6 He makes Lebanon skip like a calf, and Sirion, like a young wild ox. 
Psa 29:7 The voice of the LORD flashes flames of fire. 
Psa 29:8 The voice of the LORD shakes the wilderness; the LORD shakes the wilderness of Kadesh. 
Psa 29:9 The voice of the LORD makes the deer give birth and strips the woodlands bare. In His temple all cry, "Glory!" 
Psa 29:10 The LORD sat enthroned at the flood; the LORD sits enthroned, King forever.
Psa 29:11 The LORD gives His people strength; the LORD blesses His people with peace.
Psa 30:1 [A psalm; a dedication song for the house. Davidic.] I will exalt You, LORD, because You have lifted me up and have not allowed my enemies to triumph over me. 
Psa 30:2 LORD my God, I cried to You for help, and You healed me. 
Psa 30:3 LORD, You brought me up from Sheol; You spared me from among those going down to the Pit. 
Psa 30:4 Sing to Yahweh, you His faithful ones, and praise His holy name. 
Psa 30:5 For His anger lasts only a moment, but His favor, a lifetime. Weeping may spend the night, but there is joy in the morning. 
Psa 30:6 When I was secure, I said, "I will never be shaken." 
Psa 30:7 LORD, when You showed Your favor, You made me stand like a strong mountain; when You hid Your face, I was terrified. 
Psa 30:8 LORD, I called to You; I sought favor from my Lord: 
Psa 30:9 "What gain is there in my death, if I go down to the Pit? Will the dust praise You? Will it proclaim Your truth? 
Psa 30:10 LORD, listen and be gracious to me; LORD, be my helper." 
Psa 30:11 You turned my lament into dancing; You removed my sackcloth and clothed me with gladness, 
Psa 30:12 so that I can sing to You and not be silent. LORD my God, I will praise You forever.
Psa 31:1 [For the choir director. A Davidic psalm.] LORD, I seek refuge in You; let me never be disgraced. Save me by Your righteousness. 
Psa 31:2 Listen closely to me; rescue me quickly. Be a rock of refuge for me, a mountain fortress to save me. 
Psa 31:3 For You are my rock and my fortress; You lead and guide me because of Your name. 
Psa 31:4 You will free me from the net that is secretly set for me, for You are my refuge. 
Psa 31:5 Into Your hand I entrust my spirit; You redeem me, LORD, God of truth. 
Psa 31:6 I hate those who are devoted to worthless idols, but I trust in the LORD. 
Psa 31:7 I will rejoice and be glad in Your faithful love because You have seen my affliction. You have known the troubles of my life 
Psa 31:8 and have not handed me over to the enemy. You have set my feet in a spacious place. 
Psa 31:9 Be gracious to me, LORD, because I am in distress; my eyes are worn out from angry sorrow-- my whole being as well.
Psa 31:10 Indeed, my life is consumed with grief and my years with groaning; my strength has failed because of my sinfulness, and my bones waste away. 
Psa 31:11 I am ridiculed by all my adversaries and even by my neighbors. I am dreaded by my acquaintances; those who see me in the street run from me. 
Psa 31:12 I am forgotten: gone from memory like a dead person-- like broken pottery.
Psa 31:13 I have heard the gossip of many; terror is on every side. When they conspired against me, they plotted to take my life. 
Psa 31:14 But I trust in You, LORD; I say, "You are my God." 
Psa 31:15 The course of my life is in Your power; deliver me from the power of my enemies and from my persecutors. 
Psa 31:16 Show Your favor to Your servant; save me by Your faithful love. 
Psa 31:17 LORD, do not let me be disgraced when I call on You. Let the wicked be disgraced; let them be silent in Sheol. 
Psa 31:18 Let lying lips be quieted; they speak arrogantly against the righteous with pride and contempt. 
Psa 31:19 How great is Your goodness that You have stored up for those who fear You and accomplished in the sight of everyone for those who take refuge in You. 
Psa 31:20 You hide them in the protection of Your presence; You conceal them in a shelter from the schemes of men, from quarrelsome tongues. 
Psa 31:21 May the LORD be praised, for He has wonderfully shown His faithful love to me in a city under siege. 
Psa 31:22 In my alarm I had said, "I am cut off from Your sight." But You heard the sound of my pleading when I cried to You for help. 
Psa 31:23 Love the LORD, all His faithful ones. The LORD protects the loyal, but fully repays the arrogant. 
Psa 31:24 Be strong and courageous, all you who put your hope in the LORD.
Psa 32:1 [Davidic. A Maskil.] How joyful is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered! 
Psa 32:2 How joyful is the man the LORD does not charge with sin and in whose spirit is no deceit! 
Psa 32:3 When I kept silent, my bones became brittle from my groaning all day long. 
Psa 32:4 For day and night Your hand was heavy on me; my strength was drained as in the summer's heat. [Selah] 
Psa 32:5 Then I acknowledged my sin to You and did not conceal my iniquity. I said, "I will confess my transgressions to the LORD," and You took away the guilt of my sin.[Selah] 
Psa 32:6 Therefore let everyone who is faithful pray to You at a time that You may be found. When great floodwaters come, they will not reach him. 
Psa 32:7 You are my hiding place; You protect me from trouble. You surround me with joyful shouts of deliverance.[Selah] 
Psa 32:8 I will instruct you and show you the way to go; with My eye on you, I will give counsel. 
Psa 32:9 Do not be like a horse or mule, without understanding, that must be controlled with bit and bridle or else it will not come near you. 
Psa 32:10 Many pains come to the wicked, but the one who trusts in the LORD will have faithful love surrounding him. 
Psa 32:11 Be glad in the LORD and rejoice, you righteous ones; shout for joy, all you upright in heart. 
Psa 33:1 Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous ones; praise from the upright is beautiful. 
Psa 33:2 Praise the LORD with the lyre; make music to Him with a ten-stringed harp. 
Psa 33:3 Sing a new song to Him; play skillfully on the strings, with a joyful shout. 
Psa 33:4 For the word of the LORD is right, and all His work is trustworthy. 
Psa 33:5 He loves righteousness and justice; the earth is full of the LORD's unfailing love. 
Psa 33:6 The heavens were made by the word of the LORD, and all the stars, by the breath of His mouth. 
Psa 33:7 He gathers the waters of the sea into a heap; He puts the depths into storehouses. 
Psa 33:8 Let the whole earth tremble before the LORD; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him. 
Psa 33:9 For He spoke, and it came into being; He commanded, and it came into existence. 
Psa 33:10 The LORD frustrates the counsel of the nations; He thwarts the plans of the peoples. 
Psa 33:11 The counsel of the LORD stands forever, the plans of His heart from generation to generation. 
Psa 33:12 Happy is the nation whose God is Yahweh-- the people He has chosen to be His own possession!
Psa 33:13 The LORD looks down from heaven; He observes everyone. 
Psa 33:14 He gazes on all the inhabitants of the earth from His dwelling place. 
Psa 33:15 He alone shapes their hearts; He considers all their works. 
Psa 33:16 A king is not saved by a large army; a warrior will not be delivered by great strength. 
Psa 33:17 The horse is a false hope for safety; it provides no escape by its great power. 
Psa 33:18 Now the eye of the LORD is on those who fear Him-- those who depend on His faithful love
Psa 33:19 to deliver them from death and to keep them alive in famine. 
Psa 33:20 We wait for Yahweh; He is our help and shield. 
Psa 33:21 For our hearts rejoice in Him because we trust in His holy name. 
Psa 33:22 May Your faithful love rest on us, Yahweh, for we put our hope in You.
Psa 34:1 [Concerning David, when he pretended to be insane in the presence of Abimelech, who drove him out, and he departed.] I will praise the LORD at all times; His praise will always be on my lips. 
Psa 34:2 I will boast in the LORD; the humble will hear and be glad. 
Psa 34:3 Proclaim Yahweh's greatness with me; let us exalt His name together. 
Psa 34:4 I sought the LORD, and He answered me and delivered me from all my fears. 
Psa 34:5 Those who look to Him are radiant with joy; their faces will never be ashamed. 
Psa 34:6 This poor man cried, and the LORD heard him and saved him from all his troubles. 
Psa 34:7 The Angel of the LORD encamps around those who fear Him, and rescues them. 
Psa 34:8 Taste and see that the LORD is good. How happy is the man who takes refuge in Him! 
Psa 34:9 You who are His holy ones, fear Yahweh, for those who fear Him lack nothing. 
Psa 34:10 Young lions lack food and go hungry, but those who seek the LORD will not lack any good thing. 
Psa 34:11 Come, children, listen to me; I will teach you the fear of the LORD. 
Psa 34:12 Who is the man who delights in life, loving a long life to enjoy what is good? 
Psa 34:13 Keep your tongue from evil and your lips from deceitful speech. 
Psa 34:14 Turn away from evil and do what is good; seek peace and pursue it. 
Psa 34:15 The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous, and His ears are open to their cry for help. 
Psa 34:16 The face of the LORD is set against those who do what is evil, to erase all memory of them from the earth. 
Psa 34:17 The righteous cry out, and the LORD hears, and delivers them from all their troubles. 
Psa 34:18 The LORD is near the brokenhearted; He saves those crushed in spirit. 
Psa 34:19 Many adversities come to the one who is righteous, but the LORD delivers him from them all. 
Psa 34:20 He protects all his bones; not one of them is broken. 
Psa 34:21 Evil brings death to the wicked, and those who hate the righteous will be punished. 
Psa 34:22 The LORD redeems the life of His servants, and all who take refuge in Him will not be punished.
Psa 35:1 [Davidic.] Oppose my opponents, LORD; fight those who fight me. 
Psa 35:2 Take Your shields-- large and small-- and come to my aid.
Psa 35:3 Draw the spear and javelin against my pursuers, and assure me: "I am your deliverance." 
Psa 35:4 Let those who seek to kill me be disgraced and humiliated; let those who plan to harm me be turned back and ashamed. 
Psa 35:5 Let them be like chaff in the wind, with the angel of the LORD driving them away. 
Psa 35:6 Let their way be dark and slippery, with the angel of the LORD pursuing them. 
Psa 35:7 They hid their net for me without cause; they dug a pit for me without cause. 
Psa 35:8 Let ruin come on him unexpectedly, and let the net that he hid ensnare him; let him fall into it-- to his ruin.
Psa 35:9 Then I will rejoice in the LORD; I will delight in His deliverance. 
Psa 35:10 My very bones will say, "LORD, who is like You, rescuing the poor from one too strong for him, the poor or the needy from one who robs him?" 
Psa 35:11 Malicious witnesses come forward; they question me about things I do not know. 
Psa 35:12 They repay me evil for good, making me desolate. 
Psa 35:13 Yet when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth; I humbled myself with fasting, and my prayer was genuine. 
Psa 35:14 I went about grieving as if for my friend or brother; I was bowed down with grief, like one mourning a mother. 
Psa 35:15 But when I stumbled, they gathered in glee; they gathered against me. Assailants I did not know tore at me and did not stop. 
Psa 35:16 With godless mockery they gnashed their teeth at me. 
Psa 35:17 Lord, how long will You look on? Rescue my life from their ravages, my only one from the young lions. 
Psa 35:18 I will praise You in the great congregation; I will exalt You among many people. 
Psa 35:19 Do not let my deceitful enemies rejoice over me; do not let those who hate me without cause look at me maliciously. 
Psa 35:20 For they do not speak in friendly ways, but contrive deceitful schemes against those who live peacefully in the land. 
Psa 35:21 They open their mouths wide against me and say, "Aha, aha! We saw it!" 
Psa 35:22 You saw it, LORD; do not be silent. Lord, do not be far from me. 
Psa 35:23 Wake up and rise to my defense, to my cause, my God and my LORD! 
Psa 35:24 Vindicate me, LORD my God, in keeping with Your righteousness, and do not let them rejoice over me. 
Psa 35:25 Do not let them say in their hearts, "Aha! Just what we wanted." Do not let them say, "We have swallowed him up!" 
Psa 35:26 Let those who rejoice at my misfortune be disgraced and humiliated; let those who exalt themselves over me be clothed with shame and reproach. 
Psa 35:27 Let those who want my vindication shout for joy and be glad; let them continually say, "The LORD be exalted. He takes pleasure in His servant's well-being." 
Psa 35:28 And my tongue will proclaim Your righteousness, Your praise all day long.
Psa 36:1 [For the choir director. A psalm of David, the Lord's servant.] An oracle within my heart concerning the transgression of the wicked person: There is no dread of God before his eyes, 
Psa 36:2 for in his own eyes he flatters himself too much to discover and hate his sin. 
Psa 36:3 The words of his mouth are malicious and deceptive; he has stopped acting wisely and doing good. 
Psa 36:4 Even on his bed he makes malicious plans. He sets himself on a path that is not good and does not reject evil. 
Psa 36:5 LORD, Your faithful love reaches to heaven, Your faithfulness to the clouds. 
Psa 36:6 Your righteousness is like the highest mountains; Your judgments, like the deepest sea. LORD, You preserve man and beast. 
Psa 36:7 God, Your faithful love is so valuable that people take refuge in the shadow of Your wings. 
Psa 36:8 They are filled from the abundance of Your house; You let them drink from Your refreshing stream, 
Psa 36:9 for with You is life's fountain. In Your light we will see light. 
Psa 36:10 Spread Your faithful love over those who know You, and Your righteousness over the upright in heart. 
Psa 36:11 Do not let the foot of the arrogant man come near me or the hand of the wicked one drive me away.
Psa 36:12 There the evildoers fall; they have been thrown down and cannot rise.
Psa 37:1 [Davidic.] Do not be agitated by evildoers; do not envy those who do wrong. 
Psa 37:2 For they wither quickly like grass and wilt like tender green plants. 
Psa 37:3 Trust in the LORD and do what is good; dwell in the land and live securely. 
Psa 37:4 Take delight in the LORD, and He will give you your heart's desires. 
Psa 37:5 Commit your way to the LORD; trust in Him, and He will act, 
Psa 37:6 making your righteousness shine like the dawn, your justice like the noonday. 
Psa 37:7 Be silent before the LORD and wait expectantly for Him; do not be agitated by one who prospers in his way, by the man who carries out evil plans. 
Psa 37:8 Refrain from anger and give up your rage; do not be agitated-- it can only bring harm.
Psa 37:9 For evildoers will be destroyed, but those who put their hope in the LORD will inherit the land. 
Psa 37:10 A little while, and the wicked person will be no more; though you look for him, he will not be there. 
Psa 37:11 But the humble will inherit the land and will enjoy abundant prosperity. 
Psa 37:12 The wicked person schemes against the righteous and gnashes his teeth at him. 
Psa 37:13 The Lord laughs at him because He sees that his day is coming. 
Psa 37:14 The wicked have drawn the sword and strung the bow to bring down the afflicted and needy and to slaughter those whose way is upright. 
Psa 37:15 Their swords will enter their own hearts, and their bows will be broken. 
Psa 37:16 The little that the righteous man has is better than the abundance of many wicked people. 
Psa 37:17 For the arms of the wicked will be broken, but the LORD supports the righteous. 
Psa 37:18 The LORD watches over the blameless all their days, and their inheritance will last forever. 
Psa 37:19 They will not be disgraced in times of adversity; they will be satisfied in days of hunger.
Psa 37:20 But the wicked will perish; the LORD's enemies, like the glory of the pastures, will fade away-- they will fade away like smoke.
Psa 37:21 The wicked man borrows and does not repay, but the righteous one is gracious and giving. 
Psa 37:22 Those who are blessed by Him will inherit the land, but those cursed by Him will be destroyed. 
Psa 37:23 A man's steps are established by the LORD, and He takes pleasure in his way. 
Psa 37:24 Though he falls, he will not be overwhelmed, because the LORD holds his hand. 
Psa 37:25 I have been young and now I am old, yet I have not seen the righteous abandoned or his children begging for bread. 
Psa 37:26 He is always generous, always lending, and his children are a blessing. 
Psa 37:27 Turn away from evil and do what is good, and dwell there forever. 
Psa 37:28 For the LORD loves justice and will not abandon His faithful ones. They are kept safe forever, but the children of the wicked will be destroyed.
Psa 37:29 The righteous will inherit the land and dwell in it permanently. 
Psa 37:30 The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom; his tongue speaks what is just. 
Psa 37:31 The instruction of his God is in his heart; his steps do not falter. 
Psa 37:32 The wicked one lies in wait for the righteous and seeks to kill him; 
Psa 37:33 the LORD will not leave him in the power of the wicked one or allow him to be condemned when he is judged. 
Psa 37:34 Wait for the LORD and keep His way, and He will exalt you to inherit the land. You will watch when the wicked are destroyed. 
Psa 37:35 I have seen a wicked, violent man well-rooted like a flourishing native tree. 
Psa 37:36 Then I passed by and noticed he was gone; I searched for him, but he could not be found. 
Psa 37:37 Watch the blameless and observe the upright, for the man of peace will have a future.
Psa 37:38 But transgressors will all be eliminated; the future of the wicked will be destroyed.
Psa 37:39 The salvation of the righteous is from the LORD, their refuge in a time of distress.
Psa 37:40 The LORD helps and delivers them; He will deliver them from the wicked and will save them because they take refuge in Him.
Psa 38:1 [A Davidic psalm for remembrance.] LORD, do not punish me in Your anger or discipline me in Your wrath. 
Psa 38:2 For Your arrows have sunk into me, and Your hand has pressed down on me. 
Psa 38:3 There is no health in my body because of Your indignation; there is no strength in my bones because of my sin. 
Psa 38:4 For my sins have flooded over my head; they are a burden too heavy for me to bear. 
Psa 38:5 My wounds are foul and festering because of my foolishness. 
Psa 38:6 I am bent over and brought low; all day long I go around in mourning. 
Psa 38:7 For my loins are full of burning pain, and there is no health in my body. 
Psa 38:8 I am faint and severely crushed; I groan because of the anguish of my heart. 
Psa 38:9 Lord, my every desire is known to You; my sighing is not hidden from You.
Psa 38:10 My heart races, my strength leaves me, and even the light of my eyes has faded.
Psa 38:11 My loved ones and friends stand back from my affliction, and my relatives stand at a distance. 
Psa 38:12 Those who seek my life set traps, and those who want to harm me threaten to destroy me; they plot treachery all day long.
Psa 38:13 I am like a deaf person; I do not hear. I am like a speechless person who does not open his mouth. 
Psa 38:14 I am like a man who does not hear and has no arguments in his mouth. 
Psa 38:15 I put my hope in You, LORD; You will answer, Lord my God. 
Psa 38:16 For I said, "Don't let them rejoice over me-- those who are arrogant toward me when I stumble."
Psa 38:17 For I am about to fall, and my pain is constantly with me. 
Psa 38:18 So I confess my guilt; I am anxious because of my sin. 
Psa 38:19 But my enemies are vigorous and powerful; many hate me for no reason. 
Psa 38:20 Those who repay evil for good attack me for pursuing good. 
Psa 38:21 LORD, do not abandon me; my God, do not be far from me.
Psa 38:22 Hurry to help me, Lord, my Savior.
Psa 39:1 [For the choir director, for Jeduthun. A Davidic psalm.] I said, "I will guard my ways so that I may not sin with my tongue; I will guard my mouth with a muzzle as long as the wicked are in my presence." 
Psa 39:2 I was speechless and quiet; I kept silent, even from speaking good, and my pain intensified. 
Psa 39:3 My heart grew hot within me; as I mused, a fire burned. I spoke with my tongue: 
Psa 39:4 "LORD, reveal to me the end of my life and the number of my days. Let me know how short-lived I am. 
Psa 39:5 You, indeed, have made my days short in length, and my life span as nothing in Your sight. Yes, every mortal man is only a vapor. [Selah] 
Psa 39:6 "Certainly, man walks about like a mere shadow. Indeed, they frantically rush around in vain, gathering possessions without knowing who will get them. 
Psa 39:7 Now, Lord, what do I wait for? My hope is in You. 
Psa 39:8 Deliver me from all my transgressions; do not make me the taunt of fools. 
Psa 39:9 I am speechless; I do not open my mouth because of what You have done.
Psa 39:10 Remove Your torment from me; I fade away because of the force of Your hand. 
Psa 39:11 You discipline a man with punishment for sin, consuming like a moth what is precious to him; every man is only a vapor.[Selah] 
Psa 39:12 "Hear my prayer, LORD, and listen to my cry for help; do not be silent at my tears. For I am a foreigner residing with You, a temporary resident like all my fathers. 
Psa 39:13 Turn Your angry gaze from me so that I may be cheered up before I die and am gone."
Psa 40:1 [For the choir director. A Davidic psalm.] I waited patiently for the LORD, and He turned to me and heard my cry for help. 
Psa 40:2 He brought me up from a desolate pit, out of the muddy clay, and set my feet on a rock, making my steps secure. 
Psa 40:3 He put a new song in my mouth, a hymn of praise to our God. Many will see and fear and put their trust in the LORD. 
Psa 40:4 How happy is the man who has put his trust in the LORD and has not turned to the proud or to those who run after lies! 
Psa 40:5 LORD my God, You have done many things-- Your wonderful works and Your plans for us; none can compare with You. If I were to report and speak of them, they are more than can be told.
Psa 40:6 You do not delight in sacrifice and offering; You open my ears to listen. You do not ask for a whole burnt offering or a sin offering. 
Psa 40:7 Then I said, "See, I have come; it is written about me in the volume of the scroll. 
Psa 40:8 I delight to do Your will, my God; Your instruction lives within me." 
Psa 40:9 I proclaim righteousness in the great assembly; see, I do not keep my mouth closed-- as You know, LORD.
Psa 40:10 I did not hide Your righteousness in my heart; I spoke about Your faithfulness and salvation; I did not conceal Your constant love and truth from the great assembly. 
Psa 40:11 LORD, do not withhold Your compassion from me; Your constant love and truth will always guard me. 
Psa 40:12 For troubles without number have surrounded me; my sins have overtaken me; I am unable to see. They are more than the hairs of my head, and my courage leaves me. 
Psa 40:13 LORD, be pleased to deliver me; hurry to help me, LORD. 
Psa 40:14 Let those who seek to take my life be disgraced and confounded. Let those who wish me harm be driven back and humiliated. 
Psa 40:15 Let those who say to me, "Aha, aha!" be horrified because of their shame. 
Psa 40:16 Let all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; let those who love Your salvation continually say, "The LORD is great!"
Psa 40:17 I am afflicted and needy; the Lord thinks of me. You are my helper and my deliverer; my God, do not delay.
Psa 41:1 [For the choir director. A Davidic psalm.] Happy is one who cares for the poor; the LORD will save him in a day of adversity. 
Psa 41:2 The LORD will keep him and preserve him; he will be blessed in the land. You will not give him over to the desire of his enemies. 
Psa 41:3 The LORD will sustain him on his sickbed; You will heal him on the bed where he lies. 
Psa 41:4 I said, "LORD, be gracious to me; heal me, for I have sinned against You." 
Psa 41:5 My enemies speak maliciously about me: "When will he die and be forgotten?" 
Psa 41:6 When one of them comes to visit, he speaks deceitfully; he stores up evil in his heart; he goes out and talks. 
Psa 41:7 All who hate me whisper together about me; they plan to harm me. 
Psa 41:8 "Lethal poison has been poured into him, and he won't rise again from where he lies!" 
Psa 41:9 Even my friend in whom I trusted, one who ate my bread, has raised his heel against me. 
Psa 41:10 But You, LORD, be gracious to me and raise me up; then I will repay them. 
Psa 41:11 By this I know that You delight in me: my enemy does not shout in triumph over me. 
Psa 41:12 You supported me because of my integrity and set me in Your presence forever. 
Psa 41:13 May Yahweh, the God of Israel, be praised from everlasting to everlasting. Amen and amen.
Psa 42:1 [ For the choir director. A Maskil of the sons of Korah.] As a deer longs for streams of water, so I long for You, God. 
Psa 42:2 I thirst for God, the living God. When can I come and appear before God? 
Psa 42:3 My tears have been my food day and night, while all day long people say to me, "Where is your God?" 
Psa 42:4 I remember this as I pour out my heart: how I walked with many, leading the festive procession to the house of God, with joyful and thankful shouts. 
Psa 42:5 Why am I so depressed? Why this turmoil within me? Put your hope in God, for I will still praise Him, my Savior and my God. 
Psa 42:6 I am deeply depressed; therefore I remember You from the land of Jordan and the peaks of Hermon, from Mount Mizar. 
Psa 42:7 Deep calls to deep in the roar of Your waterfalls; all Your breakers and Your billows have swept over me. 
Psa 42:8 The LORD will send His faithful love by day; His song will be with me in the night-- a prayer to the God of my life.
Psa 42:9 I will say to God, my rock, "Why have You forgotten me? Why must I go about in sorrow because of the enemy's oppression?" 
Psa 42:10 My adversaries taunt me, as if crushing my bones, while all day long they say to me, "Where is your God?" 
Psa 42:11 Why am I so depressed? Why this turmoil within me? Put your hope in God, for I will still praise Him, my Savior and my God. 
Psa 43:1 Vindicate me, God, and defend my cause against an ungodly nation; rescue me from the deceitful and unjust man. 
Psa 43:2 For You are the God of my refuge. Why have You rejected me? Why must I go about in sorrow because of the enemy's oppression? 
Psa 43:3 Send Your light and Your truth; let them lead me. Let them bring me to Your holy mountain, to Your dwelling place. 
Psa 43:4 Then I will come to the altar of God, to God, my greatest joy. I will praise You with the lyre, God, my God. 
Psa 43:5 Why am I so depressed? Why this turmoil within me? Put your hope in God, for I will still praise Him, my Savior and my God.
Psa 44:1 [For the choir director. A Maskil of the sons of Korah.] God, we have heard with our ears-- our ancestors have told us-- the work You accomplished in their days, in days long ago:
Psa 44:2 to plant them, You drove out the nations with Your hand; to settle them, You crushed the peoples. 
Psa 44:3 For they did not take the land by their sword-- their arm did not bring them victory-- but by Your right hand, Your arm, and the light of Your face, for You were pleased with them.
Psa 44:4 You are my King, my God, who ordains victories for Jacob. 
Psa 44:5 Through You we drive back our foes; through Your name we trample our enemies. 
Psa 44:6 For I do not trust in my bow, and my sword does not bring me victory. 
Psa 44:7 But You give us victory over our foes and let those who hate us be disgraced. 
Psa 44:8 We boast in God all day long; we will praise Your name forever. [Selah] 
Psa 44:9 But You have rejected and humiliated us; You do not march out with our armies. 
Psa 44:10 You make us retreat from the foe, and those who hate us have taken plunder for themselves. 
Psa 44:11 You hand us over to be eaten like sheep and scatter us among the nations. 
Psa 44:12 You sell Your people for nothing; You make no profit from selling them. 
Psa 44:13 You make us an object of reproach to our neighbors, a source of mockery and ridicule to those around us. 
Psa 44:14 You make us a joke among the nations, a laughingstock among the peoples. 
Psa 44:15 My disgrace is before me all day long, and shame has covered my face,
Psa 44:16 because of the voice of the scorner and reviler, because of the enemy and avenger. 
Psa 44:17 All this has happened to us, but we have not forgotten You or betrayed Your covenant. 
Psa 44:18 Our hearts have not turned back; our steps have not strayed from Your path. 
Psa 44:19 But You have crushed us in a haunt of jackals and have covered us with deepest darkness. 
Psa 44:20 If we had forgotten the name of our God and spread out our hands to a foreign god, 
Psa 44:21 wouldn't God have found this out, since He knows the secrets of the heart? 
Psa 44:22 Because of You we are slain all day long; we are counted as sheep to be slaughtered. 
Psa 44:23 Wake up, LORD! Why are You sleeping? Get up! Don't reject us forever! 
Psa 44:24 Why do You hide Yourself and forget our affliction and oppression?
Psa 44:25 For we have sunk down to the dust; our bodies cling to the ground.
Psa 44:26 Rise up! Help us! Redeem us because of Your faithful love.
Psa 45:1 [For the choir director: according to "The Lilies." A Maskil of the sons of Korah. A love song.] My heart is moved by a noble theme as I recite my verses to the king; my tongue is the pen of a skillful writer. 
Psa 45:2 You are the most handsome of men; grace flows from your lips. Therefore God has blessed you forever. 
Psa 45:3 Mighty warrior, strap your sword at your side. In your majesty and splendor--
Psa 45:4 in your splendor ride triumphantly in the cause of truth, humility, and justice. May your right hand show your awe-inspiring acts. 
Psa 45:5 Your arrows pierce the hearts of the king's enemies; the peoples fall under you. 
Psa 45:6 Your throne, God, is forever and ever; the scepter of Your kingdom is a scepter of justice. 
Psa 45:7 You love righteousness and hate wickedness; therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of joy more than your companions. 
Psa 45:8 Myrrh, aloes, and cassia perfume all your garments; from ivory palaces harps bring you joy. 
Psa 45:9 Kings' daughters are among your honored women; the queen, adorned with gold from Ophir, stands at your right hand. 
Psa 45:10 Listen, daughter, pay attention and consider: forget your people and your father's house, 
Psa 45:11 and the king will desire your beauty. Bow down to him, for he is your lord. 
Psa 45:12 The daughter of Tyre, the wealthy people, will seek your favor with gifts.
Psa 45:13 In her chamber, the royal daughter is all glorious, her clothing embroidered with gold. 
Psa 45:14 In colorful garments she is led to the king; after her, the virgins, her companions, are brought to you. 
Psa 45:15 They are led in with gladness and rejoicing; they enter the king's palace. 
Psa 45:16 Your sons will succeed your ancestors; you will make them princes throughout the land. 
Psa 45:17 I will cause your name to be remembered for all generations; therefore the peoples will praise you forever and ever.
Psa 46:1 [For the choir director. A song of the sons of Korah. According to Alamoth.] God is our refuge and strength, a helper who is always found in times of trouble. 
Psa 46:2 Therefore we will not be afraid, though the earth trembles and the mountains topple into the depths of the seas, 
Psa 46:3 though its waters roar and foam and the mountains quake with its turmoil. [Selah] 
Psa 46:4 There is a river-- its streams delight the city of God, the holy dwelling place of the Most High.
Psa 46:5 God is within her; she will not be toppled. God will help her when the morning dawns. 
Psa 46:6 Nations rage, kingdoms topple; the earth melts when He lifts His voice. 
Psa 46:7 The LORD of Hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our stronghold.[Selah] 
Psa 46:8 Come, see the works of the LORD, who brings devastation on the earth. 
Psa 46:9 He makes wars cease throughout the earth. He shatters bows and cuts spears to pieces; He burns up the chariots.
Psa 46:10 "Stop your fighting-- and know that I am God, exalted among the nations, exalted on the earth."
Psa 46:11 Yahweh of Hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our stronghold.[Selah]
Psa 47:1 [ For the choir director. A psalm of the sons of Korah.] Clap your hands, all you peoples; shout to God with a jubilant cry. 
Psa 47:2 For Yahweh, the Most High, is awe-inspiring, a great King over all the earth. 
Psa 47:3 He subdues peoples under us and nations under our feet. 
Psa 47:4 He chooses for us our inheritance-- the pride of Jacob, whom He loves. [Selah]
Psa 47:5 God ascends among shouts of joy, the LORD, among the sound of trumpets. 
Psa 47:6 Sing praise to God, sing praise; sing praise to our King, sing praise!
Psa 47:7 Sing a song of wisdom, for God is King of all the earth. 
Psa 47:8 God reigns over the nations; God is seated on His holy throne. 
Psa 47:9 The nobles of the peoples have assembled with the people of the God of Abraham. For the leaders of the earth belong to God; He is greatly exalted.
Psa 48:1 [A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah.] The LORD is great and highly praised in the city of our God. His holy mountain, 
Psa 48:2 rising splendidly, is the joy of the whole earth. Mount Zion on the slopes of the north is the city of the great King.
Psa 48:3 God is known as a stronghold in its citadels. 
Psa 48:4 Look! The kings assembled; they advanced together. 
Psa 48:5 They looked and froze with fear; they fled in terror. 
Psa 48:6 Trembling seized them there, agony like that of a woman in labor, 
Psa 48:7 as You wrecked the ships of Tarshish with the east wind. 
Psa 48:8 Just as we heard, so we have seen in the city of Yahweh of Hosts, in the city of our God; God will establish it forever. [Selah] 
Psa 48:9 God, within Your temple, we contemplate Your faithful love. 
Psa 48:10 Your name, God, like Your praise, reaches to the ends of the earth; Your right hand is filled with justice. 
Psa 48:11 Mount Zion is glad. The towns of Judah rejoice because of Your judgments. 
Psa 48:12 Go around Zion, encircle it; count its towers,
Psa 48:13 note its ramparts; tour its citadels so that you can tell a future generation: 
Psa 48:14 "This God, our God forever and ever-- He will always lead us."
Psa 49:1 [For the choir director. A psalm of the sons of Korah.] Hear this, all you peoples; listen, all who inhabit the world, 
Psa 49:2 both low and high, rich and poor together. 
Psa 49:3 My mouth speaks wisdom; my heart's meditation brings understanding. 
Psa 49:4 I turn my ear to a proverb; I explain my riddle with a lyre. 
Psa 49:5 Why should I fear in times of trouble? The iniquity of my foes surrounds me. 
Psa 49:6 They trust in their wealth and boast of their abundant riches. 
Psa 49:7 Yet these cannot redeem a person or pay his ransom to God--
Psa 49:8 since the price of redeeming him is too costly, one should forever stop trying--
Psa 49:9 so that he may live forever and not see the Pit. 
Psa 49:10 For one can see that wise men die; foolish and stupid men also pass away. Then they leave their wealth to others. 
Psa 49:11 Their graves are their eternal homes, their homes from generation to generation, though they have named estates after themselves. 
Psa 49:12 But despite his assets, man will not last; he is like the animals that perish. 
Psa 49:13 This is the way of those who are arrogant, and of their followers, who approve of their words. [Selah] 
Psa 49:14 Like sheep they are headed for Sheol; Death will shepherd them. The upright will rule over them in the morning, and their form will waste away in Sheol, far from their lofty abode. 
Psa 49:15 But God will redeem my life from the power of Sheol, for He will take me.[Selah] 
Psa 49:16 Do not be afraid when a man gets rich, when the wealth of his house increases. 
Psa 49:17 For when he dies, he will take nothing at all; his wealth will not follow him down. 
Psa 49:18 Though he praises himself during his lifetime-- and people praise you when you do well for yourself--
Psa 49:19 he will go to the generation of his fathers; they will never see the light. 
Psa 49:20 A man with valuable possessions but without understanding is like the animals that perish.
Psa 50:1 [A psalm of Asaph.] Yahweh, the god of gods speaks; He summons the earth from east to west. 
Psa 50:2 From Zion, the perfection of beauty, God appears in radiance. 
Psa 50:3 Our God is coming; He will not be silent! Devouring fire precedes Him, and a storm rages around Him.
Psa 50:4 On high, He summons heaven and earth in order to judge His people. 
Psa 50:5 "Gather My faithful ones to Me, those who made a covenant with Me by sacrifice." 
Psa 50:6 The heavens proclaim His righteousness, for God is the Judge. [Selah] 
Psa 50:7 "Listen, My people, and I will speak; I will testify against you, Israel. I am God, your God. 
Psa 50:8 I do not rebuke you for your sacrifices or for your burnt offerings, which are continually before Me.
Psa 50:9 I will not accept a bull from your household or male goats from your pens, 
Psa 50:10 for every animal of the forest is Mine, the cattle on a thousand hills.
Psa 50:11 I know every bird of the mountains, and the creatures of the field are Mine. 
Psa 50:12 If I were hungry, I would not tell you, for the world and everything in it is Mine. 
Psa 50:13 Do I eat the flesh of bulls or drink the blood of goats? 
Psa 50:14 Sacrifice a thank offering to God, and pay your vows to the Most High. 
Psa 50:15 Call on Me in a day of trouble; I will rescue you, and you will honor Me." 
Psa 50:16 But God says to the wicked: "What right do you have to recite My statutes and to take My covenant on your lips? 
Psa 50:17 You hate instruction and turn your back on My words. 
Psa 50:18 When you see a thief, you make friends with him, and you associate with adulterers. 
Psa 50:19 You unleash your mouth for evil and harness your tongue for deceit. 
Psa 50:20 You sit, maligning your brother, slandering your mother's son. 
Psa 50:21 You have done these things, and I kept silent; you thought I was just like you. But I will rebuke you and lay out the case before you. 
Psa 50:22 "Understand this, you who forget God, or I will tear you apart, and there will be no one to rescue you. 
Psa 50:23 Whoever sacrifices a thank offering honors Me, and whoever orders his conduct, I will show him the salvation of God."
Psa 51:1 [For the choir director. A Davidic psalm, when Nathan the prophet came to him after he had gone to Bathsheba.] Be gracious to me, God, according to Your faithful love; according to Your abundant compassion, blot out my rebellion. 
Psa 51:2 Wash away my guilt and cleanse me from my sin. 
Psa 51:3 For I am conscious of my rebellion, and my sin is always before me. 
Psa 51:4 Against You-- You alone-- I have sinned and done this evil in Your sight. So You are right when You pass sentence; You are blameless when You judge.
Psa 51:5 Indeed, I was guilty when I was born; I was sinful when my mother conceived me. 
Psa 51:6 Surely You desire integrity in the inner self, and You teach me wisdom deep within. 
Psa 51:7 Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean; wash me, and I will be whiter than snow. 
Psa 51:8 Let me hear joy and gladness; let the bones You have crushed rejoice. 
Psa 51:9 Turn Your face away from my sins and blot out all my guilt. 
Psa 51:10 God, create a clean heart for me and renew a steadfast spirit within me. 
Psa 51:11 Do not banish me from Your presence or take Your Holy Spirit from me.
Psa 51:12 Restore the joy of Your salvation to me, and give me a willing spirit. 
Psa 51:13 Then I will teach the rebellious Your ways, and sinners will return to You. 
Psa 51:14 Save me from the guilt of bloodshed, God, the God of my salvation, and my tongue will sing of Your righteousness. 
Psa 51:15 Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will declare Your praise. 
Psa 51:16 You do not want a sacrifice, or I would give it; You are not pleased with a burnt offering. 
Psa 51:17 The sacrifice pleasing to God is a broken spirit. God, You will not despise a broken and humbled heart. 
Psa 51:18 In Your good pleasure, cause Zion to prosper; build the walls of Jerusalem. 
Psa 51:19 Then You will delight in righteous sacrifices, whole burnt offerings; then bulls will be offered on Your altar.
Psa 52:1 [For the choir director. A Davidic Maskil. When Doeg the Edomite went and reported to Saul, telling him, "David went to Ahimelech's house."] Why brag about evil, you hero! God's faithful love is constant. 
Psa 52:2 Like a sharpened razor, your tongue devises destruction, working treachery. 
Psa 52:3 You love evil instead of good, lying instead of speaking truthfully. [Selah] 
Psa 52:4 You love any words that destroy, you treacherous tongue! 
Psa 52:5 This is why God will bring you down forever. He will take you, ripping you out of your tent; He will uproot you from the land of the living.[Selah] 
Psa 52:6 The righteous will look on with awe and will ridicule him: 
Psa 52:7 "Here is the man who would not make God his refuge, but trusted in the abundance of his riches, taking refuge in his destructive behavior." 
Psa 52:8 But I am like a flourishing olive tree in the house of God; I trust in God's faithful love forever and ever. 
Psa 52:9 I will praise You forever for what You have done. In the presence of Your faithful people, I will put my hope in Your name, for it is good.
Psa 53:1 [For the choir director: on Mahalath. A Davidic Maskil.] The fool says in his heart, "God does not exist." They are corrupt, and they do vile deeds. There is no one who does good. 
Psa 53:2 God looks down from heaven on the human race to see if there is one who is wise, one who seeks God. 
Psa 53:3 All have turned away; all alike have become corrupt. There is no one who does good, not even one. 
Psa 53:4 Will evildoers never understand? They consume My people as they consume bread; they do not call on God. 
Psa 53:5 Then they will be filled with terror-- terror like no other-- because God will scatter the bones of those who besiege you. You will put them to shame, for God has rejected them.
Psa 53:6 Oh, that Israel's deliverance would come from Zion! When God restores the fortunes of His people, Jacob will rejoice; Israel will be glad.
Psa 54:1 [For the choir director: with stringed instruments. A Davidic Maskil. When the Ziphites went and said to Saul, "Is David not hiding among us?"] God, save me by Your name, and vindicate me by Your might! 
Psa 54:2 God, hear my prayer; listen to the words of my mouth. 
Psa 54:3 For strangers rise up against me, and violent men seek my life. They have no regard for God. [Selah] 
Psa 54:4 God is my helper; the Lord is the sustainer of my life. 
Psa 54:5 He will repay my adversaries for their evil. Because of Your faithfulness, annihilate them. 
Psa 54:6 I will sacrifice a freewill offering to You. I will praise Your name, Yahweh, because it is good. 
Psa 54:7 For He has delivered me from every trouble, and my eye has looked down on my enemies.
Psa 55:1 [For the choir director: with stringed instruments. A Davidic Maskil.] God, listen to my prayer and do not ignore my plea for help. 
Psa 55:2 Pay attention to me and answer me. I am restless and in turmoil with my complaint, 
Psa 55:3 because of the enemy's voice, because of the pressure of the wicked. For they bring down disaster on me and harass me in anger. 
Psa 55:4 My heart shudders within me; terrors of death sweep over me. 
Psa 55:5 Fear and trembling grip me; horror has overwhelmed me. 
Psa 55:6 I said, "If only I had wings like a dove! I would fly away and find rest. 
Psa 55:7 How far away I would flee; I would stay in the wilderness. [Selah] 
Psa 55:8 I would hurry to my shelter from the raging wind and the storm." 
Psa 55:9 Lord, confuse and confound their speech, for I see violence and strife in the city; 
Psa 55:10 day and night they make the rounds on its walls. Crime and trouble are within it; 
Psa 55:11 destruction is inside it; oppression and deceit never leave its marketplace. 
Psa 55:12 Now it is not an enemy who insults me-- otherwise I could bear it; it is not a foe who rises up against me-- otherwise I could hide from him.
Psa 55:13 But it is you, a man who is my peer, my companion and good friend! 
Psa 55:14 We used to have close fellowship; we walked with the crowd into the house of God. 
Psa 55:15 Let death take them by surprise; let them go down to Sheol alive, because evil is in their homes and within them. 
Psa 55:16 But I call to God, and the LORD will save me. 
Psa 55:17 I complain and groan morning, noon, and night, and He hears my voice. 
Psa 55:18 Though many are against me, He will redeem me from my battle unharmed. 
Psa 55:19 God, the One enthroned from long ago, will hear and will humiliate them[Selah] because they do not change and do not fear God. 
Psa 55:20 My friend acts violently against those at peace with him; he violates his covenant. 
Psa 55:21 His buttery words are smooth, but war is in his heart. His words are softer than oil, but they are drawn swords. 
Psa 55:22 Cast your burden on the LORD, and He will sustain you; He will never allow the righteous to be shaken. 
Psa 55:23 God, You will bring them down to the Pit of destruction; men of bloodshed and treachery will not live out half their days. But I will trust in You.
Psa 56:1 [For the choir director: according to "A Silent Dove Far Away." A Davidic Miktam. When the Philistines seized him in Gath.] Be gracious to me, God, for man tramples me; he fights and oppresses me all day long.
Psa 56:2 My adversaries trample me all day, for many arrogantly fight against me. 
Psa 56:3 When I am afraid, I will trust in You. 
Psa 56:4 In God, whose word I praise, in God I trust; I will not fear. What can man do to me? 
Psa 56:5 They twist my words all day long; all their thoughts against me are evil. 
Psa 56:6 They stir up strife, they lurk; they watch my steps while they wait to take my life. 
Psa 56:7 Will they escape in spite of such sin? God, bring down the nations in wrath. 
Psa 56:8 You Yourself have recorded my wanderings. Put my tears in Your bottle. Are they not in Your records? 
Psa 56:9 Then my enemies will retreat on the day when I call. This I know: God is for me. 
Psa 56:10 In God, whose word I praise, in the LORD, whose word I praise,
Psa 56:11 in God I trust; I will not fear. What can man do to me? 
Psa 56:12 I am obligated by vows to You, God; I will make my thank offerings to You. 
Psa 56:13 For You delivered me from death, even my feet from stumbling, to walk before God in the light of life.
Psa 57:1 [For the choir director: "Do Not Destroy." A Davidic Miktam. When he fled before Saul into the cave.] Be gracious to me, God, be gracious to me, for I take refuge in You. I will seek refuge in the shadow of Your wings until danger passes. 
Psa 57:2 I call to God Most High, to God who fulfills His purpose for me. 
Psa 57:3 He reaches down from heaven and saves me, challenging the one who tramples me. [Selah] God sends His faithful love and truth. 
Psa 57:4 I am surrounded by lions; I lie down with those who devour men. Their teeth are spears and arrows; their tongues are sharp swords. 
Psa 57:5 God, be exalted above the heavens; let Your glory be over the whole earth. 
Psa 57:6 They prepared a net for my steps; I was despondent. They dug a pit ahead of me, but they fell into it![Selah] 
Psa 57:7 My heart is confident, God, my heart is confident. I will sing; I will sing praises. 
Psa 57:8 Wake up, my soul! Wake up, harp and lyre! I will wake up the dawn. 
Psa 57:9 I will praise You, Lord, among the peoples; I will sing praises to You among the nations. 
Psa 57:10 For Your faithful love is as high as the heavens; Your faithfulness reaches the clouds. 
Psa 57:11 God, be exalted above the heavens; let Your glory be over the whole earth.
Psa 58:1 [For the choir director: "Do Not Destroy." A Davidic Miktam.] Do you really speak righteously, you mighty ones? Do you judge people fairly? 
Psa 58:2 No, you practice injustice in your hearts; with your hands you weigh out violence in the land. 
Psa 58:3 The wicked go astray from the womb; liars err from birth. 
Psa 58:4 They have venom like the venom of a snake, like the deaf cobra that stops up its ears, 
Psa 58:5 that does not listen to the sound of the charmers who skillfully weave spells. 
Psa 58:6 God, knock the teeth out of their mouths; LORD, tear out the young lions' fangs. 
Psa 58:7 They will vanish like water that flows by; they will aim their useless arrows. 
Psa 58:8 Like a slug that moves along in slime, like a woman's miscarried child, they will not see the sun. 
Psa 58:9 Before your pots can feel the heat of the thorns-- whether green or burning-- He will sweep them away.
Psa 58:10 The righteous one will rejoice when he sees the retribution; he will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked. 
Psa 58:11 Then people will say, "Yes, there is a reward for the righteous! There is a God who judges on earth!"
Psa 59:1 [For the choir director: "Do Not Destroy." A Davidic Miktam. When Saul sent agents to watch the house and kill him.] Deliver me from my enemies, my God; protect me from those who rise up against me. 
Psa 59:2 Deliver me from those who practice sin, and save me from men of bloodshed. 
Psa 59:3 LORD, look! They set an ambush for me. Powerful men attack me, but not because of any sin or rebellion of mine. 
Psa 59:4 For no fault of mine, they run and take up a position. Awake to help me, and take notice. 
Psa 59:5 LORD God of Hosts, You are the God of Israel, rise up to punish all the nations; do not show grace to any wicked traitors. [Selah] 
Psa 59:6 They return at evening, snarling like dogs and prowling around the city. 
Psa 59:7 Look, they spew from their mouths-- sharp words from their lips. "For who," they say, "will hear?"
Psa 59:8 But You laugh at them, LORD; You ridicule all the nations. 
Psa 59:9 I will keep watch for You, my strength, because God is my stronghold. 
Psa 59:10 My faithful God will come to meet me; God will let me look down on my adversaries.
Psa 59:11 Do not kill them; otherwise, my people will forget. By Your power, make them homeless wanderers and bring them down, Lord, our shield. 
Psa 59:12 For the sin of their mouths and the words of their lips, let them be caught in their pride. They utter curses and lies.
Psa 59:13 Consume them in rage; consume them until they are gone. Then people will know throughout the earth that God rules over Jacob.[Selah] 
Psa 59:14 And they return at evening, snarling like dogs and prowling around the city. 
Psa 59:15 They scavenge for food; they growl if they are not satisfied. 
Psa 59:16 But I will sing of Your strength and will joyfully proclaim Your faithful love in the morning. For You have been a stronghold for me, a refuge in my day of trouble. 
Psa 59:17 To You, my strength, I sing praises, because God is my stronghold-- my faithful God.
Psa 60:1 [For the choir director: according to "The Lily of Testimony." A Davidic Miktam for teaching. When he fought with Aram-naharaim and Aram-zobah, and Joab returned and struck Edom in the Valley of Salt, killing 12,000.] God, You have rejected us; You have broken out against us; You have been angry. Restore us! 
Psa 60:2 You have shaken the land and split it open. Heal its fissures, for it shudders. 
Psa 60:3 You have made Your people suffer hardship; You have given us wine to drink that made us stagger. 
Psa 60:4 You have given a signal flag to those who fear You, so that they can flee before the archers. [Selah] 
Psa 60:5 Save with Your right hand, and answer me, so that those You love may be rescued. 
Psa 60:6 God has spoken in His sanctuary: "I will triumph! I will divide up Shechem. I will apportion the Valley of Succoth. 
Psa 60:7 Gilead is Mine, Manasseh is Mine, and Ephraim is My helmet; Judah is My scepter. 
Psa 60:8 Moab is My washbasin. I throw My sandal on Edom; I shout in triumph over Philistia." 
Psa 60:9 Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom? 
Psa 60:10 God, haven't You rejected us? God, You do not march out with our armies. 
Psa 60:11 Give us aid against the foe, for human help is worthless. 
Psa 60:12 With God we will perform valiantly; He will trample our foes.

Psa 61:3 for You have been a refuge for me, a strong tower in the face of the enemy. 
Psa 61:4 I will live in Your tent forever and take refuge under the shelter of Your wings. [Selah]

Psa 62:1 [For the choir director: according to Jeduthun. A Davidic psalm.] I am at rest in God alone; my salvation comes from Him. 
Psa 62:2 He alone is my rock and my salvation, my stronghold; I will never be shaken. 
Psa 62:3 How long will you threaten a man? Will all of you attack as if he were a leaning wall or a tottering stone fence?

Psa 62:5 Rest in God alone, my soul, for my hope comes from Him. 
Psa 62:6 He alone is my rock and my salvation, my stronghold; I will not be shaken.

Psa 63:1 [A Davidic psalm. When he was in the Wilderness of Judah.] God, You are my God; I eagerly seek You. I thirst for You; my body faints for You in a land that is dry, desolate, and without water. 
Psa 63:2 So I gaze on You in the sanctuary to see Your strength and Your glory. 
Psa 63:3 My lips will glorify You because Your faithful love is better than life. 
Psa 63:4 So I will praise You as long as I live; at Your name, I will lift up my hands. 
Psa 63:5 You satisfy me as with rich food; my mouth will praise You with joyful lips. 
Psa 63:6 When I think of You as I lie on my bed, I meditate on You during the night watches 
Psa 63:7 because You are my helper; I will rejoice in the shadow of Your wings. 
Psa 63:8 I follow close to You; Your right hand holds on to me. 
Psa 63:9 But those who seek to destroy my life will go into the depths of the earth. 
Psa 63:10 They will be given over to the power of the sword; they will become the jackals' prey. 
Psa 63:11 But the king will rejoice in God; all who swear by Him will boast, for the mouths of liars will be shut.

Psa 64:3 who sharpen their tongues like swords and aim bitter words like arrows, 
Psa 64:4 shooting from concealed places at the innocent. They shoot at him suddenly and are not afraid. 
Psa 64:5 They encourage each other in an evil plan; they talk about hiding traps and say, "Who will see them?" 
Psa 64:6 They devise crimes and say, "We have perfected a secret plan." The inner man and the heart are mysterious. 
Psa 64:7 But God will shoot them with arrows; suddenly, they will be wounded. 
Psa 64:8 They will be made to stumble; their own tongues work against them. All who see them will shake their heads. 
Psa 64:9 Then everyone will fear and will tell about God's work, for they will understand what He has done.

Psa 65:1 [For the choir director. A Davidic psalm. A song.] Praise is rightfully Yours, God, in Zion; vows to You will be fulfilled.

Psa 65:3 Iniquities overwhelm me; only You can atone for our rebellions. 
Psa 65:4 How happy is the one You choose and bring near to live in Your courts! We will be satisfied with the goodness of Your house, the holiness of Your temple. 
Psa 65:5 You answer us in righteousness, with awe-inspiring works, God of our salvation, the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the distant seas. 
Psa 65:6 You establish the mountains by Your power, robed with strength. 
Psa 65:7 You silence the roar of the seas, the roar of their waves, and the tumult of the nations. 
Psa 65:8 Those who live far away are awed by Your signs; You make east and west shout for joy. 
Psa 65:9 You visit the earth and water it abundantly, enriching it greatly. God's stream is filled with water, for You prepare the earth in this way, providing people with grain. 
Psa 65:10 You soften it with showers and bless its growth, soaking its furrows and leveling its ridges. 
Psa 65:11 You crown the year with Your goodness; Your ways overflow with plenty.

Psa 65:13 The pastures are clothed with flocks and the valleys covered with grain. They shout in triumph; indeed, they sing.

Psa 66:4 All the earth will worship You and sing praise to You. They will sing praise to Your name." [Selah] 
Psa 66:5 Come and see the wonders of God; His acts for humanity are awe-inspiring. 
Psa 66:6 He turned the sea into dry land, and they crossed the river on foot. There we rejoiced in Him.

Psa 66:8 Praise our God, you peoples; let the sound of His praise be heard. 
Psa 66:9 He keeps us alive and does not allow our feet to slip.

Psa 66:11 You lured us into a trap; You placed burdens on our backs.
Psa 66:12 You let men ride over our heads; we went through fire and water, but You brought us out to abundance.

Psa 66:19 However, God has listened; He has paid attention to the sound of my prayer.
Psa 66:20 May God be praised! He has not turned away my prayer or turned His faithful love from me.

Psa 68:1 [For the choir director. A Davidic psalm. A song.] God arises. His enemies scatter, and those who hate Him flee from His presence. 
Psa 68:2 As smoke is blown away, so You blow them away. As wax melts before the fire, so the wicked are destroyed before God. 
Psa 68:3 But the righteous are glad; they rejoice before God and celebrate with joy. 
Psa 68:4 Sing to God! Sing praises to His name. Exalt Him who rides on the clouds-- His name is Yahweh-- and rejoice before Him.
Psa 68:5 God in His holy dwelling is a father of the fatherless and a champion of widows. 
Psa 68:6 God provides homes for those who are deserted. He leads out the prisoners to prosperity, but the rebellious live in a scorched land.
