Psa 68:8 the earth trembled and the skies poured down rain before God, the God of Sinai, before God, the God of Israel. 
Psa 68:9 You, God, showered abundant rain; You revived Your inheritance when it languished. 
Psa 68:10 Your people settled in it; God, You provided for the poor by Your goodness. 
Psa 68:11 The Lord gave the command; a great company of women brought the good news:
Psa 68:12 "The kings of the armies flee-- they flee!" She who stays at home divides the spoil.
Psa 68:13 While you lie among the sheepfolds, the wings of a dove are covered with silver, and its feathers with glistening gold. 
Psa 68:14 When the Almighty scattered kings in the land, it snowed on Zalmon. 
Psa 68:15 Mount Bashan is God's towering mountain; Mount Bashan is a mountain of many peaks. 
Psa 68:16 Why gaze with envy, you mountain peaks, at the mountain God desired for His dwelling? The LORD will live there forever! 
Psa 68:17 God's chariots are tens of thousands, thousands and thousands; the Lord is among them in the sanctuary as He was at Sinai. 
Psa 68:18 You ascended to the heights, taking away captives; You received gifts from people, even from the rebellious, so that the LORD God might live there. 
Psa 68:19 May the Lord be praised! Day after day He bears our burdens; God is our salvation.[Selah] 
Psa 68:20 Our God is a God of salvation, and escape from death belongs to the Lord GOD. 
Psa 68:21 Surely God crushes the heads of His enemies, the hairy head of one who goes on in his guilty acts. 
Psa 68:22 The Lord said, "I will bring them back from Bashan; I will bring them back from the depths of the sea 
Psa 68:23 so that your foot may wade in blood and your dogs' tongues may have their share from the enemies." 
Psa 68:24 People have seen Your procession, God, the procession of my God, my King, in the sanctuary. 
Psa 68:25 Singers lead the way, with musicians following; among them are young women playing tambourines. 
Psa 68:26 Praise God in the assemblies; praise the LORD from the fountain of Israel. 
Psa 68:27 There is Benjamin, the youngest, leading them, the rulers of Judah in their assembly, the rulers of Zebulun, the rulers of Naphtali. 
Psa 68:28 Your God has decreed your strength. Show Your strength, God, You who have acted on our behalf. 
Psa 68:29 Because of Your temple at Jerusalem, kings will bring tribute to You. 
Psa 68:30 Rebuke the beast in the reeds, the herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples. Trample underfoot those with bars of silver. Scatter the peoples who take pleasure in war. 
Psa 68:31 Ambassadors will come from Egypt; Cush will stretch out its hands to God. 
Psa 68:32 Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth; sing praise to the Lord,[Selah] 
Psa 68:33 to Him who rides in the ancient, highest heavens. Look, He thunders with His powerful voice! 
Psa 68:34 Ascribe power to God. His majesty is over Israel, His power among the clouds. 
Psa 68:35 God, You are awe-inspiring in Your sanctuaries. The God of Israel gives power and strength to His people. May God be praised!
Psa 69:1 [For the choir director: according to "The Lilies." Davidic.] Save me, God, for the water has risen to my neck. 
Psa 69:2 I have sunk in deep mud, and there is no footing; I have come into deep waters, and a flood sweeps over me. 
Psa 69:3 I am weary from my crying; my throat is parched. My eyes fail, looking for my God. 
Psa 69:4 Those who hate me without cause are more numerous than the hairs of my head; my deceitful enemies, who would destroy me, are powerful. Though I did not steal, I must repay. 
Psa 69:5 God, You know my foolishness, and my guilty acts are not hidden from You.
Psa 69:6 Do not let those who put their hope in You be disgraced because of me, Lord GOD of Hosts; do not let those who seek You be humiliated because of me, God of Israel. 
Psa 69:7 For I have endured insults because of You, and shame has covered my face. 
Psa 69:8 I have become a stranger to my brothers and a foreigner to my mother's sons 
Psa 69:9 because zeal for Your house has consumed me, and the insults of those who insult You have fallen on me. 
Psa 69:10 I mourned and fasted, but it brought me insults. 
Psa 69:11 I wore sackcloth as my clothing, and I was a joke to them.
Psa 69:12 Those who sit at the city gate talk about me, and drunkards make up songs about me. 
Psa 69:13 But as for me, LORD, my prayer to You is for a time of favor. In Your abundant, faithful love, God, answer me with Your sure salvation. 
Psa 69:14 Rescue me from the miry mud; don't let me sink. Let me be rescued from those who hate me and from the deep waters. 
Psa 69:15 Don't let the floodwaters sweep over me or the deep swallow me up; don't let the Pit close its mouth over me. 
Psa 69:16 Answer me, LORD, for Your faithful love is good; in keeping with Your great compassion, turn to me. 
Psa 69:17 Don't hide Your face from Your servant, for I am in distress. Answer me quickly! 
Psa 69:18 Draw near to me and redeem me; ransom me because of my enemies. 
Psa 69:19 You know the insults I endure-- my shame and disgrace. You are aware of all my adversaries.
Psa 69:20 Insults have broken my heart, and I am in despair. I waited for sympathy, but there was none; for comforters, but found no one. 
Psa 69:21 Instead, they gave me gall for my food, and for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink. 
Psa 69:22 Let their table set before them be a snare, and let it be a trap for their allies. 
Psa 69:23 Let their eyes grow too dim to see, and let their loins continually shake. 
Psa 69:24 Pour out Your rage on them, and let Your burning anger overtake them. 
Psa 69:25 Make their fortification desolate; may no one live in their tents.
Psa 69:26 For they persecute the one You struck and talk about the pain of those You wounded. 
Psa 69:27 Add guilt to their guilt; do not let them share in Your righteousness. 
Psa 69:28 Let them be erased from the book of life and not be recorded with the righteous.
Psa 69:29 But as for me-- poor and in pain-- let Your salvation protect me, God.
Psa 69:30 I will praise God's name with song and exalt Him with thanksgiving.
Psa 69:31 That will please Yahweh more than an ox, more than a bull with horns and hooves.
Psa 69:32 The humble will see it and rejoice. You who seek God, take heart! 
Psa 69:33 For the LORD listens to the needy and does not despise His own who are prisoners. 
Psa 69:34 Let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas and everything that moves in them, 
Psa 69:35 for God will save Zion and build up the cities of Judah. They will live there and possess it. 
Psa 69:36 The descendants of His servants will inherit it, and those who love His name will live in it.
Psa 70:1 [For the choir director. Davidic. To bring remembrance.] God, deliver me. Hurry to help me, LORD! 
Psa 70:2 Let those who seek my life be disgraced and confounded; let those who wish me harm be driven back and humiliated.
Psa 70:3 Let those who say, "Aha, aha!" retreat because of their shame. 
Psa 70:4 Let all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; let those who love Your salvation continually say, "God is great!" 
Psa 70:5 I am afflicted and needy; hurry to me, God. You are my help and my deliverer; LORD, do not delay. 
Psa 71:1 LORD, I seek refuge in You; let me never be disgraced. 
Psa 71:2 In Your justice, rescue and deliver me; listen closely to me and save me. 
Psa 71:3 Be a rock of refuge for me, where I can always go. Give the command to save me, for You are my rock and fortress. 
Psa 71:4 Deliver me, my God, from the power of the wicked, from the grasp of the unjust and oppressive. 
Psa 71:5 For You are my hope, Lord GOD, my confidence from my youth. 
Psa 71:6 I have leaned on You from birth; You took me from my mother's womb. My praise is always about You. 
Psa 71:7 I have become an ominous sign to many, but You are my strong refuge. 
Psa 71:8 My mouth is full of praise and honor to You all day long. 
Psa 71:9 Don't discard me in my old age; as my strength fails, do not abandon me. 
Psa 71:10 For my enemies talk about me, and those who spy on me plot together, 
Psa 71:11 saying, "God has abandoned him; chase him and catch him, for there is no one to rescue him." 
Psa 71:12 God, do not be far from me; my God, hurry to help me.
Psa 71:13 May my adversaries be disgraced and destroyed; may those who seek my harm be covered with disgrace and humiliation. 
Psa 71:14 But I will hope continually and will praise You more and more. 
Psa 71:15 My mouth will tell about Your righteousness and Your salvation all day long, though I cannot sum them up. 
Psa 71:16 I come because of the mighty acts of the Lord GOD; I will proclaim Your righteousness, Yours alone. 
Psa 71:17 God, You have taught me from my youth, and I still proclaim Your wonderful works. 
Psa 71:18 Even when I am old and gray, God, do not abandon me. Then I will proclaim Your power to another generation, Your strength to all who are to come.
Psa 71:19 Your righteousness reaches heaven, God, You who have done great things; God, who is like You? 
Psa 71:20 You caused me to experience many troubles and misfortunes, but You will revive me again. You will bring me up again, even from the depths of the earth. 
Psa 71:21 You will increase my honor and comfort me once again. 
Psa 71:22 Therefore, I will praise You with a harp for Your faithfulness, my God; I will sing to You with a lyre, Holy One of Israel. 
Psa 71:23 My lips will shout for joy when I sing praise to You because You have redeemed me. 
Psa 71:24 Therefore, my tongue will proclaim Your righteousness all day long, for those who seek my harm will be disgraced and confounded.
Psa 72:1 [Solomonic.] God, give Your justice to the king and Your righteousness to the king's son. 
Psa 72:2 He will judge Your people with righteousness and Your afflicted ones with justice. 
Psa 72:3 May the mountains bring prosperity to the people and the hills, righteousness. 
Psa 72:4 May he vindicate the afflicted among the people, help the poor, and crush the oppressor.
Psa 72:5 May he continue while the sun endures and as long as the moon, throughout all generations. 
Psa 72:6 May he be like rain that falls on the cut grass, like spring showers that water the earth. 
Psa 72:7 May the righteous flourish in his days and prosperity abound until the moon is no more.
Psa 72:8 May he rule from sea to sea and from the Euphrates to the ends of the earth. 
Psa 72:9 May desert tribes kneel before him and his enemies lick the dust. 
Psa 72:10 May the kings of Tarshish and the coasts and islands bring tribute, the kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts. 
Psa 72:11 Let all kings bow down to him, all nations serve him. 
Psa 72:12 For he will rescue the poor who cry out and the afflicted who have no helper. 
Psa 72:13 He will have pity on the poor and helpless and save the lives of the poor.
Psa 72:14 He will redeem them from oppression and violence, for their lives are precious in his sight. 
Psa 72:15 May he live long! May gold from Sheba be given to him. May prayer be offered for him continually, and may he be blessed all day long. 
Psa 72:16 May there be plenty of grain in the land; may it wave on the tops of the mountains. May its crops be like Lebanon. May people flourish in the cities like the grass of the field. 
Psa 72:17 May his name endure forever; as long as the sun shines, may his fame increase. May all nations be blessed by him and call him blessed. 
Psa 72:18 May the LORD God, the God of Israel, who alone does wonders, be praised. 
Psa 72:19 May His glorious name be praised forever; the whole earth is filled with His glory. Amen and amen. 
Psa 72:20 The prayers of David son of Jesse are concluded.
Psa 73:1 [A psalm of Asaph.] God is indeed good to Israel, to the pure in heart. 
Psa 73:2 But as for me, my feet almost slipped; my steps nearly went astray. 
Psa 73:3 For I envied the arrogant; I saw the prosperity of the wicked. 
Psa 73:4 They have an easy time until they die, and their bodies are well fed. 
Psa 73:5 They are not in trouble like others; they are not afflicted like most people. 
Psa 73:6 Therefore, pride is their necklace, and violence covers them like a garment.
Psa 73:7 Their eyes bulge out from fatness; the imaginations of their hearts run wild. 
Psa 73:8 They mock, and they speak maliciously; they arrogantly threaten oppression. 
Psa 73:9 They set their mouths against heaven, and their tongues strut across the earth. 
Psa 73:10 Therefore His people turn to them and drink in their overflowing words. 
Psa 73:11 The wicked say, "How can God know? Does the Most High know everything?" 
Psa 73:12 Look at them-- the wicked! They are always at ease, and they increase their wealth.
Psa 73:13 Did I purify my heart and wash my hands in innocence for nothing? 
Psa 73:14 For I am afflicted all day long and punished every morning. 
Psa 73:15 If I had decided to say these things aloud, I would have betrayed Your people. 
Psa 73:16 When I tried to understand all this, it seemed hopeless 
Psa 73:17 until I entered God's sanctuary. Then I understood their destiny. 
Psa 73:18 Indeed, You put them in slippery places; You make them fall into ruin. 
Psa 73:19 How suddenly they become a desolation! They come to an end, swept away by terrors.
Psa 73:20 Like one waking from a dream, Lord, when arising, You will despise their image.
Psa 73:21 When I became embittered and my innermost being was wounded, 
Psa 73:22 I was stupid and didn't understand; I was an unthinking animal toward You. 
Psa 73:23 Yet I am always with You; You hold my right hand. 
Psa 73:24 You guide me with Your counsel, and afterward You will take me up in glory. 
Psa 73:25 Who do I have in heaven but You? And I desire nothing on earth but You. 
Psa 73:26 My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart, my portion forever. 
Psa 73:27 Those far from You will certainly perish; You destroy all who are unfaithful to You. 
Psa 73:28 But as for me, God's presence is my good. I have made the Lord GOD my refuge, so I can tell about all You do.
Psa 74:1 [A Maskil of Asaph.] Why have You rejected us forever, God? Why does Your anger burn against the sheep of Your pasture? 
Psa 74:2 Remember Your congregation, which You purchased long ago and redeemed as the tribe for Your own possession. Remember Mount Zion where You dwell. 
Psa 74:3 Make Your way to the everlasting ruins, to all that the enemy has destroyed in the sanctuary. 
Psa 74:4 Your adversaries roared in the meeting place where You met with us. They set up their emblems as signs. 
Psa 74:5 It was like men in a thicket of trees, wielding axes, 
Psa 74:6 then smashing all the carvings with hatchets and picks. 
Psa 74:7 They set Your sanctuary on fire; they utterly desecrated the dwelling place of Your name. 
Psa 74:8 They said in their hearts, "Let us oppress them relentlessly." They burned down every place throughout the land where God met with us. 
Psa 74:9 There are no signs for us to see. There is no longer a prophet. And none of us knows how long this will last. 
Psa 74:10 God, how long will the enemy mock? Will the foe insult Your name forever? 
Psa 74:11 Why do You hold back Your hand? Stretch out Your right hand and destroy them! 
Psa 74:12 God my King is from ancient times, performing saving acts on the earth. 
Psa 74:13 You divided the sea with Your strength; You smashed the heads of the sea monsters in the waters; 
Psa 74:14 You crushed the heads of Leviathan; You fed him to the creatures of the desert. 
Psa 74:15 You opened up springs and streams; You dried up ever-flowing rivers. 
Psa 74:16 The day is Yours, also the night; You established the moon and the sun. 
Psa 74:17 You set all the boundaries of the earth; You made summer and winter.
Psa 74:18 Remember this: the enemy has mocked Yahweh, and a foolish people has insulted Your name. 
Psa 74:19 Do not give the life of Your dove to beasts; do not forget the lives of Your poor people forever. 
Psa 74:20 Consider the covenant, for the dark places of the land are full of violence. 
Psa 74:21 Do not let the oppressed turn away in shame; let the poor and needy praise Your name. 
Psa 74:22 Rise up, God, defend Your cause! Remember the insults that fools bring against You all day long.
Psa 74:23 Do not forget the clamor of Your adversaries, the tumult of Your opponents that goes up constantly.
Psa 75:1 [For the choir director: "Do Not Destroy." A psalm of Asaph. A song.] We give thanks to You, God; we give thanks to You, for Your name is near. People tell about Your wonderful works. 
Psa 75:2 "When I choose a time, I will judge fairly. 
Psa 75:3 When the earth and all its inhabitants shake, I am the One who steadies its pillars. [Selah] 
Psa 75:4 I say to the boastful, 'Do not boast,' and to the wicked, 'Do not lift up your horn. 
Psa 75:5 Do not lift up your horn against heaven or speak arrogantly.'" 
Psa 75:6 Exaltation does not come from the east, the west, or the desert,
Psa 75:7 for God is the Judge: He brings down one and exalts another. 
Psa 75:8 For there is a cup in the LORD's hand, full of wine blended with spices, and He pours from it. All the wicked of the earth will drink, draining it to the dregs. 
Psa 75:9 As for me, I will tell about Him forever; I will sing praise to the God of Jacob. 
Psa 75:10 "I will cut off all the horns of the wicked, but the horns of the righteous will be lifted up."
Psa 76:1 [For the choir director: with stringed instruments. A psalm of Asaph. A song.] God is known in Judah; His name is great in Israel. 
Psa 76:2 His tent is in Salem, His dwelling place in Zion. 
Psa 76:3 There He shatters the bow's flaming arrows, the shield, the sword, and the weapons of war. [Selah]
Psa 76:4 You are resplendent and majestic coming down from the mountains of prey. 
Psa 76:5 The brave-hearted have been plundered; they have slipped into their final sleep. None of the warriors was able to lift a hand. 
Psa 76:6 At Your rebuke, God of Jacob, both chariot and horse lay still. 
Psa 76:7 And You-- You are to be feared. When You are angry, who can stand before You?
Psa 76:8 From heaven You pronounced judgment. The earth feared and grew quiet 
Psa 76:9 when God rose up to judge and to save all the lowly of the earth.[Selah] 
Psa 76:10 Even human wrath will praise You; You will clothe Yourself with their remaining wrath. 
Psa 76:11 Make and keep your vows to the LORD your God; let all who are around Him bring tribute to the awe-inspiring One. 
Psa 76:12 He humbles the spirit of leaders; He is feared by the kings of the earth.
Psa 77:1 [For the choir director: according to Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A psalm.] I cry aloud to God, aloud to God, and He will hear me. 
Psa 77:2 I sought the Lord in my day of trouble. My hands were continually lifted up all night long; I refused to be comforted. 
Psa 77:3 I think of God; I groan; I meditate; my spirit becomes weak. [Selah] 
Psa 77:4 You have kept me from closing my eyes; I am troubled and cannot speak. 
Psa 77:5 I consider days of old, years long past. 
Psa 77:6 At night I remember my music; I meditate in my heart, and my spirit ponders. 
Psa 77:7 "Will the Lord reject forever and never again show favor? 
Psa 77:8 Has His faithful love ceased forever? Is His promise at an end for all generations? 
Psa 77:9 Has God forgotten to be gracious? Has He in anger withheld His compassion?"[Selah]
Psa 77:10 So I say, "I am grieved that the right hand of the Most High has changed." 
Psa 77:11 I will remember the LORD's works; yes, I will remember Your ancient wonders. 
Psa 77:12 I will reflect on all You have done and meditate on Your actions. 
Psa 77:13 God, Your way is holy. What god is great like God? 
Psa 77:14 You are the God who works wonders; You revealed Your strength among the peoples.
Psa 77:15 With power You redeemed Your people, the descendants of Jacob and Joseph.[Selah]
Psa 77:16 The waters saw You, God. The waters saw You; they trembled. Even the depths shook.
Psa 77:17 The clouds poured down water. The storm clouds thundered; Your arrows flashed back and forth. 
Psa 77:18 The sound of Your thunder was in the whirlwind; lightning lit up the world. The earth shook and quaked. 
Psa 77:19 Your way went through the sea and Your path through the great waters, but Your footprints were unseen.
Psa 77:20 You led Your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
Psa 78:1 [A Maskil of Asaph.] My people, hear my instruction; listen to what I say. 
Psa 78:2 I will declare wise sayings; I will speak mysteries from the past--
Psa 78:3 things we have heard and known and that our fathers have passed down to us. 
Psa 78:4 We must not hide them from their children, but must tell a future generation the praises of the LORD, His might, and the wonderful works He has performed. 
Psa 78:5 He established a testimony in Jacob and set up a law in Israel, which He commanded our fathers to teach to their children 
Psa 78:6 so that a future generation-- children yet to be born-- might know. They were to rise and tell their children
Psa 78:7 so that they might put their confidence in God and not forget God's works, but keep His commands. 
Psa 78:8 Then they would not be like their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation whose heart was not loyal and whose spirit was not faithful to God. 
Psa 78:9 The Ephraimite archers turned back on the day of battle. 
Psa 78:10 They did not keep God's covenant and refused to live by His law. 
Psa 78:11 They forgot what He had done, the wonderful works He had shown them. 
Psa 78:12 He worked wonders in the sight of their fathers in the land of Egypt, the region of Zoan. 
Psa 78:13 He split the sea and brought them across; the water stood firm like a wall. 
Psa 78:14 He led them with a cloud by day and with a fiery light throughout the night. 
Psa 78:15 He split rocks in the wilderness and gave them drink as abundant as the depths. 
Psa 78:16 He brought streams out of the stone and made water flow down like rivers. 
Psa 78:17 But they continued to sin against Him, rebelling in the desert against the Most High. 
Psa 78:18 They deliberately tested God, demanding the food they craved. 
Psa 78:19 They spoke against God, saying, "Is God able to provide food in the wilderness?
Psa 78:20 Look! He struck the rock and water gushed out; torrents overflowed. But can He also provide bread or furnish meat for His people?" 
Psa 78:21 Therefore, the LORD heard and became furious; then fire broke out against Jacob, and anger flared up against Israel 
Psa 78:22 because they did not believe God or rely on His salvation. 
Psa 78:23 He gave a command to the clouds above and opened the doors of heaven. 
Psa 78:24 He rained manna for them to eat; He gave them grain from heaven. 
Psa 78:25 People ate the bread of angels. He sent them an abundant supply of food. 
Psa 78:26 He made the east wind blow in the skies and drove the south wind by His might. 
Psa 78:27 He rained meat on them like dust, and winged birds like the sand of the seas.
Psa 78:28 He made them fall in His camp, all around His tent. 
Psa 78:29 They ate and were completely satisfied, for He gave them what they craved.
Psa 78:30 Before they had satisfied their desire, while the food was still in their mouths,
Psa 78:31 God's anger flared up against them, and He killed some of their best men. He struck down Israel's choice young men. 
Psa 78:32 Despite all this, they kept sinning and did not believe His wonderful works. 
Psa 78:33 He made their days end in futility, their years in sudden disaster. 
Psa 78:34 When He killed some of them, the rest began to seek Him; they repented and searched for God. 
Psa 78:35 They remembered that God was their rock, the Most High God, their Redeemer. 
Psa 78:36 But they deceived Him with their mouths, they lied to Him with their tongues, 
Psa 78:37 their hearts were insincere toward Him, and they were unfaithful to His covenant. 
Psa 78:38 Yet He was compassionate; He atoned for their guilt and did not destroy them. He often turned His anger aside and did not unleash all His wrath. 
Psa 78:39 He remembered that they were only flesh, a wind that passes and does not return. 
Psa 78:40 How often they rebelled against Him in the wilderness and grieved Him in the desert.
Psa 78:41 They constantly tested God and provoked the Holy One of Israel. 
Psa 78:42 They did not remember His power shown on the day He redeemed them from the foe, 
Psa 78:43 when He performed His miraculous signs in Egypt and His wonders in the region of Zoan. 
Psa 78:44 He turned their rivers into blood, and they could not drink from their streams. 
Psa 78:45 He sent among them swarms of flies, which fed on them, and frogs, which devastated them. 
Psa 78:46 He gave their crops to the caterpillar and the fruit of their labor to the locust. 
Psa 78:47 He killed their vines with hail and their sycamore fig trees with a flood.
Psa 78:48 He handed over their livestock to hail and their cattle to lightning bolts. 
Psa 78:49 He sent His burning anger against them: fury, indignation, and calamity-- a band of deadly messengers.
Psa 78:50 He cleared a path for His anger. He did not spare them from death but delivered their lives to the plague. 
Psa 78:51 He struck all the firstborn in Egypt, the first progeny of the tents of Ham. 
Psa 78:52 He led His people out like sheep and guided them like a flock in the wilderness. 
Psa 78:53 He led them safely, and they were not afraid; but the sea covered their enemies. 
Psa 78:54 He brought them to His holy land, to the mountain His right hand acquired. 
Psa 78:55 He drove out nations before them. He apportioned their inheritance by lot and settled the tribes of Israel in their tents. 
Psa 78:56 But they rebelliously tested the Most High God, for they did not keep His decrees. 
Psa 78:57 They treacherously turned away like their fathers; they became warped like a faulty bow. 
Psa 78:58 They enraged Him with their high places and provoked His jealousy with their carved images. 
Psa 78:59 God heard and became furious; He completely rejected Israel. 
Psa 78:60 He abandoned the tabernacle at Shiloh, the tent where He resided among men. 
Psa 78:61 He gave up His strength to captivity and His splendor to the hand of a foe. 
Psa 78:62 He surrendered His people to the sword because He was enraged with His heritage. 
Psa 78:63 Fire consumed His chosen young men, and His young women had no wedding songs.
Psa 78:64 His priests fell by the sword, but the widows could not lament. 
Psa 78:65 Then the Lord awoke as if from sleep, like a warrior from the effects of wine. 
Psa 78:66 He beat back His foes; He gave them lasting shame. 
Psa 78:67 He rejected the tent of Joseph and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.
Psa 78:68 He chose instead the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which He loved. 
Psa 78:69 He built His sanctuary like the heights, like the earth that He established forever. 
Psa 78:70 He chose David His servant and took him from the sheepfolds; 
Psa 78:71 He brought him from tending ewes to be shepherd over His people Jacob-- over Israel, His inheritance.
Psa 78:72 He shepherded them with a pure heart and guided them with his skillful hands.
Psa 79:1 [A psalm of Asaph.] God, the nations have invaded Your inheritance, desecrated Your holy temple, and turned Jerusalem into ruins. 
Psa 79:2 They gave the corpses of Your servants to the birds of the sky for food, the flesh of Your godly ones to the beasts of the earth. 
Psa 79:3 They poured out their blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there was no one to bury them. 
Psa 79:4 We have become an object of reproach to our neighbors, a source of mockery and ridicule to those around us. 
Psa 79:5 How long, Yahweh? Will You be angry forever? Will Your jealousy keep burning like fire? 
Psa 79:6 Pour out Your wrath on the nations that don't acknowledge You, on the kingdoms that don't call on Your name, 
Psa 79:7 for they have devoured Jacob and devastated his homeland. 
Psa 79:8 Do not hold past sins against us; let Your compassion come to us quickly, for we have become weak. 
Psa 79:9 God of our salvation, help us-- for the glory of Your name. Deliver us and atone for our sins, because of Your name.
Psa 79:10 Why should the nations ask, "Where is their God?" Before our eyes, let vengeance for the shed blood of Your servants be known among the nations. 
Psa 79:11 Let the groans of the prisoners reach You; according to Your great power, preserve those condemned to die. 
Psa 79:12 Pay back sevenfold to our neighbors the reproach they have hurled at You, Lord. 
Psa 79:13 Then we, Your people, the sheep of Your pasture, will thank You forever; we will declare Your praise to generation after generation.
Psa 80:1 [For the choir director: according to "The Lilies." A testimony of Asaph. A psalm.] Listen, Shepherd of Israel, who leads Joseph like a flock; You who sit enthroned on the cherubim, rise up
Psa 80:2 before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh. Rally Your power and come to save us. 
Psa 80:3 Restore us, God; look on us with favor, and we will be saved. 
Psa 80:4 LORD God of Hosts, how long will You be angry with Your people's prayers? 
Psa 80:5 You fed them the bread of tears and gave them a full measure of tears to drink.
Psa 80:6 You make us quarrel with our neighbors; our enemies make fun of us. 
Psa 80:7 Restore us, God of Hosts; look on us with favor, and we will be saved. 
Psa 80:8 You uprooted a vine from Egypt; You drove out the nations and planted it. 
Psa 80:9 You cleared a place for it; it took root and filled the land. 
Psa 80:10 The mountains were covered by its shade, and the mighty cedars with its branches. 
Psa 80:11 It sent out sprouts toward the Sea and shoots toward the River. 
Psa 80:12 Why have You broken down its walls so that all who pass by pick its fruit? 
Psa 80:13 The boar from the forest tears it and creatures of the field feed on it. 
Psa 80:14 Return, God of Hosts. Look down from heaven and see; take care of this vine, 
Psa 80:15 the root Your right hand has planted, the shoot that You made strong for Yourself. 
Psa 80:16 It was cut down and burned up; they perish at the rebuke of Your countenance. 
Psa 80:17 Let Your hand be with the man at Your right hand, with the son of man You have made strong for Yourself. 
Psa 80:18 Then we will not turn away from You; revive us, and we will call on Your name. 
Psa 80:19 Restore us, Yahweh, the God of Hosts; look on us with favor, and we will be saved.
Psa 81:1 [For the choir director: on the Gittith. Of Asaph.] Sing for joy to God our strength; shout in triumph to the God of Jacob. 
Psa 81:2 Lift up a song-- play the tambourine, the melodious lyre, and the harp.
Psa 81:3 Blow the horn on the day of our feasts during the new moon and during the full moon. 
Psa 81:4 For this is a statute for Israel, a judgment of the God of Jacob. 
Psa 81:5 He set it up as an ordinance for Joseph when He went throughout the land of Egypt. I heard an unfamiliar language: 
Psa 81:6 "I relieved his shoulder from the burden; his hands were freed from carrying the basket. 
Psa 81:7 You called out in distress, and I rescued you; I answered you from the thundercloud. I tested you at the waters of Meribah. [Selah] 
Psa 81:8 Listen, My people, and I will admonish you. Israel, if you would only listen to Me! 
Psa 81:9 There must not be a strange god among you; you must not bow down to a foreign god.
Psa 81:10 I am Yahweh your God, who brought you up from the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it. 
Psa 81:11 "But My people did not listen to Me; Israel did not obey Me. 
Psa 81:12 So I gave them over to their stubborn hearts to follow their own plans. 
Psa 81:13 If only My people would listen to Me and Israel would follow My ways, 
Psa 81:14 I would quickly subdue their enemies and turn My hand against their foes." 
Psa 81:15 Those who hate the LORD would pretend submission to Him; their doom would last forever. 
Psa 81:16 But He would feed Israel with the best wheat. "I would satisfy you with honey from the rock."
Psa 82:1 [A psalm of Asaph.] God has taken His place in the divine assembly; He judges among the gods: 
Psa 82:2 "How long will you judge unjustly and show partiality to the wicked? [Selah] 
Psa 82:3 Provide justice for the needy and the fatherless; uphold the rights of the oppressed and the destitute.
Psa 82:4 Rescue the poor and needy; save them from the power of the wicked." 
Psa 82:5 They do not know or understand; they wander in darkness. All the foundations of the earth are shaken.
Psa 82:6 I said, "You are gods; you are all sons of the Most High. 
Psa 82:7 However, you will die like men and fall like any other ruler." 
Psa 82:8 Rise up, God, judge the earth, for all the nations belong to You.
Psa 83:1 [A song. A psalm of Asaph.] God, do not keep silent. Do not be deaf, God; do not be idle. 
Psa 83:2 See how Your enemies make an uproar; those who hate You have acted arrogantly. 
Psa 83:3 They devise clever schemes against Your people; they conspire against Your treasured ones. 
Psa 83:4 They say, "Come, let us wipe them out as a nation so that Israel's name will no longer be remembered."
Psa 83:5 For they have conspired with one mind; they form an alliance against You--
Psa 83:6 the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites, 
Psa 83:7 Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek, Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre. 
Psa 83:8 Even Assyria has joined them; they lend support to the sons of Lot. [Selah] 
Psa 83:9 Deal with them as You did with Midian, as You did with Sisera and Jabin at the Kishon River. 
Psa 83:10 They were destroyed at En-dor; they became manure for the ground. 
Psa 83:11 Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, and all their tribal leaders like Zebah and Zalmunna,
Psa 83:12 who said, "Let us seize God's pastures for ourselves." 
Psa 83:13 Make them like tumbleweed, my God, like straw before the wind. 
Psa 83:14 As fire burns a forest, as a flame blazes through mountains, 
Psa 83:15 so pursue them with Your tempest and terrify them with Your storm. 
Psa 83:16 Cover their faces with shame so that they will seek Your name Yahweh. 
Psa 83:17 Let them be put to shame and terrified forever; let them perish in disgrace. 
Psa 83:18 May they know that You alone-- whose name is Yahweh-- are the Most High over all the earth.
Psa 84:1 [For the choir director: on the Gittith. A psalm of the sons of Korah.] How lovely is Your dwelling place, LORD of Hosts. 
Psa 84:2 I long and yearn for the courts of the LORD; my heart and flesh cry out for the living God. 
Psa 84:3 Even a sparrow finds a home, and a swallow, a nest for herself where she places her young-- near Your altars, LORD of Hosts, my King and my God.
Psa 84:4 How happy are those who reside in Your house, who praise You continually. [Selah] 
Psa 84:5 Happy are the people whose strength is in You, whose hearts are set on pilgrimage. 
Psa 84:6 As they pass through the Valley of Baca, they make it a source of springwater; even the autumn rain will cover it with blessings. 
Psa 84:7 They go from strength to strength; each appears before God in Zion. 
Psa 84:8 LORD God of Hosts, hear my prayer; listen, God of Jacob.[Selah] 
Psa 84:9 Consider our shield, God; look on the face of Your anointed one.
Psa 84:10 Better a day in Your courts than a thousand anywhere else. I would rather be at the door of the house of my God than to live in the tents of wicked people. 
Psa 84:11 For the LORD God is a sun and shield. The LORD gives grace and glory; He does not withhold the good from those who live with integrity. 
Psa 84:12 Happy is the person who trusts in You, LORD of Hosts!

Psa 86:1 [A Davidic prayer.] Listen, LORD, and answer me, for I am poor and needy.

Psa 86:3 Be gracious to me, Lord, for I call to You all day long. 
Psa 86:4 Bring joy to Your servant's life, because I turn to You, Lord. 
Psa 86:5 For You, Lord, are kind and ready to forgive, rich in faithful love to all who call on You. 
Psa 86:6 LORD, hear my prayer; listen to my plea for mercy. 
Psa 86:7 I call on You in the day of my distress, for You will answer me. 
Psa 86:8 Lord, there is no one like You among the gods, and there are no works like Yours. 
Psa 86:9 All the nations You have made will come and bow down before You, Lord, and will honor Your name. 
Psa 86:10 For You are great and perform wonders; You alone are God. 
Psa 86:11 Teach me Your way, Yahweh, and I will live by Your truth. Give me an undivided mind to fear Your name. 
Psa 86:12 I will praise You with all my heart, Lord my God, and will honor Your name forever. 
Psa 86:13 For Your faithful love for me is great, and You deliver my life from the depths of Sheol.

Psa 86:15 But You, Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger and rich in faithful love and truth. 
Psa 86:16 Turn to me and be gracious to me. Give Your strength to Your servant; save the son of Your female servant. 
Psa 86:17 Show me a sign of Your goodness; my enemies will see and be put to shame because You, LORD, have helped and comforted me.

Psa 88:1 [A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah. For the choir director: according to Mahalath Leannoth. A Maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.] LORD, God of my salvation, I cry out before You day and night. 
Psa 88:2 May my prayer reach Your presence; listen to my cry. 
Psa 88:3 For I have had enough troubles, and my life is near Sheol. 
Psa 88:4 I am counted among those going down to the Pit. I am like a man without strength, 
Psa 88:5 abandoned among the dead. I am like the slain lying in the grave, whom You no longer remember, and who are cut off from Your care.
Psa 88:6 You have put me in the lowest part of the Pit, in the darkest places, in the depths. 
Psa 88:7 Your wrath weighs heavily on me; You have overwhelmed me with all Your waves. [Selah] 
Psa 88:8 You have distanced my friends from me; You have made me repulsive to them. I am shut in and cannot go out. 
Psa 88:9 My eyes are worn out from crying. LORD, I cry out to You all day long; I spread out my hands to You. 
Psa 88:10 Do You work wonders for the dead? Do departed spirits rise up to praise You?[Selah] 
Psa 88:11 Will Your faithful love be declared in the grave, Your faithfulness in Abaddon? 
Psa 88:12 Will Your wonders be known in the darkness or Your righteousness in the land of oblivion? 
Psa 88:13 But I call to You for help, LORD; in the morning my prayer meets You. 
Psa 88:14 LORD, why do You reject me? Why do You hide Your face from me? 
Psa 88:15 From my youth, I have been afflicted and near death. I suffer Your horrors; I am desperate. 
Psa 88:16 Your wrath sweeps over me; Your terrors destroy me. 
Psa 88:17 They surround me like water all day long; they close in on me from every side. 
Psa 88:18 You have distanced loved one and neighbor from me; darkness is my only friend.
Psa 89:1 [A Maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.] I will sing about the LORD's faithful love forever; I will proclaim Your faithfulness to all generations with my mouth. 
Psa 89:2 For I will declare, "Faithful love is built up forever; You establish Your faithfulness in the heavens." 
Psa 89:3 The LORD said, "I have made a covenant with My chosen one; I have sworn an oath to David My servant:
Psa 89:4 'I will make your offspring endure forever and establish your throne for all generations.'" [Selah] 
Psa 89:5 LORD, the heavens praise Your wonders-- Your faithfulness also-- in the assembly of the holy ones.
Psa 89:6 For who in the skies can compare with the LORD? Who among the heavenly beings is like the LORD?
Psa 89:7 God is greatly feared in the council of the holy ones, more awe-inspiring than all who surround Him.
Psa 89:8 LORD God of Hosts, who is strong like You, LORD? Your faithfulness surrounds You. 
Psa 89:9 You rule the raging sea; when its waves surge, You still them. 
Psa 89:10 You crushed Rahab like one who is slain; You scattered Your enemies with Your powerful arm. 
Psa 89:11 The heavens are Yours; the earth also is Yours. The world and everything in it-- You founded them.
Psa 89:12 North and south-- You created them. Tabor and Hermon shout for joy at Your name.
Psa 89:13 You have a mighty arm; Your hand is powerful; Your right hand is lifted high.
Psa 89:14 Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne; faithful love and truth go before You.
Psa 89:15 Happy are the people who know the joyful shout; Yahweh, they walk in the light of Your presence.
Psa 89:16 They rejoice in Your name all day long, and they are exalted by Your righteousness. 
Psa 89:17 For You are their magnificent strength; by Your favor our horn is exalted. 
Psa 89:18 Surely our shield belongs to the LORD, our king to the Holy One of Israel. 
Psa 89:19 You once spoke in a vision to Your loyal ones and said: "I have granted help to a warrior; I have exalted one chosen from the people. 
Psa 89:20 I have found David My servant; I have anointed him with My sacred oil. 
Psa 89:21 My hand will always be with him, and My arm will strengthen him. 
Psa 89:22 The enemy will not afflict him; no wicked man will oppress him.
Psa 89:23 I will crush his foes before him and strike those who hate him.
Psa 89:24 My faithfulness and love will be with him, and through My name his horn will be exalted. 
Psa 89:25 I will extend his power to the sea and his right hand to the rivers. 
Psa 89:26 He will call to Me, 'You are my Father, my God, the rock of my salvation.' 
Psa 89:27 I will also make him My firstborn, greatest of the kings of the earth.
Psa 89:28 I will always preserve My faithful love for him, and My covenant with him will endure. 
Psa 89:29 I will establish his line forever, his throne as long as heaven lasts. 
Psa 89:30 If his sons forsake My instruction and do not live by My ordinances, 
Psa 89:31 if they dishonor My statutes and do not keep My commands, 
Psa 89:32 then I will call their rebellion to account with the rod, their sin with blows. 
Psa 89:33 But I will not withdraw My faithful love from him or betray My faithfulness.
Psa 89:34 I will not violate My covenant or change what My lips have said. 
Psa 89:35 Once and for all I have sworn an oath by My holiness; I will not lie to David.
Psa 89:36 His offspring will continue forever, his throne like the sun before Me, 
Psa 89:37 like the moon, established forever, a faithful witness in the sky."[Selah] 
Psa 89:38 But You have spurned and rejected him; You have become enraged with Your anointed. 
Psa 89:39 You have repudiated the covenant with Your servant; You have completely dishonored his crown. 
Psa 89:40 You have broken down all his walls; You have reduced his fortified cities to ruins. 
Psa 89:41 All who pass by plunder him; he has become an object of ridicule to his neighbors.
Psa 89:42 You have lifted high the right hand of his foes; You have made all his enemies rejoice. 
Psa 89:43 You have also turned back his sharp sword and have not let him stand in battle. 
Psa 89:44 You have made his splendor cease and have overturned his throne. 
Psa 89:45 You have shortened the days of his youth; You have covered him with shame.[Selah] 
Psa 89:46 How long, LORD? Will You hide Yourself forever? Will Your anger keep burning like fire? 
Psa 89:47 Remember how short my life is. Have You created everyone for nothing? 
Psa 89:48 What man can live and never see death? Who can save himself from the power of Sheol?[Selah] 
Psa 89:49 Lord, where are the former acts of Your faithful love that You swore to David in Your faithfulness? 
Psa 89:50 Remember, Lord, the ridicule against Your servants-- in my heart I carry abuse from all the peoples--
Psa 89:51 how Your enemies have ridiculed, LORD, how they have ridiculed every step of Your anointed. 
Psa 89:52 May the LORD be praised forever. Amen and amen.
Psa 90:1 [A prayer of Moses, the man of God.] Lord, You have been our refuge in every generation.
Psa 90:2 Before the mountains were born, before You gave birth to the earth and the world, from eternity to eternity, You are God. 
Psa 90:3 You return mankind to the dust, saying, "Return, descendants of Adam." 
Psa 90:4 For in Your sight a thousand years are like yesterday that passes by, like a few hours of the night. 
Psa 90:5 You end their lives; they sleep. They are like grass that grows in the morning--
Psa 90:6 in the morning it sprouts and grows; by evening it withers and dries up. 
Psa 90:7 For we are consumed by Your anger; we are terrified by Your wrath. 
Psa 90:8 You have set our unjust ways before You, our secret sins in the light of Your presence. 
Psa 90:9 For all our days ebb away under Your wrath; we end our years like a sigh. 
Psa 90:10 Our lives last seventy years or, if we are strong, eighty years. Even the best of them are struggle and sorrow; indeed, they pass quickly and we fly away. 
Psa 90:11 Who understands the power of Your anger? Your wrath matches the fear that is due You. 
Psa 90:12 Teach us to number our days carefully so that we may develop wisdom in our hearts.
Psa 90:13 LORD-- how long? Turn and have compassion on Your servants.
Psa 90:14 Satisfy us in the morning with Your faithful love so that we may shout with joy and be glad all our days. 
Psa 90:15 Make us rejoice for as many days as You have humbled us, for as many years as we have seen adversity. 
Psa 90:16 Let Your work be seen by Your servants, and Your splendor by their children. 
Psa 90:17 Let the favor of the Lord our God be on us; establish for us the work of our hands-- establish the work of our hands!
Psa 91:1 The one who lives under the protection of the Most High dwells in the shadow of the Almighty. 
Psa 91:2 I will say to the LORD, "My refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust." 
Psa 91:3 He Himself will deliver you from the hunter's net, from the destructive plague. 
Psa 91:4 He will cover you with His feathers; you will take refuge under His wings. His faithfulness will be a protective shield. 
Psa 91:5 You will not fear the terror of the night, the arrow that flies by day,
Psa 91:6 the plague that stalks in darkness, or the pestilence that ravages at noon. 
Psa 91:7 Though a thousand fall at your side and ten thousand at your right hand, the pestilence will not reach you. 
Psa 91:8 You will only see it with your eyes and witness the punishment of the wicked. 
Psa 91:9 Because you have made the LORD-- my refuge, the Most High-- your dwelling place,
Psa 91:10 no harm will come to you; no plague will come near your tent. 
Psa 91:11 For He will give His angels orders concerning you, to protect you in all your ways. 
Psa 91:12 They will support you with their hands so that you will not strike your foot against a stone. 
Psa 91:13 You will tread on the lion and the cobra; you will trample the young lion and the serpent.
Psa 91:14 Because he is lovingly devoted to Me, I will deliver him; I will protect him because he knows My name. 
Psa 91:15 When he calls out to Me, I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble. I will rescue him and give him honor. 
Psa 91:16 I will satisfy him with a long life and show him My salvation.

Psa 97:1 The LORD reigns! Let the earth rejoice; let the many coasts and islands be glad. 
Psa 97:2 Clouds and thick darkness surround Him; righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne. 
Psa 97:3 Fire goes before Him and burns up His foes on every side. 
Psa 97:4 His lightning lights up the world; the earth sees and trembles. 
Psa 97:5 The mountains melt like wax at the presence of the LORD-- at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.
Psa 97:6 The heavens proclaim His righteousness; all the peoples see His glory. 
Psa 97:7 All who serve carved images, those who boast in idols, will be put to shame. All the gods must worship Him. 
Psa 97:8 Zion hears and is glad, and the towns of Judah rejoice because of Your judgments, LORD. 
Psa 97:9 For You, LORD, are the Most High over all the earth; You are exalted above all the gods. 
Psa 97:10 You who love the LORD, hate evil! He protects the lives of His godly ones; He rescues them from the power of the wicked. 
Psa 97:11 Light dawns for the righteous, gladness for the upright in heart.

Psa 101:1 [A Davidic psalm.] I will sing of faithful love and justice; I will sing praise to You, LORD. 
Psa 101:2 I will pay attention to the way of integrity. When will You come to me? I will live with a heart of integrity in my house. 
Psa 101:3 I will not set anything worthless before my eyes. I hate the practice of transgression; it will not cling to me. 
Psa 101:4 A devious heart will be far from me; I will not be involved with evil. 
Psa 101:5 I will destroy anyone who secretly slanders his neighbor; I cannot tolerate anyone with haughty eyes or an arrogant heart. 
Psa 101:6 My eyes favor the faithful of the land so that they may sit down with me. The one who follows the way of integrity may serve me. 
Psa 101:7 No one who acts deceitfully will live in my palace; no one who tells lies will remain in my presence. 
Psa 101:8 Every morning I will destroy all the wicked of the land, eliminating all evildoers from the LORD's city.
Psa 102:1 [A prayer of an afflicted person who is weak and pours out his lament before the Lord.] LORD, hear my prayer; let my cry for help come before You. 
Psa 102:2 Do not hide Your face from me in my day of trouble. Listen closely to me; answer me quickly when I call. 
Psa 102:3 For my days vanish like smoke, and my bones burn like a furnace. 
Psa 102:4 My heart is afflicted, withered like grass; I even forget to eat my food. 
Psa 102:5 Because of the sound of my groaning, my flesh sticks to my bones. 
Psa 102:6 I am like a desert owl, like an owl among the ruins. 
Psa 102:7 I stay awake; I am like a solitary bird on a roof. 
Psa 102:8 My enemies taunt me all day long; they ridicule and curse me. 
Psa 102:9 I eat ashes like bread and mingle my drinks with tears 
Psa 102:10 because of Your indignation and wrath; for You have picked me up and thrown me aside. 
Psa 102:11 My days are like a lengthening shadow, and I wither away like grass. 
Psa 102:12 But You, LORD, are enthroned forever; Your fame endures to all generations. 
Psa 102:13 You will rise up and have compassion on Zion, for it is time to show favor to her-- the appointed time has come.
Psa 102:14 For Your servants take delight in its stones and favor its dust. 
Psa 102:15 Then the nations will fear the name of Yahweh, and all the kings of the earth Your glory, 
Psa 102:16 for the LORD will rebuild Zion; He will appear in His glory. 
Psa 102:17 He will pay attention to the prayer of the destitute and will not despise their prayer. 
Psa 102:18 This will be written for a later generation, and a newly created people will praise the LORD: 
Psa 102:19 He looked down from His holy heights-- the LORD gazed out from heaven to earth--
Psa 102:20 to hear a prisoner's groaning, to set free those condemned to die, 
Psa 102:21 so that they might declare the name of Yahweh in Zion and His praise in Jerusalem, 
Psa 102:22 when peoples and kingdoms are assembled to serve the LORD. 
Psa 102:23 He has broken my strength in midcourse; He has shortened my days. 
Psa 102:24 I say: "My God, do not take me in the middle of my life! Your years continue through all generations. 
Psa 102:25 Long ago You established the earth, and the heavens are the work of Your hands. 
Psa 102:26 They will perish, but You will endure; all of them will wear out like clothing. You will change them like a garment, and they will pass away. 
Psa 102:27 But You are the same, and Your years will never end. 
Psa 102:28 Your servants' children will dwell securely, and their offspring will be established before You."
Psa 103:1 [Davidic.] My soul, praise Yahweh, and all that is within me, praise His holy name. 
Psa 103:2 My soul, praise the LORD, and do not forget all His benefits. 
Psa 103:3 He forgives all your sin; He heals all your diseases. 
Psa 103:4 He redeems your life from the Pit; He crowns you with faithful love and compassion. 
Psa 103:5 He satisfies you with goodness; your youth is renewed like the eagle. 
Psa 103:6 The LORD executes acts of righteousness and justice for all the oppressed. 
Psa 103:7 He revealed His ways to Moses, His deeds to the people of Israel. 
Psa 103:8 The LORD is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger and rich in faithful love.
Psa 103:9 He will not always accuse us or be angry forever. 
Psa 103:10 He has not dealt with us as our sins deserve or repaid us according to our offenses. 
Psa 103:11 For as high as the heavens are above the earth, so great is His faithful love toward those who fear Him. 
Psa 103:12 As far as the east is from the west, so far has He removed our transgressions from us. 
Psa 103:13 As a father has compassion on his children, so the LORD has compassion on those who fear Him. 
Psa 103:14 For He knows what we are made of, remembering that we are dust. 
Psa 103:15 As for man, his days are like grass-- he blooms like a flower of the field;
Psa 103:16 when the wind passes over it, it vanishes, and its place is no longer known. 
Psa 103:17 But from eternity to eternity the LORD's faithful love is toward those who fear Him, and His righteousness toward the grandchildren 
Psa 103:18 of those who keep His covenant, who remember to observe His precepts. 
Psa 103:19 The LORD has established His throne in heaven, and His kingdom rules over all. 
Psa 103:20 Praise the LORD, all His angels of great strength, who do His word, obedient to His command. 
Psa 103:21 Praise the LORD, all His armies, His servants who do His will. 
Psa 103:22 Praise the LORD, all His works in all the places where He rules. My soul, praise Yahweh! 
Psa 104:1 My soul, praise Yahweh! LORD my God, You are very great; You are clothed with majesty and splendor. 
Psa 104:2 He wraps Himself in light as if it were a robe, spreading out the sky like a canopy, 
Psa 104:3 laying the beams of His palace on the waters above, making the clouds His chariot, walking on the wings of the wind, 
Psa 104:4 and making the winds His messengers, flames of fire His servants. 
Psa 104:5 He established the earth on its foundations; it will never be shaken. 
Psa 104:6 You covered it with the deep as if it were a garment; the waters stood above the mountains. 
Psa 104:7 At Your rebuke the waters fled; at the sound of Your thunder they hurried away--
Psa 104:8 mountains rose and valleys sank-- to the place You established for them.
Psa 104:9 You set a boundary they cannot cross; they will never cover the earth again. 
Psa 104:10 He causes the springs to gush into the valleys; they flow between the mountains.
Psa 104:11 They supply water for every wild beast; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
Psa 104:12 The birds of the sky live beside the springs; they sing among the foliage.
Psa 104:13 He waters the mountains from His palace; the earth is satisfied by the fruit of Your labor. 
Psa 104:14 He causes grass to grow for the livestock and provides crops for man to cultivate, producing food from the earth,
Psa 104:15 wine that makes man's heart glad-- making his face shine with oil-- and bread that sustains man's heart.
Psa 104:16 The trees of the LORD flourish, the cedars of Lebanon that He planted. 
Psa 104:17 There the birds make their nests; the stork makes its home in the pine trees. 
Psa 104:18 The high mountains are for the wild goats; the cliffs are a refuge for hyraxes. 
Psa 104:19 He made the moon to mark the festivals; the sun knows when to set. 
Psa 104:20 You bring darkness, and it becomes night, when all the forest animals stir. 
Psa 104:21 The young lions roar for their prey and seek their food from God. 
Psa 104:22 The sun rises; they go back and lie down in their dens. 
Psa 104:23 Man goes out to his work and to his labor until evening. 
Psa 104:24 How countless are Your works, LORD! In wisdom You have made them all; the earth is full of Your creatures. 
Psa 104:25 Here is the sea, vast and wide, teeming with creatures beyond number-- living things both large and small.
Psa 104:26 There the ships move about, and Leviathan, which You formed to play there. 
Psa 104:27 All of them wait for You to give them their food at the right time. 
Psa 104:28 When You give it to them, they gather it; when You open Your hand, they are satisfied with good things.
Psa 104:29 When You hide Your face, they are terrified; when You take away their breath, they die and return to the dust.
Psa 104:30 When You send Your breath, they are created, and You renew the face of the earth. 
Psa 104:31 May the glory of the LORD endure forever; may the LORD rejoice in His works. 
Psa 104:32 He looks at the earth, and it trembles; He touches the mountains, and they pour out smoke. 
Psa 104:33 I will sing to the LORD all my life; I will sing praise to my God while I live. 
Psa 104:34 May my meditation be pleasing to Him; I will rejoice in the LORD. 
Psa 104:35 May sinners vanish from the earth and wicked people be no more. My soul, praise Yahweh! Hallelujah! 
Psa 105:1 Give thanks to Yahweh, call on His name; proclaim His deeds among the peoples. 
Psa 105:2 Sing to Him, sing praise to Him; tell about all His wonderful works! 
Psa 105:3 Honor His holy name; let the hearts of those who seek Yahweh rejoice. 
Psa 105:4 Search for the LORD and for His strength; seek His face always. 
Psa 105:5 Remember the wonderful works He has done, His wonders, and the judgments He has pronounced, 
Psa 105:6 you offspring of Abraham His servant, Jacob's descendants-- His chosen ones.
Psa 105:7 He is the LORD our God; His judgments govern the whole earth. 
Psa 105:8 He remembers His covenant forever, the promise He ordained for a thousand generations--
Psa 105:9 the covenant He made with Abraham, swore to Isaac, 
Psa 105:10 and confirmed to Jacob as a decree and to Israel as an everlasting covenant: 
Psa 105:11 "I will give the land of Canaan to you as your inherited portion." 
Psa 105:12 When they were few in number, very few indeed, and temporary residents in Canaan, 
Psa 105:13 wandering from nation to nation and from one kingdom to another, 
Psa 105:14 He allowed no one to oppress them; He rebuked kings on their behalf: 
Psa 105:15 "Do not touch My anointed ones, or harm My prophets." 
Psa 105:16 He called down famine against the land and destroyed the entire food supply. 
Psa 105:17 He had sent a man ahead of them-- Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
Psa 105:18 They hurt his feet with shackles; his neck was put in an iron collar. 
Psa 105:19 Until the time his prediction came true, the word of the LORD tested him.
Psa 105:20 The king sent for him and released him; the ruler of peoples set him free. 
Psa 105:21 He made him master of his household, ruler over all his possessions--
Psa 105:22 binding his officials at will and instructing his elders. 
Psa 105:23 Then Israel went to Egypt; Jacob lived as a foreigner in the land of Ham.
Psa 105:24 The LORD made His people very fruitful; He made them more numerous than their foes, 
Psa 105:25 whose hearts He turned to hate His people and to deal deceptively with His servants. 
Psa 105:26 He sent Moses His servant, and Aaron, whom He had chosen. 
Psa 105:27 They performed His miraculous signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham. 
Psa 105:28 He sent darkness, and it became dark-- for did they not defy His commands?
Psa 105:29 He turned their water into blood and caused their fish to die. 
Psa 105:30 Their land was overrun with frogs, even in their royal chambers. 
Psa 105:31 He spoke, and insects came-- gnats throughout their country.
Psa 105:32 He gave them hail for rain, and lightning throughout their land. 
Psa 105:33 He struck their vines and fig trees and shattered the trees of their territory. 
Psa 105:34 He spoke, and locusts came-- young locusts without number.
Psa 105:35 They devoured all the vegetation in their land and consumed the produce of their land.
Psa 105:36 He struck all the firstborn in their land, all their first progeny. 
Psa 105:37 Then He brought Israel out with silver and gold, and no one among His tribes stumbled.
Psa 105:38 Egypt was glad when they left, for the dread of Israel had fallen on them. 
Psa 105:39 He spread a cloud as a covering and gave a fire to light up the night. 
Psa 105:40 They asked, and He brought quail and satisfied them with bread from heaven. 
Psa 105:41 He opened a rock, and water gushed out; it flowed like a stream in the desert. 
Psa 105:42 For He remembered His holy promise to Abraham His servant. 
Psa 105:43 He brought His people out with rejoicing, His chosen ones with shouts of joy.
Psa 105:44 He gave them the lands of the nations, and they inherited what other peoples had worked for. 
Psa 105:45 All this happened so that they might keep His statutes and obey His instructions. Hallelujah! 
Psa 106:1 Hallelujah! Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; His faithful love endures forever. 
Psa 106:2 Who can declare the LORD's mighty acts or proclaim all the praise due Him? 
Psa 106:3 How happy are those who uphold justice, who practice righteousness at all times. 
Psa 106:4 Remember me, LORD, when You show favor to Your people. Come to me with Your salvation 
Psa 106:5 so that I may enjoy the prosperity of Your chosen ones, rejoice in the joy of Your nation, and boast about Your heritage. 
Psa 106:6 Both we and our fathers have sinned; we have gone astray and have acted wickedly. 
Psa 106:7 Our fathers in Egypt did not grasp the significance of Your wonderful works or remember Your many acts of faithful love; instead, they rebelled by the sea-- the Red Sea.
Psa 106:8 Yet He saved them because of His name, to make His power known. 
Psa 106:9 He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up; He led them through the depths as through a desert. 
Psa 106:10 He saved them from the hand of the adversary; He redeemed them from the hand of the enemy. 
Psa 106:11 Water covered their foes; not one of them remained. 
Psa 106:12 Then they believed His promises and sang His praise. 
Psa 106:13 They soon forgot His works and would not wait for His counsel. 
Psa 106:14 They were seized with craving in the wilderness and tested God in the desert. 
Psa 106:15 He gave them what they asked for, but sent a wasting disease among them. 
Psa 106:16 In the camp they were envious of Moses and of Aaron, the LORD's holy one. 
Psa 106:17 The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan; it covered the assembly of Abiram.
Psa 106:18 Fire blazed throughout their assembly; flames consumed the wicked. 
Psa 106:19 At Horeb they made a calf and worshiped the cast metal image. 
Psa 106:20 They exchanged their glory for the image of a grass-eating ox. 
Psa 106:21 They forgot God their Savior, who did great things in Egypt, 
Psa 106:22 wonderful works in the land of Ham, awe-inspiring acts at the Red Sea. 
Psa 106:23 So He said He would have destroyed them-- if Moses His chosen one had not stood before Him in the breach to turn His wrath away from destroying them.
Psa 106:24 They despised the pleasant land and did not believe His promise. 
Psa 106:25 They grumbled in their tents and did not listen to the LORD's voice. 
Psa 106:26 So He raised His hand against them with an oath that He would make them fall in the desert 
Psa 106:27 and would disperse their descendants among the nations, scattering them throughout the lands. 
Psa 106:28 They aligned themselves with Baal of Peor and ate sacrifices offered to lifeless gods. 
Psa 106:29 They provoked the LORD with their deeds, and a plague broke out against them. 
Psa 106:30 But Phinehas stood up and intervened, and the plague was stopped. 
Psa 106:31 It was credited to him as righteousness throughout all generations to come. 
Psa 106:32 They angered the LORD at the waters of Meribah, and Moses suffered because of them;
Psa 106:33 for they embittered his spirit, and he spoke rashly with his lips. 
Psa 106:34 They did not destroy the peoples as the LORD had commanded them
Psa 106:35 but mingled with the nations and adopted their ways. 
Psa 106:36 They served their idols, which became a snare to them. 
Psa 106:37 They sacrificed their sons and daughters to demons.
Psa 106:38 They shed innocent blood-- the blood of their sons and daughters whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; so the land became polluted with blood.
Psa 106:39 They defiled themselves by their actions and prostituted themselves by their deeds. 
Psa 106:40 Therefore the LORD's anger burned against His people, and He abhorred His own inheritance. 
Psa 106:41 He handed them over to the nations; those who hated them ruled them. 
Psa 106:42 Their enemies oppressed them, and they were subdued under their power. 
Psa 106:43 He rescued them many times, but they continued to rebel deliberately and were beaten down by their sin. 
Psa 106:44 When He heard their cry, He took note of their distress, 
Psa 106:45 remembered His covenant with them, and relented according to the riches of His faithful love. 
Psa 106:46 He caused them to be pitied before all their captors. 
Psa 106:47 Save us, Yahweh our God, and gather us from the nations, so that we may give thanks to Your holy name and rejoice in Your praise. 
Psa 106:48 May Yahweh, the God of Israel, be praised from everlasting to everlasting. Let all the people say, " Amen!" Hallelujah! 
Psa 107:1 Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; His faithful love endures forever. 
Psa 107:2 Let the redeemed of the LORD proclaim that He has redeemed them from the hand of the foe 
Psa 107:3 and has gathered them from the lands-- from the east and the west, from the north and the south.
Psa 107:4 Some wandered in the desolate wilderness, finding no way to a city where they could live. 
Psa 107:5 They were hungry and thirsty; their spirits failed within them. 
Psa 107:6 Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble; He rescued them from their distress.
Psa 107:7 He led them by the right path to go to a city where they could live. 
Psa 107:8 Let them give thanks to the LORD for His faithful love and His wonderful works for all humanity.
Psa 107:9 For He has satisfied the thirsty and filled the hungry with good things. 
Psa 107:10 Others sat in darkness and gloom-- prisoners in cruel chains--
Psa 107:11 because they rebelled against God's commands and despised the counsel of the Most High. 
Psa 107:12 He broke their spirits with hard labor; they stumbled, and there was no one to help.
Psa 107:13 Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble; He saved them from their distress.
Psa 107:14 He brought them out of darkness and gloom and broke their chains apart. 
Psa 107:15 Let them give thanks to the LORD for His faithful love and His wonderful works for all humanity.
Psa 107:16 For He has broken down the bronze gates and cut through the iron bars. 
Psa 107:17 Fools suffered affliction because of their rebellious ways and their sins. 
Psa 107:18 They loathed all food and came near the gates of death. 
Psa 107:19 Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble; He saved them from their distress. 
Psa 107:20 He sent His word and healed them; He rescued them from the Pit. 
Psa 107:21 Let them give thanks to the LORD for His faithful love and His wonderful works for all humanity.
Psa 107:22 Let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving and announce His works with shouts of joy. 
Psa 107:23 Others went to sea in ships, conducting trade on the vast waters. 
Psa 107:24 They saw the LORD's works, His wonderful works in the deep. 
Psa 107:25 He spoke and raised a tempest that stirred up the waves of the sea. 
Psa 107:26 Rising up to the sky, sinking down to the depths, their courage melting away in anguish, 
Psa 107:27 they reeled and staggered like drunken men, and all their skill was useless. 
Psa 107:28 Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, and He brought them out of their distress. 
Psa 107:29 He stilled the storm to a murmur, and the waves of the sea were hushed. 
Psa 107:30 They rejoiced when the waves grew quiet. Then He guided them to the harbor they longed for.
Psa 107:31 Let them give thanks to the LORD for His faithful love and His wonderful works for all humanity.
Psa 107:32 Let them exalt Him in the assembly of the people and praise Him in the council of the elders.
Psa 107:33 He turns rivers into desert, springs of water into thirsty ground, 
Psa 107:34 and fruitful land into salty wasteland, because of the wickedness of its inhabitants. 
Psa 107:35 He turns a desert into a pool of water, dry land into springs of water. 
Psa 107:36 He causes the hungry to settle there, and they establish a city where they can live.
Psa 107:37 They sow fields and plant vineyards that yield a fruitful harvest. 
Psa 107:38 He blesses them, and they multiply greatly; He does not let their livestock decrease. 
Psa 107:39 When they are diminished and are humbled by cruel oppression and sorrow, 
Psa 107:40 He pours contempt on nobles and makes them wander in a trackless wasteland. 
Psa 107:41 But He lifts the needy out of their suffering and makes their families multiply like flocks.
Psa 107:42 The upright see it and rejoice, and all injustice shuts its mouth. 
Psa 107:43 Let whoever is wise pay attention to these things and consider the LORD's acts of faithful love.

Psa 109:1 [For the choir director. A Davidic psalm.] God of my praise, do not be silent. 
Psa 109:2 For wicked and deceitful mouths open against me; they speak against me with lying tongues. 
Psa 109:3 They surround me with hateful words and attack me without cause. 
Psa 109:4 In return for my love they accuse me, but I continue to pray.
Psa 109:5 They repay me evil for good, and hatred for my love. 
Psa 109:6 Set a wicked person over him; let an accuser stand at his right hand. 
Psa 109:7 When he is judged, let him be found guilty, and let his prayer be counted as sin. 
Psa 109:8 Let his days be few; let another take over his position. 
Psa 109:9 Let his children be fatherless and his wife a widow. 
Psa 109:10 Let his children wander as beggars, searching for food far from their demolished homes.
Psa 109:11 Let a creditor seize all he has; let strangers plunder what he has worked for. 
Psa 109:12 Let no one show him kindness, and let no one be gracious to his fatherless children.
Psa 109:13 Let the line of his descendants be cut off; let their name be blotted out in the next generation. 
Psa 109:14 Let his ancestors' guilt be remembered before the LORD, and do not let his mother's sin be blotted out. 
Psa 109:15 Let their sins always remain before the LORD, and let Him erase all memory of them from the earth. 
Psa 109:16 For he did not think to show kindness, but pursued the afflicted, poor, and brokenhearted in order to put them to death. 
Psa 109:17 He loved cursing-- let it fall on him; he took no delight in blessing-- let it be far from him.
Psa 109:18 He wore cursing like his coat-- let it enter his body like water and go into his bones like oil.
Psa 109:19 Let it be like a robe he wraps around himself, like a belt he always wears. 
Psa 109:20 Let this be the LORD's payment to my accusers, to those who speak evil against me. 
Psa 109:21 But You, Yahweh my Lord, deal kindly with me because of Your name; deliver me because of the goodness of Your faithful love. 
Psa 109:22 For I am afflicted and needy; my heart is wounded within me. 
Psa 109:23 I fade away like a lengthening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust. 
Psa 109:24 My knees are weak from fasting, and my body is emaciated. 
Psa 109:25 I have become an object of ridicule to my accusers; when they see me, they shake their heads in scorn. 
Psa 109:26 Help me, LORD my God; save me according to Your faithful love 
Psa 109:27 so they may know that this is Your hand and that You, LORD, have done it. 
Psa 109:28 Though they curse, You will bless. When they rise up, they will be put to shame, but Your servant will rejoice. 
Psa 109:29 My accusers will be clothed with disgrace; they will wear their shame like a cloak. 
Psa 109:30 I will fervently thank the LORD with my mouth; I will praise Him in the presence of many. 
Psa 109:31 For He stands at the right hand of the needy to save him from those who would condemn him.

Psa 110:5 The Lord is at Your right hand; He will crush kings on the day of His anger.
