Psa 111:1 Hallelujah! I will praise the LORD with all my heart in the assembly of the upright and in the congregation. 
Psa 111:2 The LORD's works are great, studied by all who delight in them. 
Psa 111:3 All that He does is splendid and majestic; His righteousness endures forever. 
Psa 111:4 He has caused His wonderful works to be remembered. The LORD is gracious and compassionate. 
Psa 111:5 He has provided food for those who fear Him; He remembers His covenant forever. 
Psa 111:6 He has shown His people the power of His works by giving them the inheritance of the nations. 
Psa 111:7 The works of His hands are truth and justice; all His instructions are trustworthy. 
Psa 111:8 They are established forever and ever, enacted in truth and in what is right. 
Psa 111:9 He has sent redemption to His people. He has ordained His covenant forever. His name is holy and awe-inspiring. 
Psa 111:10 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; all who follow His instructions have good insight. His praise endures forever. 
Psa 112:1 Hallelujah! Happy is the man who fears the LORD, taking great delight in His commands. 
Psa 112:2 His descendants will be powerful in the land; the generation of the upright will be blessed. 
Psa 112:3 Wealth and riches are in his house, and his righteousness endures forever. 
Psa 112:4 Light shines in the darkness for the upright man. He is gracious, compassionate, and righteous. 
Psa 112:5 Good will come to a man who lends generously and conducts his business fairly. 
Psa 112:6 He will never be shaken. The righteous man will be remembered forever. 
Psa 112:7 He will not fear bad news; his heart is confident, trusting in the LORD. 
Psa 112:8 His heart is assured; he will not fear. In the end he will look in triumph on his foes. 
Psa 112:9 He distributes freely to the poor; his righteousness endures forever. His horn will be exalted in honor. 
Psa 112:10 The wicked man will see it and be angry; he will gnash his teeth in despair. The desire of the wicked man will come to nothing. 
Psa 113:1 Hallelujah! Give praise, servants of Yahweh; praise the name of Yahweh. 
Psa 113:2 Let the name of Yahweh be praised both now and forever. 
Psa 113:3 From the rising of the sun to its setting, let the name of Yahweh be praised. 
Psa 113:4 Yahweh is exalted above all the nations, His glory above the heavens. 
Psa 113:5 Who is like Yahweh our God-- the One enthroned on high,
Psa 113:6 who stoops down to look on the heavens and the earth?
Psa 113:7 He raises the poor from the dust and lifts the needy from the garbage pile
Psa 113:8 in order to seat them with nobles-- with the nobles of His people.
Psa 113:9 He gives the childless woman a household, making her the joyful mother of children. Hallelujah! 
Psa 114:1 When Israel came out of Egypt-- the house of Jacob from a people who spoke a foreign language--
Psa 114:2 Judah became His sanctuary, Israel, His dominion. 
Psa 114:3 The sea looked and fled; the Jordan turned back.
Psa 114:4 The mountains skipped like rams, the hills, like lambs. 
Psa 114:5 Why was it, sea, that you fled? Jordan, that you turned back? 
Psa 114:6 Mountains, that you skipped like rams? Hills, like lambs? 
Psa 114:7 Tremble, earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob, 
Psa 114:8 who turned the rock into a pool of water, the flint into a spring of water. 
Psa 115:1 Not to us, Yahweh, not to us, but to Your name give glory because of Your faithful love, because of Your truth. 
Psa 115:2 Why should the nations say, "Where is their God?" 
Psa 115:3 Our God is in heaven and does whatever He pleases. 
Psa 115:4 Their idols are silver and gold, made by human hands. 
Psa 115:5 They have mouths but cannot speak, eyes, but cannot see.
Psa 115:6 They have ears but cannot hear, noses, but cannot smell. 
Psa 115:7 They have hands but cannot feel, feet, but cannot walk. They cannot make a sound with their throats. 
Psa 115:8 Those who make them are just like them, as are all who trust in them. 
Psa 115:9 Israel, trust in the LORD! He is their help and shield. 
Psa 115:10 House of Aaron, trust in the LORD! He is their help and shield. 
Psa 115:11 You who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD! He is their help and shield. 
Psa 115:12 The LORD remembers us and will bless us. He will bless the house of Israel; He will bless the house of Aaron; 
Psa 115:13 He will bless those who fear the LORD-- small and great alike.
Psa 115:14 May the LORD add to your numbers, both yours and your children's. 
Psa 115:15 May you be blessed by the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.
Psa 115:16 The heavens are the LORD's, but the earth He has given to the human race. 
Psa 115:17 It is not the dead who praise the LORD, nor any of those descending into the silence of death. 
Psa 115:18 But we will praise the LORD, both now and forever. Hallelujah! 
Psa 116:1 I love the LORD because He has heard my appeal for mercy. 
Psa 116:2 Because He has turned His ear to me, I will call out to Him as long as I live. 
Psa 116:3 The ropes of death were wrapped around me, and the torments of Sheol overcame me; I encountered trouble and sorrow. 
Psa 116:4 Then I called on the name of Yahweh: "Yahweh, save me!" 
Psa 116:5 The LORD is gracious and righteous; our God is compassionate. 
Psa 116:6 The LORD guards the inexperienced; I was helpless, and He saved me. 
Psa 116:7 Return to your rest, my soul, for the LORD has been good to you.
Psa 116:8 For You, LORD, rescued me from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling. 
Psa 116:9 I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.
Psa 116:10 I believed, even when I said, "I am severely afflicted." 
Psa 116:11 In my alarm I said, "Everyone is a liar." 
Psa 116:12 How can I repay the LORD for all the good He has done for me? 
Psa 116:13 I will take the cup of salvation and call on the name of Yahweh. 
Psa 116:14 I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all His people. 
Psa 116:15 The death of His faithful ones is valuable in the LORD's sight. 
Psa 116:16 LORD, I am indeed Your servant; I am Your servant, the son of Your female servant. You have loosened my bonds. 
Psa 116:17 I will offer You a sacrifice of thanksgiving and call on the name of Yahweh. 
Psa 116:18 I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all His people, 
Psa 116:19 in the courts of the LORD's house-- within you, Jerusalem. Hallelujah!
Psa 117:1 Praise the LORD, all nations! Glorify Him, all peoples!
Psa 117:2 For His faithful love to us is great; the LORD's faithfulness endures forever. Hallelujah! 
Psa 118:1 Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; His faithful love endures forever.
Psa 118:2 Let Israel say, "His faithful love endures forever." 
Psa 118:3 Let the house of Aaron say, "His faithful love endures forever." 
Psa 118:4 Let those who fear the LORD say, "His faithful love endures forever." 
Psa 118:5 I called to the LORD in distress; the LORD answered me and put me in a spacious place. 
Psa 118:6 The LORD is for me; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me? 
Psa 118:7 The LORD is my helper, Therefore, I will look in triumph on those who hate me. 
Psa 118:8 It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in man. 
Psa 118:9 It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in nobles. 
Psa 118:10 All the nations surrounded me; in the name of Yahweh I destroyed them. 
Psa 118:11 They surrounded me, yes, they surrounded me; in the name of Yahweh I destroyed them. 
Psa 118:12 They surrounded me like bees; they were extinguished like a fire among thorns; in the name of Yahweh I destroyed them. 
Psa 118:13 You pushed me hard to make me fall, but the LORD helped me. 
Psa 118:14 The LORD is my strength and my song; He has become my salvation. 
Psa 118:15 There are shouts of joy and victory in the tents of the righteous: "The LORD's right hand performs valiantly! 
Psa 118:16 The LORD's right hand is raised. The LORD's right hand performs valiantly!" 
Psa 118:17 I will not die, but I will live and proclaim what the LORD has done. 
Psa 118:18 The LORD disciplined me severely but did not give me over to death.
Psa 118:19 Open the gates of righteousness for me; I will enter through them and give thanks to the LORD. 
Psa 118:20 This is the gate of the LORD; the righteous will enter through it. 
Psa 118:21 I will give thanks to You because You have answered me and have become my salvation. 
Psa 118:22 The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone. 
Psa 118:23 This came from the LORD; it is wonderful in our eyes. 
Psa 118:24 This is the day the LORD has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it. 
Psa 118:25 LORD, save us! LORD, please grant us success! 
Psa 118:26 He who comes in the name of the LORD is blessed. From the house of the LORD we bless you. 
Psa 118:27 The LORD is God and has given us light. Bind the festival sacrifice with cords to the horns of the altar. 
Psa 118:28 You are my God, and I will give You thanks. You are my God; I will exalt You. 
Psa 118:29 Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; His faithful love endures forever. 
Psa 119:1 How happy are those whose way is blameless, who live according to the LORD's instruction! 
Psa 119:2 Happy are those who keep His decrees and seek Him with all their heart. 
Psa 119:3 They do nothing wrong; they follow His ways. 
Psa 119:4 You have commanded that Your precepts be diligently kept. 
Psa 119:5 If only my ways were committed to keeping Your statutes!
Psa 119:6 Then I would not be ashamed when I think about all Your commands. 
Psa 119:7 I will praise You with a sincere heart when I learn Your righteous judgments. 
Psa 119:8 I will keep Your statutes; never abandon me. 
Psa 119:9 How can a young man keep his way pure? By keeping Your word. 
Psa 119:10 I have sought You with all my heart; don't let me wander from Your commands.
Psa 119:11 I have treasured Your word in my heart so that I may not sin against You.
Psa 119:12 LORD, may You be praised; teach me Your statutes. 
Psa 119:13 With my lips I proclaim all the judgments from Your mouth. 
Psa 119:14 I rejoice in the way revealed by Your decrees as much as in all riches.
Psa 119:15 I will meditate on Your precepts and think about Your ways. 
Psa 119:16 I will delight in Your statutes; I will not forget Your word. 
Psa 119:17 Deal generously with Your servant so that I might live; then I will keep Your word. 
Psa 119:18 Open my eyes so that I may contemplate wonderful things from Your instruction.
Psa 119:19 I am a stranger on earth; do not hide Your commands from me. 
Psa 119:20 I am continually overcome with longing for Your judgments. 
Psa 119:21 You rebuke the proud, the ones under a curse, who wander from Your commands.
Psa 119:22 Take insult and contempt away from me, for I have kept Your decrees. 
Psa 119:23 Though princes sit together speaking against me, Your servant will think about Your statutes; 
Psa 119:24 Your decrees are my delight and my counselors. 
Psa 119:25 My life is down in the dust; give me life through Your word. 
Psa 119:26 I told You about my life, and You listened to me; teach me Your statutes. 
Psa 119:27 Help me understand the meaning of Your precepts so that I can meditate on Your wonders. 
Psa 119:28 I am weary from grief; strengthen me through Your word. 
Psa 119:29 Keep me from the way of deceit and graciously give me Your instruction.
Psa 119:30 I have chosen the way of truth; I have set Your ordinances before me.
Psa 119:31 I cling to Your decrees; LORD, do not put me to shame. 
Psa 119:32 I pursue the way of Your commands, for You broaden my understanding.
Psa 119:33 Teach me, LORD, the meaning of Your statutes, and I will always keep them. 
Psa 119:34 Help me understand Your instruction, and I will obey it and follow it with all my heart. 
Psa 119:35 Help me stay on the path of Your commands, for I take pleasure in it. 
Psa 119:36 Turn my heart to Your decrees and not to material gain. 
Psa 119:37 Turn my eyes from looking at what is worthless; give me life in Your ways. 
Psa 119:38 Confirm what You said to Your servant, for it produces reverence for You.
Psa 119:39 Turn away the disgrace I dread; indeed, Your judgments are good. 
Psa 119:40 How I long for Your precepts! Give me life through Your righteousness.
Psa 119:41 Let Your faithful love come to me, LORD, Your salvation, as You promised.
Psa 119:42 Then I can answer the one who taunts me, for I trust in Your word. 
Psa 119:43 Never take the word of truth from my mouth, for I hope in Your judgments.
Psa 119:44 I will always obey Your instruction, forever and ever. 
Psa 119:45 I will walk freely in an open place because I seek Your precepts. 
Psa 119:46 I will speak of Your decrees before kings and not be ashamed. 
Psa 119:47 I delight in Your commands, which I love. 
Psa 119:48 I will lift up my hands to Your commands, which I love, and will meditate on Your statutes. 
Psa 119:49 Remember Your word to Your servant; You have given me hope through it.
Psa 119:50 This is my comfort in my affliction: Your promise has given me life.
Psa 119:51 The arrogant constantly ridicule me, but I do not turn away from Your instruction. 
Psa 119:52 LORD, I remember Your judgments from long ago and find comfort.
Psa 119:53 Rage seizes me because of the wicked who reject Your instruction. 
Psa 119:54 Your statutes are the theme of my song during my earthly life.
Psa 119:55 Yahweh, I remember Your name in the night, and I obey Your instruction. 
Psa 119:56 This is my practice: I obey Your precepts. 
Psa 119:57 The LORD is my portion; I have promised to keep Your words. 
Psa 119:58 I have sought Your favor with all my heart; be gracious to me according to Your promise.
Psa 119:59 I thought about my ways and turned my steps back to Your decrees. 
Psa 119:60 I hurried, not hesitating to keep Your commands.
Psa 119:61 Though the ropes of the wicked were wrapped around me, I did not forget Your instruction. 
Psa 119:62 I rise at midnight to thank You for Your righteous judgments. 
Psa 119:63 I am a friend to all who fear You, to those who keep Your precepts. 
Psa 119:64 LORD, the earth is filled with Your faithful love; teach me Your statutes. 
Psa 119:65 LORD, You have treated Your servant well, just as You promised.
Psa 119:66 Teach me good judgment and discernment, for I rely on Your commands. 
Psa 119:67 Before I was afflicted I went astray, but now I keep Your word. 
Psa 119:68 You are good, and You do what is good; teach me Your statutes.
Psa 119:69 The arrogant have smeared me with lies, but I obey Your precepts with all my heart. 
Psa 119:70 Their hearts are hard and insensitive, but I delight in Your instruction. 
Psa 119:71 It was good for me to be afflicted so that I could learn Your statutes. 
Psa 119:72 Instruction from Your lips is better for me than thousands of gold and silver pieces. 
Psa 119:73 Your hands made me and formed me; give me understanding so that I can learn Your commands.
Psa 119:74 Those who fear You will see me and rejoice, for I put my hope in Your word. 
Psa 119:75 I know, LORD, that Your judgments are just and that You have afflicted me fairly. 
Psa 119:76 May Your faithful love comfort me as You promised Your servant.
Psa 119:77 May Your compassion come to me so that I may live, for Your instruction is my delight. 
Psa 119:78 Let the arrogant be put to shame for slandering me with lies; I will meditate on Your precepts. 
Psa 119:79 Let those who fear You, those who know Your decrees, turn to me.
Psa 119:80 May my heart be blameless regarding Your statutes so that I will not be put to shame. 
Psa 119:81 I long for Your salvation; I put my hope in Your word. 
Psa 119:82 My eyes grow weary looking for what You have promised; I ask, "When will You comfort me?" 
Psa 119:83 Though I have become like a wineskin dried by smoke, I do not forget Your statutes.
Psa 119:84 How many days must Your servant wait? When will You execute judgment on my persecutors? 
Psa 119:85 The arrogant have dug pits for me; they violate Your instruction. 
Psa 119:86 All Your commands are true; people persecute me with lies-- help me!
Psa 119:87 They almost ended my life on earth, but I did not abandon Your precepts.
Psa 119:88 Give me life in accordance with Your faithful love, and I will obey the decree You have spoken.
Psa 119:89 LORD, Your word is forever; it is firmly fixed in heaven. 
Psa 119:90 Your faithfulness is for all generations; You established the earth, and it stands firm. 
Psa 119:91 They stand today in accordance with Your judgments, for all things are Your servants.
Psa 119:92 If Your instruction had not been my delight, I would have died in my affliction. 
Psa 119:93 I will never forget Your precepts, for You have given me life through them. 
Psa 119:94 I am Yours; save me, for I have sought Your precepts. 
Psa 119:95 The wicked hope to destroy me, but I contemplate Your decrees. 
Psa 119:96 I have seen a limit to all perfection, but Your command is without limit.
Psa 119:97 How I love Your instruction! It is my meditation all day long. 
Psa 119:98 Your commands make me wiser than my enemies, for they are always with me. 
Psa 119:99 I have more insight than all my teachers because Your decrees are my meditation. 
Psa 119:100 I understand more than the elders because I obey Your precepts. 
Psa 119:101 I have kept my feet from every evil path to follow Your word. 
Psa 119:102 I have not turned from Your judgments, for You Yourself have instructed me. 
Psa 119:103 How sweet Your word is to my taste-- sweeter than honey in my mouth.
Psa 119:104 I gain understanding from Your precepts; therefore I hate every false way.
Psa 119:105 Your word is a lamp for my feet and a light on my path. 
Psa 119:106 I have solemnly sworn to keep Your righteous judgments. 
Psa 119:107 I am severely afflicted; LORD, give me life through Your word. 
Psa 119:108 LORD, please accept my willing offerings of praise, and teach me Your judgments. 
Psa 119:109 My life is constantly in danger, yet I do not forget Your instruction. 
Psa 119:110 The wicked have set a trap for me, but I have not wandered from Your precepts. 
Psa 119:111 I have Your decrees as a heritage forever; indeed, they are the joy of my heart. 
Psa 119:112 I am resolved to obey Your statutes to the very end. 
Psa 119:113 I hate those who are double-minded, but I love Your instruction. 
Psa 119:114 You are my shelter and my shield; I put my hope in Your word.
Psa 119:115 Depart from me, you evil ones, so that I may obey my God's commands. 
Psa 119:116 Sustain me as You promised, and I will live; do not let me be ashamed of my hope. 
Psa 119:117 Sustain me so that I can be safe and always be concerned about Your statutes. 
Psa 119:118 You reject all who stray from Your statutes, for their deceit is a lie. 
Psa 119:119 You remove all the wicked on earth as if they were dross; therefore, I love Your decrees. 
Psa 119:120 I tremble in awe of You; I fear Your judgments. 
Psa 119:121 I have done what is just and right; do not leave me to my oppressors. 
Psa 119:122 Guarantee Your servant's well-being; do not let the arrogant oppress me. 
Psa 119:123 My eyes grow weary looking for Your salvation and for Your righteous promise. 
Psa 119:124 Deal with Your servant based on Your faithful love; teach me Your statutes. 
Psa 119:125 I am Your servant; give me understanding so that I may know Your decrees. 
Psa 119:126 It is time for the LORD to act, for they have violated Your instruction.
Psa 119:127 Since I love Your commands more than gold, even the purest gold, 
Psa 119:128 I carefully follow all Your precepts and hate every false way. 
Psa 119:129 Your decrees are wonderful; therefore I obey them. 
Psa 119:130 The revelation of Your words brings light and gives understanding to the inexperienced. 
Psa 119:131 I open my mouth and pant because I long for Your commands. 
Psa 119:132 Turn to me and be gracious to me, as is Your practice toward those who love Your name.
Psa 119:133 Make my steps steady through Your promise; don't let any sin dominate me. 
Psa 119:134 Redeem me from human oppression, and I will keep Your precepts. 
Psa 119:135 Show favor to Your servant, and teach me Your statutes. 
Psa 119:136 My eyes pour out streams of tears because people do not follow Your instruction. 
Psa 119:137 You are righteous, LORD, and Your judgments are just. 
Psa 119:138 The decrees You issue are righteous and altogether trustworthy. 
Psa 119:139 My anger overwhelms me because my foes forget Your words. 
Psa 119:140 Your word is completely pure, and Your servant loves it.
Psa 119:141 I am insignificant and despised, but I do not forget Your precepts. 
Psa 119:142 Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and Your instruction is true. 
Psa 119:143 Trouble and distress have overtaken me, but Your commands are my delight. 
Psa 119:144 Your decrees are righteous forever. Give me understanding, and I will live. 
Psa 119:145 I call with all my heart; answer me, LORD. I will obey Your statutes. 
Psa 119:146 I call to You; save me, and I will keep Your decrees. 
Psa 119:147 I rise before dawn and cry out for help; I put my hope in Your word.
Psa 119:148 I am awake through each watch of the night to meditate on Your promise. 
Psa 119:149 In keeping with Your faithful love, hear my voice. LORD, give me life in keeping with Your justice. 
Psa 119:150 Those who pursue evil plans come near; they are far from Your instruction. 
Psa 119:151 You are near, LORD, and all Your commands are true. 
Psa 119:152 Long ago I learned from Your decrees that You have established them forever. 
Psa 119:153 Consider my affliction and rescue me, for I have not forgotten Your instruction. 
Psa 119:154 Defend my cause and redeem me; give me life as You promised. 
Psa 119:155 Salvation is far from the wicked because they do not seek Your statutes. 
Psa 119:156 Your compassions are many, LORD; give me life according to Your judgments. 
Psa 119:157 My persecutors and foes are many. I have not turned from Your decrees. 
Psa 119:158 I have seen the disloyal and feel disgust because they do not keep Your word.
Psa 119:159 Consider how I love Your precepts; LORD, give me life according to Your faithful love. 
Psa 119:160 The entirety of Your word is truth, and all Your righteous judgments endure forever. 
Psa 119:161 Princes have persecuted me without cause, but my heart fears only Your word. 
Psa 119:162 I rejoice over Your promise like one who finds vast treasure. 
Psa 119:163 I hate and abhor falsehood, but I love Your instruction. 
Psa 119:164 I praise You seven times a day for Your righteous judgments.
Psa 119:165 Abundant peace belongs to those who love Your instruction; nothing makes them stumble. 
Psa 119:166 LORD, I hope for Your salvation and carry out Your commands. 
Psa 119:167 I obey Your decrees and love them greatly. 
Psa 119:168 I obey Your precepts and decrees, for all my ways are before You. 
Psa 119:169 Let my cry reach You, LORD; give me understanding according to Your word. 
Psa 119:170 Let my plea reach You; rescue me according to Your promise. 
Psa 119:171 My lips pour out praise, for You teach me Your statutes.
Psa 119:172 My tongue sings about Your promise, for all Your commands are righteous.
Psa 119:173 May Your hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen Your precepts. 
Psa 119:174 I long for Your salvation, LORD, and Your instruction is my delight. 
Psa 119:175 Let me live, and I will praise You; may Your judgments help me. 
Psa 119:176 I wander like a lost sheep; seek Your servant, for I do not forget Your commands.
Psa 120:1 [A song of ascents.] In my distress I called to the LORD, and He answered me. 
Psa 120:2 "LORD, deliver me from lying lips and a deceitful tongue." 
Psa 120:3 What will He give you, and what will He do to you, you deceitful tongue? 
Psa 120:4 A warrior's sharp arrows with burning charcoal!
Psa 120:5 What misery that I have stayed in Meshech, that I have lived among the tents of Kedar! 
Psa 120:6 I have lived too long with those who hate peace. 
Psa 120:7 I am for peace; but when I speak, they are for war.
Psa 121:1 [A song of ascents.] I lift my eyes toward the mountains. Where will my help come from? 
Psa 121:2 My help comes from the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth. 
Psa 121:3 He will not allow your foot to slip; your Protector will not slumber. 
Psa 121:4 Indeed, the Protector of Israel does not slumber or sleep. 
Psa 121:5 The LORD protects you; the LORD is a shelter right by your side. 
Psa 121:6 The sun will not strike you by day or the moon by night. 
Psa 121:7 The LORD will protect you from all harm; He will protect your life. 
Psa 121:8 The LORD will protect your coming and going both now and forever.
Psa 122:1 [A Davidic song of ascents.] I rejoiced with those who said to me, "Let us go to the house of the LORD."
Psa 122:2 Our feet are standing within your gates, Jerusalem--
Psa 122:3 Jerusalem, built as a city should be, solidly joined together, 
Psa 122:4 where the tribes, Yahweh's tribes, go up to give thanks to the name of Yahweh. (This is an ordinance for Israel.) 
Psa 122:5 There, thrones for judgment are placed, thrones of the house of David. 
Psa 122:6 Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: "May those who love you prosper; 
Psa 122:7 may there be peace within your walls, prosperity within your fortresses." 
Psa 122:8 Because of my brothers and friends, I will say, "Peace be with you." 
Psa 122:9 Because of the house of the LORD our God, I will seek your good.
Psa 123:1 [A song of ascents.] I lift my eyes to You, the One enthroned in heaven.
Psa 123:2 Like a servant's eyes on his master's hand, like a servant girl's eyes on her mistress's hand, so our eyes are on the LORD our God until He shows us favor. 
Psa 123:3 Show us favor, LORD, show us favor, for we've had more than enough contempt. 
Psa 123:4 We've had more than enough scorn from the arrogant and contempt from the proud.
Psa 124:1 [A Davidic song of ascents.] If the LORD had not been on our side-- let Israel say--
Psa 124:2 If the LORD had not been on our side when men attacked us, 
Psa 124:3 then they would have swallowed us alive in their burning anger against us. 
Psa 124:4 Then the waters would have engulfed us; the torrent would have swept over us;
Psa 124:5 the raging waters would have swept over us. 
Psa 124:6 Praise the LORD, who has not let us be ripped apart by their teeth. 
Psa 124:7 We have escaped like a bird from the hunter's net; the net is torn, and we have escaped. 
Psa 124:8 Our help is in the name of Yahweh, the Maker of heaven and earth.
Psa 125:1 [A song of ascents.] Those who trust in the LORD are like Mount Zion. It cannot be shaken; it remains forever. 
Psa 125:2 Jerusalem-- the mountains surround her. And the LORD surrounds His people, both now and forever.
Psa 125:3 The scepter of the wicked will not remain over the land allotted to the righteous, so that the righteous will not apply their hands to injustice. 
Psa 125:4 Do what is good, LORD, to the good, to those whose hearts are upright. 
Psa 125:5 But as for those who turn aside to crooked ways, the LORD will banish them with the evildoers. Peace be with Israel.
Psa 126:1 [A song of ascents.] When the LORD restored the fortunes of Zion, we were like those who dream. 
Psa 126:2 Our mouths were filled with laughter then, and our tongues with shouts of joy. Then they said among the nations, "The LORD has done great things for them." 
Psa 126:3 The LORD had done great things for us; we were joyful. 
Psa 126:4 Restore our fortunes, LORD, like watercourses in the Negev. 
Psa 126:5 Those who sow in tears will reap with shouts of joy. 
Psa 126:6 Though one goes along weeping, carrying the bag of seed, he will surely come back with shouts of joy, carrying his sheaves.
Psa 127:1 [A Solomonic song of ascents.] Unless the LORD builds a house, its builders labor over it in vain; unless the LORD watches over a city, the watchman stays alert in vain.
Psa 127:2 In vain you get up early and stay up late, working hard to have enough food-- yes, He gives sleep to the one He loves.
Psa 127:3 Sons are indeed a heritage from the LORD, children, a reward. 
Psa 127:4 Like arrows in the hand of a warrior are the sons born in one's youth. 
Psa 127:5 Happy is the man who has filled his quiver with them. Such men will never be put to shame when they speak with their enemies at the city gate.
Psa 128:1 [A song of ascents.] How happy is everyone who fears the LORD, who walks in His ways! 
Psa 128:2 You will surely eat what your hands have worked for. You will be happy, and it will go well for you. 
Psa 128:3 Your wife will be like a fruitful vine within your house, your sons, like young olive trees around your table. 
Psa 128:4 In this very way the man who fears the LORD will be blessed. 
Psa 128:5 May the LORD bless you from Zion, so that you will see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life 
Psa 128:6 and will see your children's children! Peace be with Israel.
Psa 129:1 [A song of ascents.] Since my youth they have often attacked me-- let Israel say--
Psa 129:2 Since my youth they have often attacked me, but they have not prevailed against me. 
Psa 129:3 Plowmen plowed over my back; they made their furrows long. 
Psa 129:4 The LORD is righteous; He has cut the ropes of the wicked. 
Psa 129:5 Let all who hate Zion be driven back in disgrace. 
Psa 129:6 Let them be like grass on the rooftops, which withers before it grows up 
Psa 129:7 and can't even fill the hands of the reaper or the arms of the one who binds sheaves. 
Psa 129:8 Then none who pass by will say, "May the LORD's blessing be on you." We bless you in the name of Yahweh.
Psa 130:1 [A song of ascents.] Out of the depths I call to You, Yahweh! 
Psa 130:2 Lord, listen to my voice; let Your ears be attentive to my cry for help. 
Psa 130:3 Yahweh, if You considered sins, Lord, who could stand? 
Psa 130:4 But with You there is forgiveness, so that You may be revered. 
Psa 130:5 I wait for Yahweh; I wait and put my hope in His word. 
Psa 130:6 I wait for the Lord more than watchmen for the morning-- more than watchmen for the morning.
Psa 130:7 Israel, put your hope in the LORD. For there is faithful love with the LORD, and with Him is redemption in abundance. 
Psa 130:8 And He will redeem Israel from all its sins.
Psa 131:1 [A Davidic song of ascents.] LORD, my heart is not proud; my eyes are not haughty. I do not get involved with things too great or too difficult for me. 
Psa 131:2 Instead, I have calmed and quieted myself like a little weaned child with its mother; I am like a little child. 
Psa 131:3 Israel, put your hope in the LORD, both now and forever.
Psa 132:1 [A song of ascents.] LORD, remember David and all the hardships he endured, 
Psa 132:2 and how he swore an oath to the LORD, making a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob: 
Psa 132:3 "I will not enter my house or get into my bed, 
Psa 132:4 I will not allow my eyes to sleep or my eyelids to slumber 
Psa 132:5 until I find a place for the LORD, a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob."
Psa 132:6 We heard of the ark in Ephrathah; we found it in the fields of Jaar. 
Psa 132:7 Let us go to His dwelling place; let us worship at His footstool.
Psa 132:8 Rise up, LORD, come to Your resting place, You and Your powerful ark. 
Psa 132:9 May Your priests be clothed with righteousness, and may Your godly people shout for joy. 
Psa 132:10 Because of Your servant David, do not reject Your anointed one. 
Psa 132:11 The LORD swore an oath to David, a promise He will not abandon: "I will set one of your descendants on your throne. 
Psa 132:12 If your sons keep My covenant and My decrees that I will teach them, their sons will also sit on your throne forever." 
Psa 132:13 For the LORD has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His home: 
Psa 132:14 "This is My resting place forever; I will make My home here because I have desired it. 
Psa 132:15 I will abundantly bless its food; I will satisfy its needy with bread. 
Psa 132:16 I will clothe its priests with salvation, and its godly people will shout for joy. 
Psa 132:17 There I will make a horn grow for David; I have prepared a lamp for My anointed one. 
Psa 132:18 I will clothe his enemies with shame, but the crown he wears will be glorious."
Psa 133:1 [A Davidic song of ascents.] How good and pleasant it is when brothers live together in harmony! 
Psa 133:2 It is like fine oil on the head, running down on the beard, running down Aaron's beard onto his robes. 
Psa 133:3 It is like the dew of Hermon falling on the mountains of Zion. For there the LORD has appointed the blessing-- life forevermore.
Psa 134:1 [A song of ascents.] Now praise the LORD, all you servants of the LORD who stand in the LORD's house at night! 
Psa 134:2 Lift up your hands in the holy place and praise the LORD! 
Psa 134:3 May the LORD, Maker of heaven and earth, bless you from Zion. 
Psa 135:1 Hallelujah! Praise the name of Yahweh. Give praise, you servants of Yahweh 
Psa 135:2 who stand in the house of Yahweh, in the courts of the house of our God. 
Psa 135:3 Praise Yahweh, for Yahweh is good; sing praise to His name, for it is delightful. 
Psa 135:4 For Yahweh has chosen Jacob for Himself, Israel as His treasured possession. 
Psa 135:5 For I know that Yahweh is great; our Lord is greater than all gods. 
Psa 135:6 Yahweh does whatever He pleases in heaven and on earth, in the seas and all the depths. 
Psa 135:7 He causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth. He makes lightning for the rain and brings the wind from His storehouses. 
Psa 135:8 He struck down the firstborn of Egypt, both man and beast. 
Psa 135:9 He sent signs and wonders against you, Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his officials. 
Psa 135:10 He struck down many nations and slaughtered mighty kings: 
Psa 135:11 Sihon king of the Amorites, Og king of Bashan, and all the kings of Canaan. 
Psa 135:12 He gave their land as an inheritance, an inheritance to His people Israel.
Psa 135:13 Yahweh, Your name endures forever, Your reputation, Yahweh, through all generations. 
Psa 135:14 For Yahweh will judge His people and have compassion on His servants. 
Psa 135:15 The idols of the nations are of silver and gold, made by human hands. 
Psa 135:16 They have mouths but cannot speak, eyes, but cannot see. 
Psa 135:17 They have ears but cannot hear; indeed, there is no breath in their mouths. 
Psa 135:18 Those who make them are just like them, as are all who trust in them. 
Psa 135:19 House of Israel, praise Yahweh! House of Aaron, praise Yahweh! 
Psa 135:20 House of Levi, praise Yahweh! You who revere the LORD, praise the LORD! 
Psa 135:21 May the LORD be praised from Zion; He dwells in Jerusalem. Hallelujah!

Psa 137:1 By the rivers of Babylon-- there we sat down and wept when we remembered Zion.
Psa 137:2 There we hung up our lyres on the poplar trees, 
Psa 137:3 for our captors there asked us for songs, and our tormentors, for rejoicing: "Sing us one of the songs of Zion." 
Psa 137:4 How can we sing the LORD's song on foreign soil? 
Psa 137:5 If I forget you, Jerusalem, may my right hand forget its skill. 
Psa 137:6 May my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I do not remember you, if I do not exalt Jerusalem as my greatest joy! 
Psa 137:7 Remember, LORD, what the Edomites said that day at Jerusalem: "Destroy it! Destroy it down to its foundations!" 
Psa 137:8 Daughter Babylon, doomed to destruction, happy is the one who pays you back what you have done to us. 
Psa 137:9 Happy is he who takes your little ones and dashes them against the rocks.
Psa 138:1 [Davidic.] I will give You thanks with all my heart; I will sing Your praise before the heavenly beings. 
Psa 138:2 I will bow down toward Your holy temple and give thanks to Your name for Your constant love and truth. You have exalted Your name and Your promise above everything else.
Psa 138:3 On the day I called, You answered me; You increased strength within me. 
Psa 138:4 All the kings on earth will give You thanks, LORD, when they hear what You have promised. 
Psa 138:5 They will sing of the LORD's ways, for the LORD's glory is great. 
Psa 138:6 Though the LORD is exalted, He takes note of the humble; but He knows the haughty from a distance. 
Psa 138:7 If I walk into the thick of danger, You will preserve my life from the anger of my enemies. You will extend Your hand; Your right hand will save me. 
Psa 138:8 The LORD will fulfill His purpose for me. LORD, Your love is eternal; do not abandon the work of Your hands.
Psa 139:1 [For the choir director. A Davidic psalm.] LORD, You have searched me and known me. 
Psa 139:2 You know when I sit down and when I stand up; You understand my thoughts from far away. 
Psa 139:3 You observe my travels and my rest; You are aware of all my ways. 
Psa 139:4 Before a word is on my tongue, You know all about it, LORD. 
Psa 139:5 You have encircled me; You have placed Your hand on me. 
Psa 139:6 This extraordinary knowledge is beyond me. It is lofty; I am unable to reach it. 
Psa 139:7 Where can I go to escape Your Spirit? Where can I flee from Your presence? 
Psa 139:8 If I go up to heaven, You are there; if I make my bed in Sheol, You are there. 
Psa 139:9 If I live at the eastern horizon or settle at the western limits, 
Psa 139:10 even there Your hand will lead me; Your right hand will hold on to me. 
Psa 139:11 If I say, "Surely the darkness will hide me, and the light around me will be night"--
Psa 139:12 even the darkness is not dark to You. The night shines like the day; darkness and light are alike to You.
Psa 139:13 For it was You who created my inward parts; You knit me together in my mother's womb. 
Psa 139:14 I will praise You because I have been remarkably and wonderfully made. Your works are wonderful, and I know this very well. 
Psa 139:15 My bones were not hidden from You when I was made in secret, when I was formed in the depths of the earth. 
Psa 139:16 Your eyes saw me when I was formless; all my days were written in Your book and planned before a single one of them began.
Psa 139:17 God, how difficult Your thoughts are for me to comprehend; how vast their sum is! 
Psa 139:18 If I counted them, they would outnumber the grains of sand; when I wake up, I am still with You. 
Psa 139:19 God, if only You would kill the wicked-- you bloodthirsty men, stay away from me--
Psa 139:20 who invoke You deceitfully. Your enemies swear by You falsely. 
Psa 139:21 LORD, don't I hate those who hate You, and detest those who rebel against You?
Psa 139:22 I hate them with extreme hatred; I consider them my enemies. 
Psa 139:23 Search me, God, and know my heart; test me and know my concerns. 
Psa 139:24 See if there is any offensive way in me; lead me in the everlasting way.
Psa 140:1 [For the choir director. A Davidic psalm.] Rescue me, LORD, from evil men. Keep me safe from violent men 
Psa 140:2 who plan evil in their hearts. They stir up wars all day long. 
Psa 140:3 They make their tongues as sharp as a snake's bite; viper's venom is under their lips. [Selah] 
Psa 140:4 Protect me, LORD, from the clutches of the wicked. Keep me safe from violent men who plan to make me stumble. 
Psa 140:5 The proud hide a trap with ropes for me; they spread a net along the path and set snares for me.[Selah] 
Psa 140:6 I say to the LORD, "You are my God." Listen, LORD, to my cry for help. 
Psa 140:7 Lord GOD, my strong Savior, You shield my head on the day of battle. 
Psa 140:8 LORD, do not grant the desires of the wicked; do not let them achieve their goals. Otherwise, they will become proud.[Selah] 
Psa 140:9 When those who surround me rise up, may the trouble their lips cause overwhelm them. 
Psa 140:10 Let hot coals fall on them. Let them be thrown into the fire, into the abyss, never again to rise. 
Psa 140:11 Do not let a slanderer stay in the land. Let evil relentlessly hunt down a violent man. 
Psa 140:12 I know that the LORD upholds the just cause of the poor, justice for the needy. 
Psa 140:13 Surely the righteous will praise Your name; the upright will live in Your presence.
Psa 141:1 [A Davidic psalm.] LORD, I call on You; hurry to help me. Listen to my voice when I call on You. 
Psa 141:2 May my prayer be set before You as incense, the raising of my hands as the evening offering. 
Psa 141:3 LORD, set up a guard for my mouth; keep watch at the door of my lips. 
Psa 141:4 Do not let my heart turn to any evil thing or perform wicked acts with men who commit sin. Do not let me feast on their delicacies. 
Psa 141:5 Let the righteous one strike me-- it is an act of faithful love; let him rebuke me-- it is oil for my head; let me not refuse it. Even now my prayer is against the evil acts of the wicked.
Psa 141:6 When their rulers will be thrown off the sides of a cliff, the people will listen to my words, for they are pleasing. 
Psa 141:7 As when one plows and breaks up the soil, turning up rocks, so our bones have been scattered at the mouth of Sheol. 
Psa 141:8 But my eyes look to You, Lord GOD. I seek refuge in You; do not let me die. 
Psa 141:9 Protect me from the trap they have set for me, and from the snares of evildoers. 
Psa 141:10 Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I pass by safely.
Psa 142:1 [A Davidic Maskil. When he was in the cave. A prayer.] I cry aloud to the LORD; I plead aloud to the LORD for mercy.
Psa 142:2 I pour out my complaint before Him; I reveal my trouble to Him. 
Psa 142:3 Although my spirit is weak within me, You know my way. Along this path I travel they have hidden a trap for me. 
Psa 142:4 Look to the right and see: no one stands up for me; there is no refuge for me; no one cares about me. 
Psa 142:5 I cry to You, LORD; I say, "You are my shelter, my portion in the land of the living." 
Psa 142:6 Listen to my cry, for I am very weak. Rescue me from those who pursue me, for they are too strong for me. 
Psa 142:7 Free me from prison so that I can praise Your name. The righteous will gather around me because You deal generously with me.
Psa 143:1 [A Davidic psalm.] LORD, hear my prayer. In Your faithfulness listen to my plea, and in Your righteousness answer me. 
Psa 143:2 Do not bring Your servant into judgment, for no one alive is righteous in Your sight. 
Psa 143:3 For the enemy has pursued me, crushing me to the ground, making me live in darkness like those long dead. 
Psa 143:4 My spirit is weak within me; my heart is overcome with dismay. 
Psa 143:5 I remember the days of old; I meditate on all You have done; I reflect on the work of Your hands. 
Psa 143:6 I spread out my hands to You; I am like parched land before You. [Selah] 
Psa 143:7 Answer me quickly, LORD; my spirit fails. Don't hide Your face from me, or I will be like those going down to the Pit. 
Psa 143:8 Let me experience Your faithful love in the morning, for I trust in You. Reveal to me the way I should go because I long for You. 
Psa 143:9 Rescue me from my enemies, LORD; I come to You for protection. 
Psa 143:10 Teach me to do Your will, for You are my God. May Your gracious Spirit lead me on level ground. 
Psa 143:11 Because of Your name, Yahweh, let me live. In Your righteousness deliver me from trouble, 
Psa 143:12 and in Your faithful love destroy my enemies. Wipe out all those who attack me, for I am Your servant.
Psa 144:1 [Davidic.] May the LORD, my rock, be praised, who trains my hands for battle and my fingers for warfare. 
Psa 144:2 He is my faithful love and my fortress, my stronghold and my deliverer. He is my shield, and I take refuge in Him; He subdues my people under me. 
Psa 144:3 LORD, what is man, that You care for him, the son of man, that You think of him? 
Psa 144:4 Man is like a breath; his days are like a passing shadow. 
Psa 144:5 LORD, part Your heavens and come down. Touch the mountains, and they will smoke. 
Psa 144:6 Flash Your lightning and scatter the foe; shoot Your arrows and rout them. 
Psa 144:7 Reach down from heaven; rescue me from deep water, and set me free from the grasp of foreigners 
Psa 144:8 whose mouths speak lies, whose right hands are deceptive. 
Psa 144:9 God, I will sing a new song to You; I will play on a ten-stringed harp for You--
Psa 144:10 the One who gives victory to kings, who frees His servant David from the deadly sword. 
Psa 144:11 Set me free and rescue me from the grasp of foreigners whose mouths speak lies, whose right hands are deceptive. 
Psa 144:12 Then our sons will be like plants nurtured in their youth, our daughters, like corner pillars that are carved in the palace style. 
Psa 144:13 Our storehouses will be full, supplying all kinds of produce; our flocks will increase by thousands and tens of thousands in our open fields. 
Psa 144:14 Our cattle will be well fed. There will be no breach in the walls, no going into captivity, and no cry of lament in our public squares. 
Psa 144:15 Happy are the people with such blessings. Happy are the people whose God is Yahweh.

Psa 145:2 I will praise You every day; I will honor Your name forever and ever. 
Psa 145:3 Yahweh is great and is highly praised; His greatness is unsearchable. 
Psa 145:4 One generation will declare Your works to the next and will proclaim Your mighty acts. 
Psa 145:5 I will speak of Your splendor and glorious majesty and Your wonderful works. 
Psa 145:6 They will proclaim the power of Your awe-inspiring acts, and I will declare Your greatness. 
Psa 145:7 They will give a testimony of Your great goodness and will joyfully sing of Your righteousness. 
Psa 145:8 The LORD is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and great in faithful love. 
Psa 145:9 The LORD is good to everyone; His compassion rests on all He has made. 
Psa 145:10 All You have made will thank You, LORD; the godly will praise You. 
Psa 145:11 They will speak of the glory of Your kingdom and will declare Your might, 
Psa 145:12 informing all people of Your mighty acts and of the glorious splendor of Your kingdom. 
Psa 145:13 Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom; Your rule is for all generations. The LORD is faithful in all His words and gracious in all His actions.
Psa 145:14 The LORD helps all who fall; He raises up all who are oppressed. 
Psa 145:15 All eyes look to You, and You give them their food at the proper time.
Psa 145:16 You open Your hand and satisfy the desire of every living thing. 
Psa 145:17 The LORD is righteous in all His ways and gracious in all His acts.
Psa 145:18 The LORD is near all who call out to Him, all who call out to Him with integrity. 
Psa 145:19 He fulfills the desires of those who fear Him; He hears their cry for help and saves them. 
Psa 145:20 The LORD guards all those who love Him, but He destroys all the wicked. 
Psa 145:21 My mouth will declare Yahweh's praise; let every living thing praise His holy name forever and ever.

Psa 147:1 Hallelujah! How good it is to sing to our God, for praise is pleasant and lovely. 
Psa 147:2 The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem; He gathers Israel's exiled people. 
Psa 147:3 He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds. 
Psa 147:4 He counts the number of the stars; He gives names to all of them. 
Psa 147:5 Our Lord is great, vast in power; His understanding is infinite.
Psa 147:6 The LORD helps the afflicted but brings the wicked to the ground. 
Psa 147:7 Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving; play the lyre to our God, 
Psa 147:8 who covers the sky with clouds, prepares rain for the earth, and causes grass to grow on the hills. 
Psa 147:9 He provides the animals with their food, and the young ravens, what they cry for. 
Psa 147:10 He is not impressed by the strength of a horse; He does not value the power of a man. 
Psa 147:11 The LORD values those who fear Him, those who put their hope in His faithful love.
Psa 147:12 Exalt the LORD, Jerusalem; praise your God, Zion! 
Psa 147:13 For He strengthens the bars of your gates and blesses your children within you.
Psa 147:14 He endows your territory with prosperity; He satisfies you with the finest wheat.
Psa 147:15 He sends His command throughout the earth; His word runs swiftly. 
Psa 147:16 He spreads snow like wool; He scatters frost like ashes; 
Psa 147:17 He throws His hailstones like crumbs. Who can withstand His cold? 
Psa 147:18 He sends His word and melts them; He unleashes His winds, and the waters flow.
Psa 147:19 He declares His word to Jacob, His statutes and judgments to Israel. 
Psa 147:20 He has not done this for any nation; they do not know His judgments. Hallelujah!

Psa 149:2 Let Israel celebrate its Maker; let the children of Zion rejoice in their King. 
Psa 149:3 Let them praise His name with dancing and make music to Him with tambourine and lyre. 
Psa 149:4 For Yahweh takes pleasure in His people; He adorns the humble with salvation.

Psa 149:8 binding their kings with chains and their dignitaries with iron shackles, 
Psa 149:9 carrying out the judgment decreed against them. This honor is for all His godly people. Hallelujah! 
Psa 150:1 Hallelujah! Praise God in His sanctuary. Praise Him in His mighty heavens. 
Psa 150:2 Praise Him for His powerful acts; praise Him for His abundant greatness. 
Psa 150:3 Praise Him with trumpet blast; praise Him with harp and lyre. 
Psa 150:4 Praise Him with tambourine and dance; praise Him with flute and strings. 
Psa 150:5 Praise Him with resounding cymbals; praise Him with clashing cymbals.

Pro 1:1 The proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel: 
Pro 1:2 For learning what wisdom and discipline are; for understanding insightful sayings;
Pro 1:3 for receiving wise instruction in righteousness, justice, and integrity; 
Pro 1:4 for teaching shrewdness to the inexperienced, knowledge and discretion to a young man--
Pro 1:5 a wise man will listen and increase his learning, and a discerning man will obtain guidance--
Pro 1:6 for understanding a proverb or a parable, the words of the wise, and their riddles. 
Pro 1:7 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; fools despise wisdom and discipline. 
Pro 1:8 Listen, my son, to your father's instruction, and don't reject your mother's teaching, 
Pro 1:9 for they will be a garland of grace on your head and a gold chain around your neck.
Pro 1:10 My son, if sinners entice you, don't be persuaded. 
Pro 1:11 If they say-- "Come with us! Let's set an ambush and kill someone. Let's attack some innocent person just for fun!
Pro 1:12 Let's swallow them alive, like Sheol, still healthy as they go down to the Pit. 
Pro 1:13 We'll find all kinds of valuable property and fill our houses with plunder. 
Pro 1:14 Throw in your lot with us, and we'll all share our money"--
Pro 1:15 my son, don't travel that road with them or set foot on their path, 
Pro 1:16 because their feet run toward trouble and they hurry to commit murder. 
Pro 1:17 It is foolish to spread a net where any bird can see it,
Pro 1:18 but they set an ambush to kill themselves; they attack their own lives. 
Pro 1:19 Such are the paths of all who make profit dishonestly; it takes the lives of those who receive it. 
Pro 1:20 Wisdom calls out in the street; she raises her voice in the public squares. 
Pro 1:21 She cries out above the commotion; she speaks at the entrance of the city gates: 
Pro 1:22 "How long, foolish ones, will you love ignorance? How long will you mockers enjoy mocking and you fools hate knowledge? 
Pro 1:23 If you respond to my warning, then I will pour out my spirit on you and teach you my words. 
Pro 1:24 Since I called out and you refused, extended my hand and no one paid attention, 
Pro 1:25 since you neglected all my counsel and did not accept my correction, 
Pro 1:26 I, in turn, will laugh at your calamity. I will mock when terror strikes you, 
Pro 1:27 when terror strikes you like a storm and your calamity comes like a whirlwind, when trouble and stress overcome you.
Pro 1:28 Then they will call me, but I won't answer; they will search for me, but won't find me. 
Pro 1:29 Because they hated knowledge, didn't choose to fear the LORD, 
Pro 1:30 were not interested in my counsel, and rejected all my correction, 
Pro 1:31 they will eat the fruit of their way and be glutted with their own schemes. 
Pro 1:32 For the turning away of the inexperienced will kill them, and the complacency of fools will destroy them. 
Pro 1:33 But whoever listens to me will live securely and be free from the fear of danger." 
Pro 2:1 My son, if you accept my words and store up my commands within you, 
Pro 2:2 listening closely to wisdom and directing your heart to understanding; 
Pro 2:3 furthermore, if you call out to insight and lift your voice to understanding,
Pro 2:4 if you seek it like silver and search for it like hidden treasure, 
Pro 2:5 then you will understand the fear of the LORD and discover the knowledge of God.
Pro 2:6 For the LORD gives wisdom; from His mouth come knowledge and understanding. 
Pro 2:7 He stores up success for the upright; He is a shield for those who live with integrity 
Pro 2:8 so that He may guard the paths of justice and protect the way of His loyal followers.
Pro 2:9 Then you will understand righteousness, justice, and integrity-- every good path.
Pro 2:10 For wisdom will enter your mind, and knowledge will delight your heart.
Pro 2:11 Discretion will watch over you, and understanding will guard you, 
Pro 2:12 rescuing you from the way of evil-- from the one who says perverse things,
Pro 2:13 from those who abandon the right paths to walk in ways of darkness, 
Pro 2:14 from those who enjoy doing evil and celebrate perversion, 
Pro 2:15 whose paths are crooked, and whose ways are devious. 
Pro 2:16 It will rescue you from a forbidden woman, from a stranger with her flattering talk,
Pro 2:17 who abandons the companion of her youth and forgets the covenant of her God; 
Pro 2:18 for her house sinks down to death and her ways to the land of the departed spirits.
Pro 2:19 None return who go to her; none reach the paths of life. 
Pro 2:20 So follow the way of good people, and keep to the paths of the righteous. 
Pro 2:21 For the upright will inhabit the land, and those of integrity will remain in it;
Pro 2:22 but the wicked will be cut off from the land, and the treacherous uprooted from it.
Pro 3:1 My son, don't forget my teaching, but let your heart keep my commands; 
Pro 3:2 for they will bring you many days, a full life, and well-being. 
Pro 3:3 Never let loyalty and faithfulness leave you. Tie them around your neck; write them on the tablet of your heart. 
Pro 3:4 Then you will find favor and high regard in the sight of God and man.
Pro 3:5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart, and do not rely on your own understanding; 
Pro 3:6 think about Him in all your ways, and He will guide you on the right paths. 
Pro 3:7 Don't consider yourself to be wise; fear the LORD and turn away from evil.
Pro 3:8 This will be healing for your body and strengthening for your bones. 
Pro 3:9 Honor the LORD with your possessions and with the first produce of your entire harvest; 
Pro 3:10 then your barns will be completely filled, and your vats will overflow with new wine. 
Pro 3:11 Do not despise the LORD's instruction, my son, and do not loathe His discipline; 
Pro 3:12 for the LORD disciplines the one He loves, just as a father, the son he delights in.
Pro 3:13 Happy is a man who finds wisdom and who acquires understanding, 
Pro 3:14 for she is more profitable than silver, and her revenue is better than gold. 
Pro 3:15 She is more precious than jewels; nothing you desire compares with her. 
Pro 3:16 Long life is in her right hand; in her left, riches and honor. 
Pro 3:17 Her ways are pleasant, and all her paths, peaceful. 
Pro 3:18 She is a tree of life to those who embrace her, and those who hold on to her are happy. 
Pro 3:19 The LORD founded the earth by wisdom and established the heavens by understanding. 
Pro 3:20 By His knowledge the watery depths broke open, and the clouds dripped with dew.
Pro 3:21 Maintain your competence and discretion. My son, don't lose sight of them. 
Pro 3:22 They will be life for you and adornment for your neck. 
Pro 3:23 Then you will go safely on your way; your foot will not stumble. 
Pro 3:24 When you lie down, you will not be afraid; you will lie down, and your sleep will be pleasant. 
Pro 3:25 Don't fear sudden danger or the ruin of the wicked when it comes, 
Pro 3:26 for the LORD will be your confidence and will keep your foot from a snare. 
Pro 3:27 When it is in your power, don't withhold good from the one it belongs to.
Pro 3:28 Don't say to your neighbor, "Go away! Come back later. I'll give it tomorrow"-- when it is there with you.
Pro 3:29 Don't plan any harm against your neighbor, for he trusts you and lives near you. 
Pro 3:30 Don't accuse anyone without cause, when he has done you no harm. 
Pro 3:31 Don't envy a violent man or choose any of his ways; 
Pro 3:32 for the devious are detestable to the LORD, but He is a friend to the upright. 
Pro 3:33 The LORD's curse is on the household of the wicked, but He blesses the home of the righteous; 
Pro 3:34 He mocks those who mock, but gives grace to the humble. 
Pro 3:35 The wise will inherit honor, but He holds up fools to dishonor. 
Pro 4:1 Listen, my sons, to a father's discipline, and pay attention so that you may gain understanding, 
Pro 4:2 for I am giving you good instruction. Don't abandon my teaching. 
Pro 4:3 When I was a son with my father, tender and precious to my mother,
Pro 4:4 he taught me and said: "Your heart must hold on to my words. Keep my commands and live. 
Pro 4:5 Get wisdom, get understanding; don't forget or turn away from the words of my mouth.
Pro 4:6 Don't abandon wisdom, and she will watch over you; love her, and she will guard you.
Pro 4:7 Wisdom is supreme-- so get wisdom. And whatever else you get, get understanding.
Pro 4:8 Cherish her, and she will exalt you; if you embrace her, she will honor you. 
Pro 4:9 She will place a garland of grace on your head; she will give you a crown of beauty." 
Pro 4:10 Listen, my son. Accept my words, and you will live many years. 
Pro 4:11 I am teaching you the way of wisdom; I am guiding you on straight paths. 
Pro 4:12 When you walk, your steps will not be hindered; when you run, you will not stumble. 
Pro 4:13 Hold on to instruction; don't let go. Guard it, for it is your life. 
Pro 4:14 Don't set foot on the path of the wicked; don't proceed in the way of evil ones.
Pro 4:15 Avoid it; don't travel on it. Turn away from it, and pass it by.
Pro 4:16 For they can't sleep unless they have done what is evil; they are robbed of sleep unless they make someone stumble. 
Pro 4:17 They eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence.
Pro 4:18 The path of the righteous is like the light of dawn, shining brighter and brighter until midday. 
Pro 4:19 But the way of the wicked is like the darkest gloom; they don't know what makes them stumble.
Pro 4:20 My son, pay attention to my words; listen closely to my sayings. 
Pro 4:21 Don't lose sight of them; keep them within your heart. 
Pro 4:22 For they are life to those who find them, and health to one's whole body.
Pro 4:23 Guard your heart above all else, for it is the source of life. 
Pro 4:24 Don't let your mouth speak dishonestly, and don't let your lips talk deviously. 
Pro 4:25 Let your eyes look forward; fix your gaze straight ahead. 
Pro 4:26 Carefully consider the path for your feet, and all your ways will be established. 
Pro 4:27 Don't turn to the right or to the left; keep your feet away from evil. 
Pro 5:1 My son, pay attention to my wisdom; listen closely to my understanding 
Pro 5:2 so that you may maintain discretion and your lips safeguard knowledge. 
Pro 5:3 Though the lips of the forbidden woman drip honey and her words are smoother than oil, 
Pro 5:4 in the end she's as bitter as wormwood and as sharp as a double-edged sword. 
Pro 5:5 Her feet go down to death; her steps head straight for Sheol. 
Pro 5:6 She doesn't consider the path of life; she doesn't know that her ways are unstable.
Pro 5:7 So now, my sons, listen to me, and don't turn away from the words of my mouth. 
Pro 5:8 Keep your way far from her. Don't go near the door of her house. 
Pro 5:9 Otherwise, you will give up your vitality to others and your years to someone cruel;
Pro 5:10 strangers will drain your resources, and your earnings will end up in a foreigner's house.
Pro 5:11 At the end of your life, you will lament when your physical body has been consumed,
Pro 5:12 and you will say, "How I hated discipline, and how my heart despised correction.
Pro 5:13 I didn't obey my teachers or listen closely to my mentors. 
Pro 5:14 I am on the verge of complete ruin before the entire community."
Pro 5:15 Drink water from your own cistern, water flowing from your own well. 
Pro 5:16 Should your springs flow in the streets, streams of water in the public squares?
Pro 5:17 They should be for you alone and not for you to share with strangers.
Pro 5:18 Let your fountain be blessed, and take pleasure in the wife of your youth. 
Pro 5:19 A loving doe, a graceful fawn-- let her breasts always satisfy you; be lost in her love forever.
Pro 5:20 Why, my son, would you be infatuated with a forbidden woman or embrace the breast of a stranger?
Pro 5:21 For a man's ways are before the LORD's eyes, and He considers all his paths. 
Pro 5:22 A wicked man's iniquities entrap him; he is entangled in the ropes of his own sin. 
Pro 5:23 He will die because there is no discipline, and be lost because of his great stupidity. 
Pro 6:1 My son, if you have put up security for your neighbor or entered into an agreement with a stranger, 
Pro 6:2 you have been trapped by the words of your lips-- ensnared by the words of your mouth.
Pro 6:3 Do this, then, my son, and free yourself, for you have put yourself in your neighbor's power: Go, humble yourself, and plead with your neighbor.
Pro 6:4 Don't give sleep to your eyes or slumber to your eyelids. 
Pro 6:5 Escape like a gazelle from a hunter, like a bird from a fowler's trap. 
Pro 6:6 Go to the ant, you slacker! Observe its ways and become wise. 
Pro 6:7 Without leader, administrator, or ruler,
Pro 6:8 it prepares its provisions in summer; it gathers its food during harvest. 
Pro 6:9 How long will you stay in bed, you slacker? When will you get up from your sleep?
Pro 6:10 A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the arms to rest, 
Pro 6:11 and your poverty will come like a robber, your need, like a bandit. 
Pro 6:12 A worthless person, a wicked man goes around speaking dishonestly,
Pro 6:13 winking his eyes, signaling with his feet, and gesturing with his fingers. 
Pro 6:14 He always plots evil with perversity in his heart-- he stirs up trouble.
Pro 6:15 Therefore calamity will strike him suddenly; he will be shattered instantly-- beyond recovery.
Pro 6:16 The LORD hates six things; in fact, seven are detestable to Him:
Pro 6:17 arrogant eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood,
Pro 6:18 a heart that plots wicked schemes, feet eager to run to evil,
Pro 6:19 a lying witness who gives false testimony, and one who stirs up trouble among brothers. 
Pro 6:20 My son, keep your father's command, and don't reject your mother's teaching. 
Pro 6:21 Always bind them to your heart; tie them around your neck. 
Pro 6:22 When you walk here and there, they will guide you; when you lie down, they will watch over you; when you wake up, they will talk to you.
Pro 6:23 For a command is a lamp, teaching is a light, and corrective discipline is the way to life. 
Pro 6:24 They will protect you from an evil woman, from the flattering tongue of a stranger. 
Pro 6:25 Don't lust in your heart for her beauty or let her captivate you with her eyelashes. 
Pro 6:26 For a prostitute's fee is only a loaf of bread, but an adulteress goes after a precious life. 
Pro 6:27 Can a man embrace fire and his clothes not be burned? 
Pro 6:28 Can a man walk on burning coals without scorching his feet?
Pro 6:29 So it is with the one who sleeps with another man's wife; no one who touches her will go unpunished. 
Pro 6:30 People don't despise the thief if he steals to satisfy himself when he is hungry. 
Pro 6:31 Still, if caught, he must pay seven times as much; he must give up all the wealth in his house. 
Pro 6:32 The one who commits adultery lacks sense; whoever does so destroys himself. 
Pro 6:33 He will get a beating and dishonor, and his disgrace will never be removed. 
Pro 6:34 For jealousy enrages a husband, and he will show no mercy when he takes revenge. 
Pro 6:35 He will not be appeased by anything or be persuaded by lavish gifts.
Pro 7:1 My son, obey my words, and treasure my commands. 
Pro 7:2 Keep my commands and live; protect my teachings as the pupil of your eye. 
Pro 7:3 Tie them to your fingers; write them on the tablet of your heart. 
Pro 7:4 Say to wisdom, "You are my sister," and call understanding your relative. 
Pro 7:5 She will keep you from a forbidden woman, a stranger with her flattering talk. 
Pro 7:6 At the window of my house I looked through my lattice. 
Pro 7:7 I saw among the inexperienced, I noticed among the youths, a young man lacking sense. 
Pro 7:8 Crossing the street near her corner, he strolled down the road to her house
Pro 7:9 at twilight, in the evening, in the dark of the night. 
Pro 7:10 A woman came to meet him dressed like a prostitute, having a hidden agenda. 
Pro 7:11 She is loud and defiant; her feet do not stay at home. 
Pro 7:12 Now in the street, now in the squares, she lurks at every corner. 
Pro 7:13 She grabs him and kisses him; she brazenly says to him, 
Pro 7:14 "I've made fellowship offerings; today I've fulfilled my vows.
Pro 7:15 So I came out to meet you, to search for you, and I've found you.
Pro 7:16 I've spread coverings on my bed-- richly colored linen from Egypt.
Pro 7:17 I've perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon. 
Pro 7:18 Come, let's drink deeply of lovemaking until morning. Let's feast on each other's love! 
Pro 7:19 My husband isn't home; he went on a long journey.
Pro 7:20 He took a bag of money with him and will come home at the time of the full moon."
Pro 7:21 She seduces him with her persistent pleading; she lures with her flattering talk. 
Pro 7:22 He follows her impulsively like an ox going to the slaughter, like a deer bounding toward a trap 
Pro 7:23 until an arrow pierces its liver, like a bird darting into a snare-- he doesn't know it will cost him his life.
Pro 7:24 Now, my sons, listen to me, and pay attention to the words of my mouth.
Pro 7:25 Don't let your heart turn aside to her ways; don't stray onto her paths. 
Pro 7:26 For she has brought many down to death; her victims are countless. 
Pro 7:27 Her house is the road to Sheol, descending to the chambers of death. 
Pro 8:1 Doesn't Wisdom call out? Doesn't Understanding make her voice heard? 
Pro 8:2 At the heights overlooking the road, at the crossroads, she takes her stand.
Pro 8:3 Beside the gates at the entry to the city, at the main entrance, she cries out: 
Pro 8:4 "People, I call out to you; my cry is to mankind.
Pro 8:5 Learn to be shrewd, you who are inexperienced; develop common sense, you who are foolish.
Pro 8:6 Listen, for I speak of noble things, and what my lips say is right.
Pro 8:7 For my mouth tells the truth, and wickedness is detestable to my lips. 
Pro 8:8 All the words of my mouth are righteous; none of them are deceptive or perverse. 
Pro 8:9 All of them are clear to the perceptive, and right to those who discover knowledge. 
Pro 8:10 Accept my instruction instead of silver, and knowledge rather than pure gold. 
Pro 8:11 For wisdom is better than jewels, and nothing desirable can compare with it.
Pro 8:12 I, Wisdom, share a home with shrewdness and have knowledge and discretion.
Pro 8:13 To fear the LORD is to hate evil. I hate arrogant pride, evil conduct, and perverse speech. 
Pro 8:14 I possess good advice and competence; I have understanding and strength. 
Pro 8:15 It is by me that kings reign and rulers enact just law; 
Pro 8:16 by me, princes lead, as do nobles and all righteous judges. 
Pro 8:17 I love those who love me, and those who search for me find me. 
Pro 8:18 With me are riches and honor, lasting wealth and righteousness. 
Pro 8:19 My fruit is better than solid gold, and my harvest than pure silver. 
Pro 8:20 I walk in the way of righteousness, along the paths of justice,
Pro 8:21 giving wealth as an inheritance to those who love me, and filling their treasuries.
Pro 8:22 The LORD made me at the beginning of His creation, before His works of long ago.
Pro 8:23 I was formed before ancient times, from the beginning, before the earth began.
Pro 8:24 I was born when there were no watery depths and no springs filled with water.
Pro 8:25 I was delivered before the mountains and hills were established, 
Pro 8:26 before He made the land, the fields, or the first soil on earth.
Pro 8:27 I was there when He established the heavens, when He laid out the horizon on the surface of the ocean, 
Pro 8:28 when He placed the skies above, when the fountains of the ocean gushed out,
Pro 8:29 when He set a limit for the sea so that the waters would not violate His command, when He laid out the foundations of the earth. 
Pro 8:30 I was a skilled craftsman beside Him. I was His delight every day, always rejoicing before Him. 
Pro 8:31 I was rejoicing in His inhabited world, delighting in the human race. 
Pro 8:32 And now, my sons, listen to me; those who keep my ways are happy. 
Pro 8:33 Listen to instruction and be wise; don't ignore it. 
Pro 8:34 Anyone who listens to me is happy, watching at my doors every day, waiting by the posts of my doorway. 
Pro 8:35 For the one who finds me finds life and obtains favor from the LORD, 
Pro 8:36 but the one who misses me harms himself; all who hate me love death." 
Pro 9:1 Wisdom has built her house; she has carved out her seven pillars.
Pro 9:2 She has prepared her meat; she has mixed her wine; she has also set her table. 
Pro 9:3 She has sent out her female servants; she calls out from the highest points of the city: 
Pro 9:4 "Whoever is inexperienced, enter here!" To the one who lacks sense, she says, 
Pro 9:5 "Come, eat my bread, and drink the wine I have mixed. 
Pro 9:6 Leave inexperience behind, and you will live; pursue the way of understanding.
Pro 9:7 The one who corrects a mocker will bring dishonor on himself; the one who rebukes a wicked man will get hurt. 
Pro 9:8 Don't rebuke a mocker, or he will hate you; rebuke a wise man, and he will love you. 
Pro 9:9 Instruct a wise man, and he will be wiser still; teach a righteous man, and he will learn more. 
Pro 9:10 "The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding. 
Pro 9:11 For by Wisdom your days will be many, and years will be added to your life.
Pro 9:12 If you are wise, you are wise for your own benefit; if you mock, you alone will bear the consequences." 
Pro 9:13 The woman Folly is rowdy; she is gullible and knows nothing. 
Pro 9:14 She sits by the doorway of her house, on a seat at the highest point of the city,
Pro 9:15 calling to those who pass by, who go straight ahead on their paths: 
Pro 9:16 "Whoever is inexperienced, enter here!" To the one who lacks sense, she says,
Pro 9:17 "Stolen water is sweet, and bread eaten secretly is tasty!" 
Pro 9:18 But he doesn't know that the departed spirits are there, that her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
Pro 10:1 Solomon's proverbs: A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish son, heartache to his mother. 
Pro 10:2 Ill-gotten gains do not profit anyone, but righteousness rescues from death. 
Pro 10:3 The LORD will not let the righteous go hungry, but He denies the wicked what they crave. 
Pro 10:4 Idle hands make one poor, but diligent hands bring riches. 
Pro 10:5 The son who gathers during summer is prudent; the son who sleeps during harvest is disgraceful. 
Pro 10:6 Blessings are on the head of the righteous, but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence. 
Pro 10:7 The remembrance of the righteous is a blessing, but the name of the wicked will rot. 
Pro 10:8 A wise heart accepts commands, but foolish lips will be destroyed. 
Pro 10:9 The one who lives with integrity lives securely, but whoever perverts his ways will be found out.
Pro 10:10 A sly wink of the eye causes grief, and foolish lips will be destroyed. 
Pro 10:11 The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life, but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
Pro 10:12 Hatred stirs up conflicts, but love covers all offenses. 
Pro 10:13 Wisdom is found on the lips of the discerning, but a rod is for the back of the one who lacks sense. 
Pro 10:14 The wise store up knowledge, but the mouth of the fool hastens destruction. 
Pro 10:15 A rich man's wealth is his fortified city; the poverty of the poor is their destruction. 
Pro 10:16 The labor of the righteous leads to life; the activity of the wicked leads to sin. 
Pro 10:17 The one who follows instruction is on the path to life, but the one who rejects correction goes astray. 
Pro 10:18 The one who conceals hatred has lying lips, and whoever spreads slander is a fool. 
Pro 10:19 When there are many words, sin is unavoidable, but the one who controls his lips is wise. 
Pro 10:20 The tongue of the righteous is pure silver; the heart of the wicked is of little value. 
Pro 10:21 The lips of the righteous feed many, but fools die for lack of sense. 
Pro 10:22 The LORD's blessing enriches, and struggle adds nothing to it. 
Pro 10:23 As shameful conduct is pleasure for a fool, so wisdom is for a man of understanding.
Pro 10:24 What the wicked dreads will come to him, but what the righteous desire will be given to them. 
Pro 10:25 When the whirlwind passes, the wicked are no more, but the righteous are secure forever. 
Pro 10:26 Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, so the slacker is to the one who sends him on an errand. 
Pro 10:27 The fear of the LORD prolongs life, but the years of the wicked are cut short. 
Pro 10:28 The hope of the righteous is joy, but the expectation of the wicked comes to nothing. 
Pro 10:29 The way of the LORD is a stronghold for the honorable, but destruction awaits the malicious. 
Pro 10:30 The righteous will never be shaken, but the wicked will not remain on the earth. 
Pro 10:31 The mouth of the righteous produces wisdom, but a perverse tongue will be cut out. 
Pro 10:32 The lips of the righteous know what is appropriate, but the mouth of the wicked, only what is perverse. 
Pro 11:1 Dishonest scales are detestable to the LORD, but an accurate weight is His delight. 
Pro 11:2 When pride comes, disgrace follows, but with humility comes wisdom. 
Pro 11:3 The integrity of the upright guides them, but the perversity of the treacherous destroys them. 
Pro 11:4 Wealth is not profitable on a day of wrath, but righteousness rescues from death. 
Pro 11:5 The righteousness of the blameless clears his path, but the wicked person will fall because of his wickedness.
Pro 11:6 The righteousness of the upright rescues them, but the treacherous are trapped by their own desires. 
Pro 11:7 When the wicked man dies, his expectation comes to nothing, and hope placed in wealth vanishes. 
Pro 11:8 The righteous one is rescued from trouble; in his place, the wicked one goes in. 
Pro 11:9 With his mouth the ungodly destroys his neighbor, but through knowledge the righteous are rescued.
Pro 11:10 When the righteous thrive, a city rejoices, and when the wicked die, there is joyful shouting. 
Pro 11:11 A city is built up by the blessing of the upright, but it is torn down by the mouth of the wicked. 
Pro 11:12 Whoever shows contempt for his neighbor lacks sense, but a man with understanding keeps silent.
Pro 11:13 A gossip goes around revealing a secret, but a trustworthy person keeps a confidence. 
Pro 11:14 Without guidance, people fall, but with many counselors there is deliverance. 
Pro 11:15 If someone puts up security for a stranger, he will suffer for it, but the one who hates such agreements is protected. 
Pro 11:16 A gracious woman gains honor, but violent men gain only riches.
Pro 11:17 A kind man benefits himself, but a cruel man brings disaster on himself. 
Pro 11:18 The wicked man earns an empty wage, but the one who sows righteousness, a true reward. 
Pro 11:19 Genuine righteousness leads to life, but pursuing evil leads to death. 
Pro 11:20 Those with twisted minds are detestable to the LORD, but those with blameless conduct are His delight. 
Pro 11:21 Be assured that the wicked will not go unpunished, but the offspring of the righteous will escape. 
Pro 11:22 A beautiful woman who rejects good sense is like a gold ring in a pig's snout. 
Pro 11:23 The desire of the righteous turns out well, but the hope of the wicked leads to wrath. 
Pro 11:24 One person gives freely, yet gains more; another withholds what is right, only to become poor. 
Pro 11:25 A generous person will be enriched, and the one who gives a drink of water will receive water. 
Pro 11:26 People will curse anyone who hoards grain, but a blessing will come to the one who sells it. 
Pro 11:27 The one who searches for what is good finds favor, but if someone looks for trouble, it will come to him. 
Pro 11:28 Anyone trusting in his riches will fall, but the righteous will flourish like foliage. 
Pro 11:29 The one who brings ruin on his household will inherit the wind, and a fool will be a slave to someone whose heart is wise. 
Pro 11:30 The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, but violence takes lives. 
Pro 11:31 If the righteous will be repaid on earth, how much more the wicked and sinful. 
Pro 12:1 Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge, but one who hates correction is stupid. 
Pro 12:2 The good person obtains favor from the LORD, but He condemns a man who schemes. 
Pro 12:3 Man cannot be made secure by wickedness, but the root of the righteous is immovable. 
Pro 12:4 A capable wife is her husband's crown, but a wife who causes shame is like rottenness in his bones. 
Pro 12:5 The thoughts of the righteous are just, but guidance from the wicked leads to deceit.
Pro 12:6 The words of the wicked are a deadly ambush, but the speech of the upright rescues them. 
Pro 12:7 The wicked are overthrown and perish, but the house of the righteous will stand. 
Pro 12:8 A man is praised for his insight, but a twisted mind is despised.
Pro 12:9 Better to be dishonored, yet have a servant, than to act important but have no food. 
Pro 12:10 A righteous man cares about his animal's health, but even the merciful acts of the wicked are cruel. 
Pro 12:11 The one who works his land will have plenty of food, but whoever chases fantasies lacks sense. 
Pro 12:12 The wicked desire what evil men have, but the root of the righteous produces fruit. 
Pro 12:13 An evil man is trapped by his rebellious speech, but a righteous one escapes from trouble. 
Pro 12:14 A man will be satisfied with good by the words of his mouth, and the work of a man's hands will reward him. 
Pro 12:15 A fool's way is right in his own eyes, but whoever listens to counsel is wise.
